userReviewOnlyContent:
What a wonderful way to start the year! This was my second time back to HIGH END SPA, and we had a great time. The crowds were very low (seriously, it felt like we had the place to ourselves most of the day.) We walked right into the mineral baths, club mud, and didn't wait in any kind of line for lunch. None of the pools were crowded, and we were even able to enjoy one of the hammocks in the secret garden.

Tiffany at the front check-in desk went above and beyond for us regarding the robes. I had requested a plus-sized robe, since after my last review I knew they had added some to their collection. Unfortunately, all of their plus-sized robes were still dirty from the day before. Tiffany was so accommodating, though! She was able to get us robes from the cabana area that fit me perfectly! It is so great to know that not only do they now offer guests of all sizes the option to enjoy a warm robe, but that they really want to make sure you have a good day. Thank you, Tiffany, for everything.

All of the staff today were in good spirits. The only thing that would have made today better would have been a massage. We'll have to book one next time. My husband and I are going to make HIGH END SPA our annual New Year's Day tradition!
businessReplyContent:
Amber P. of HIGH END SPA Hot Springs

Business Customer Service

1/2/20191/15/2018-
Hi Michelle, HIGH END SPA is proud to welcome men and women of all shapes and sizes. In response to your day, we are now in the process of ordering a few XL robes so we can continue to have offerings for all of our guests.  I wanted to reach out to you to let you know we have sent you a private message as we would like to connect with you directly. Thank you again for communicating your concern with us.
Alexa Gallegos

1/2/2019 -

Hi Michelle,
I am so happy to hear that you had a great returning experience! Our team members do the best they can to accommodate all of our guests needs and we are very glad to hear you were happy with the solution.
We hope to see you and your husband again!

Best,
Amber Peyghambari

It's too bad, I had such a great time here and some bathroom attendant ruined my whole experience!! Just the worst manners and let's just say customer service was not her specialty or even close.
This young girl had some nerve to correct a customer for accidentally missing the trash with some paper from a cinco de mayo mustache.. (jokes) she chases after me to tell me to throw it in the trash I explained half way down the hall I was sorry and had to
LeAve, my friend was sick and need me to tend to her. She then chased me down again and started to harass me to tell her where my friend threw up. Really? Well, maybe she had a bad day.. but after explaining what happen to management and the front office,  Jose, the manager, didn't look too surprised.. I guess this is normal behavior for her.. needless to say I'm almost afraid to go back. I may not hold my tongue next time.. personal space was not In her vocabulary she tapped me on the shoulder, she's lucky i was in a great mood till then..

userReviewOnlyContent: Went to  for acupuncture as I was past due in my pregnancy and heard acupuncture could help induce labor. I was scheduled for medical induction in a week and wanted to avoid it. My appointment went well, about 22 needles at my first appointment. From the second needle on the baby started moving so I could tell that he knew the right triggerpoints. I ended up making a second appointment two days later. I went into labor that night. The only reason for a one star knock off was even by my second appointment they hadn't looked into my insurance benefits. And now it's been two weeks later and I still haven't heard from them re if my insurance covered anything. Not a huge deal because the appointments were affordable but from a customer service standpoint I had to point that out.

businessReplyContent:
R. of CHIROPRACTIC Chiropractic Spa

Business Owner

1/8/2018Hello Laura I?m sorry to hear of your experience. Our staff understood when you called that you were canceling a service for later that same day. We do have a same day cancel (less than 24 hours notice) fee for massage appointments and all patients are notified of this in our financial policies paperwork and required to initial understanding of the policy. We understand that unfortunate circumstances can arise from time to time, which is why we waive 1 same day cancellation in a 12 month period at ?no charge?.  

You are correct that there is no charge to cancel or reschedule with advanced notice (more than 24 hours). We have reached out to you a couple of times since Saturday and look forward to clearing this up with you. Our staff has been counseled on how to avoid this type of miscommunication in the future.

userReviewOnlyContent:
The DOCTOR fixed a knee issue I had. For his medical expertise, A+!

However, when I asked DOCTOR some questions, he would answer them. Then I would attempt to ask a  up question and he would hold up a finger and shush me by saying, "I'm not finished." --- O.o lol What the heck? Oh excuse me sir, I thought this was a conversation. Ha.

He was great majority of the time except for that. It really irked me and put me off. I was trying to ask questions to help my healing process.

Another issue was that the front desk staff needs to realize to LOOK UP FROM THE FRONT DESK and say HELLOOOOOO to people. The whole purpose of having a *FRONT* desk is so that the first thing customers see are these people. If they didn't feel like they needed to say hello to people when they first walk in, then put the desk in the BACK since the whole purpose of a FRONT desk was not being put to good use. It's cold and feels put-offish. There was ONE girl who would say hello to me. I forgot her name but she's brunette and was super nice. When the other girls simply ignored me when I walked it, it felt snobbish and cold. That's probably not their intention but they need to realize that is the vibe they give off when they are too good to look up. -__-

I would recommend this chiropractor because medically, DOCTOR is great!!!! However, the customer service needs help. =)

It's cold and feels put-offish. There was ONE girl who would say hello to me. I forgot her name but she's brunette and was super nice. When the other girls simply ignored me when I walked it, it felt snobbish and cold. That's probably not their intention but they need to realize that is the vibe they give off when they are too good to look up. -__-

I would recommend this chiropractor because medically, DOCTOR is great!!!! However, the customer service needs help. =)

userReviewContent:
6/5/2018Updated review
 6 photos

 2 check-ins

Another fabulous trip to HIGH END SPA! Love the new addition in the back with rocking chairs under beautiful trees! This place is growing faster than it can hardly keep up with - went on a Monday thinking it won't be as crowded and wow! It felt like a weekend! I'm hoping they will expand kitchen and help as it takes about 40 minutes to wait in line around the lunch hour to get food. It's all prepared fresh though and I appreciate that.

Been going here for over 27 years. I've seen all the growth and change. It's been bumpy and they are ironing out the kinks. Love the new bar - prob could use another one on other end of spa. I understand they are talking expansion though and even building a resort. I only hope it doesn't take away the private feel of this place. The area inside Starbucks (long hallway) seems like wasted space. Hardly anyone in there. Food was good, try the fish tacos (although I think they told me shells were gluten free and I'm certain they are not) and so were the beverages. Overall a relaxing day and I'd recommend if you want to get away. Get there early to claim a spot- it can get crowded and they do hit max occupancy on holidays and some weekends. Get on email list to purchase gift card deals when they offer them- it's definitely the way to go and they don't expire I'm told.

userReviewOnlyContent:
My boyfriend took me here for my birthday this past weekend and it was absolutely divine. We got a canopy (Palm date one) - perfect for two and in the corner of a small jacuzzi. To start our morning at After a tasteful breakfast, we had an appointment for a massage at We then headed over to our canopy to relax and get ready to take a dip in the salt baths and mud baths. One star off for the crowd. We went on a Saturday in January and I was just taken aback by how many people there were in the pools and just in general. It takes away from the experience for me since I'm there to get away from people and relax but there was just so many people in the way. I really enjoyed the mud bath and took advantage of it and exfoliated my entire body including my face! There is a sauna room to stay in after you put the mud all over your body and then a shower you can wash the mud off at afterwards. They provide you with a ary eucalyptus body wash which smells heavenly!

Our second scheduled service was the grotto which is an underground cave experience where they paint you with a mixture of coconut oil, Shea butter, lavender & eucalyptus oil and aloe Vera! You then can hang out for as long as you like then take a shower underground too. There are complementary tea and fruits in the last room after you clean off. I think this service is an added $This experience left us hungry so we head back o our canopy and ordered the bbq chicken flat bread! So delicious :)

Finally, to end our day.. we soaked in the mineral baths and had our last scheduled service: facials. Ahhh my favorite guilty pleasure. I get facials on a monthly basis so I know what is good or not. Unfortunately I did not enjoy my facial here. They use gloves and barely do any extractions. The effort and pressure just wasn't there. Everything was mediocre including the ambiance of the room. Lights were too bright so it did not provide a comfortable experience. I had to ask the lady to dim the lights. At the end of the facial, she put tinted moisturizer on me but it was so uneven and she blamed it on the dim lighting.. she had to take it off and just put on clear spf for me. It was the worse facial I gotten. To top it off, they try to upsell you on products after which is annoying. I would not use this service again if I were to return.

Overall it was a fun, relaxing time! It flew by sooo quickly. Next time I will try to just stay at my canopy more and go to all the different pools. I would skip out on the grotto and the facial and just get a massage :)
businessReplyContent:
Amber P. of HIGH END SPA Hot Springs

Business Customer Service

2/7/2019Hi Kim, We're so glad you enjoyed your birthday with us. It sounds like you were here right before we closed the Grotto for renovations. Thank you again for taking the time to write and we're looking forward to seeing  you again soon.

My boyfriend took me here for my birthday this past weekend and it was absolutely divine. We got a canopy (Palm date one) - perfect for two and in the corner of a small jacuzzi. To start our morning at 9am, we ordered the superfood omelette which is all veggies including kale, shirtsleeves, mushrooms and avocados. It was surprisingly really delicious and a great way to start our morning.

After a tasteful breakfast, we had an appointment for a massage at 10. Oh my gosh, BEST massage ever! I get a lot of massages and hands down, the massages here are magical. I believe I got Cheri who was very knowledgeable and educated me on different types of stretches for back pain, and taught me where the pressure points were. I wish it was longer but my boyfriend only booked the 50 min one. Next time, I hope to get one for at least two hours! My boyfriend really enjoyed his too.

We then headed over to our canopy to relax and get ready to take a dip in the salt baths and mud baths. One star off for the crowd. We went on a Saturday in January and I was just taken aback by how many people there were in the pools and just in general. It takes away from the experience for me since I'm there to get away from people and relax but there was just so many people in the way. I really enjoyed the mud bath and took advantage of it and exfoliated my entire body including my face! There is a sauna room to stay in after you put the mud all over your body and then a shower you can wash the mud off at afterwards. They provide you with a ary eucalyptus body wash which smells heavenly!

Our second scheduled service was the grotto which is an underground cave experience where they paint you with a mixture of coconut oil, Shea butter, lavender & eucalyptus oil and aloe Vera! You then can hang out for as long as you like then take a shower underground too. There are complementary tea and fruits in the last room after you clean off. I think this service is an added $175/ person which is pricey for what you get but it's worth trying once and one time only. My skin did feel very moisturized after.

This experience left us hungry so we head back o our canopy and ordered the bbq chicken flat bread! So delicious :)

Finally, to end our day.. we soaked in the mineral baths and had our last scheduled service: facials. Ahhh my favorite guilty pleasure. I get facials on a monthly basis so I know what is good or not. userReviewOnlyContent: This was my first visit for acupuncture. I was very disappointed that Dr. Bong didn't even bother to review my medical history. He he had none of my paperwork. He did not use rubbing alcohol for every single needle insertion point, only a few. He did not explain the procedure he was going to use on me. He ended up doing dry cupping which was fine but he did not even bother to tell me that that was what he was going to do. I was already face down when he started.  He did not say how long the needles would be in or how long he would allow me to lay down and relax. All of that is so different from what I'm used to. Also the room they put me in it was so loud. I could hear the cackling laughter of the employees, the constant ringing of the phone and beeping of the door sensor. Overall it was just a very chaotic experience. They clearly have too much going on to make it a relaxing environment.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Imagine planning a family event for the last three months only to be greeted by list of restrictions upon restrictions. I was excited to spend the day at HIGH END SPA and expected to hear Warm water greetings of "Good morning, thank you for choosing HIGH END SPA, on behalf of our staff, we hope you enjoy your day here."

That greeting was never heard, ever. I initially reserved and paid for the BambooCabana for I tried to explain to Robert the email exchanges of what was told to me, but he was not going to hear anything I said. He stated that the email had to go through him and he had to approve everything and was not informed. So, HIGH END SPA's miscommunication  was misdirected towards me and my group.

Robert also said that we were placed in another poolside cabana and I had to move my car. I corrected him by showing my email confirmation and instead of apologizing for any confusion, he brushed it off. He was smug the entire time I was trying to explain what I understood. It didn't matter to him because he is the manager is always right, and customers are not and should be told so.

We shook it off and the day went by fine, as Asia and Jasson took care of us in a friendly and professional fashion. We all appreciated their attentiveness when they were around. We also ordered food from the cafeteria and several bars in the resort (as we didn't expect a personal attendant at all times). The group spend most of the time lounging in different pools so cabanas were used only as a quick stop to eat, drink and getting out of the sun.

At We were not noisy, we didn't play music, we didn't bring outside food or alcohol, we didn't use foul language, we weren't inappropriately dressed. We were just sitting on the edge of a lounge chair. I asked Robert "where's the demarcation between cabana and cabana and non cabana, if there was an actual border and lines to be crossed" He informed me that there wasn't . But again, he threatened that he can charge me $What was suppose to be a celebration of family and a relaxing day ended up being a huge disappointment. Instead of fond memories of our family day in the mud, it's scarred by Robert's smugness and militant demeanor.  

We asked to speak to someone other than Robert, he told us that there was "no one higher up" than he; however Jason came out to LISTEN. He didn't blame anyone, he just listen and agreed that things could have turned out different and positively.

HIGH END SPA, you got a good thing going. I loved the place, the sense of peace and relaxation. I've been going there for However, the combative and insensitive treatment we received from Robert was uncalled for and doesn't bode well for the image of HIGH END SPA. He needs to be placed in another position that's non "hospitality." He is the main reason why I wrote this review.  Extremely unprofessional, uncaring, unwillingly to listen, unwillingly to find a common ground. I won't return nor recommend HIGH END SPA because of this experience.
userReviewContent:
1/11/2020Updated review
 3 photos

Imagine planning a family event for the last three months only to be greeted by list of restrictions upon restrictions. I was excited to spend the day at HIGH END SPA and expected to hear Warm water greetings of "Good morning, thank you for choosing HIGH END SPA, on behalf of our staff, we hope you enjoy your day here."

That greeting was never heard, ever. I initially reserved and paid for the BambooCabana for 8-10ppl @($400/day). Unfortunately HIGH END SPA couldn't get that for us because we changed dates but asked if we wanted 2 poolside cabana ($200/per cabana= same cost).  Totally fine .. just as long we can be together. I was totally upfront with the guest list indicating all guest-- not trying to cheat the system at all. Well, upon arriving we were told that we can't do a lot of things "we won't serve people in your party that exceeds the cabanas (4ppl) and you can't step into the cabana area".

I tried to explain to Robert the email exchanges of what was told to me, but he was not going to hear anything I said. He stated that the email had to go through him and he had to approve everything and was not informed. So, HIGH END SPA's miscommunication  was misdirected towards me and my group.

Robert also said that we were placed in another poolside cabana and I had to move my car. I corrected him by showing my email confirmation and instead of apologizing for any confusion, he brushed it off. He was smug the entire time I was trying to explain what I understood. It didn't matter to him because he is the manager is always right, and customers are not and should be told so.

We shook it off and the day went by fine, as Asia and Jasson took care of us in a friendly and professional fashion. We all appreciated their attentiveness when they were around. We also ordered food from the cafeteria and several bars in the resort (as we didn't expect a personal attendant at all times). The group spend most of the time lounging in different pools so cabanas were used only as a quick stop to eat, drink and getting out of the sun.

At 5pm, a lot of people left and the day was getting quieter. We wanted to try the evening menu and ordered from a different server My, who proceeded to count heads in the cabana. We were told that we couldn't sit on an empty lounge chair in front of the 3rd cabana (that was mistakenly assigned to us earlier in the day--no one ever showed up/ it was zipped closed). My sister was told that she couldn't even sit on the edge of a lounge chair just to get out of the sun. The whole area was EMPTY. Are you kidding?! Robert came out reading the riot act saying that he could charge me another $200 for the day because my sister was sitting on the edge of the lounge chair in an area that was EMPTY. He reminded me that he had all our cards on file and that he could call security to have us removed.

We were not noisy, we didn't play music, we didn't bring outside food or alcohol, we didn't use foul language, we weren't inappropriately dressed. We were just sitting on the edge of a lounge chair. I asked Robert "where's the demarcation between cabana and cabana and non cabana, if there was an actual border and lines to be crossed" He informed me that there wasn't . But again, he threatened that he can charge me $200 for sitting on the EDGE of a lounge chair in an area that was EMPTY. He reiterated that several times.

What was suppose to be a celebration of family and a relaxing day ended up being a huge disappointment. Instead of fond memories of our family day in the mud, it's scarred by Robert's smugness and militant demeanor.  

We asked to speak to someone other than Robert, he told us that there was "no one higher up" than he; however Jason came out to LISTEN. He didn't blame anyone, he just listen and agreed that things could have turned out different and positively.

HIGH END SPA, you got a good thing going. I loved the place, the sense of peace and relaxation. I've been going there for 25+ years.. always a good experience.  Food is delicious and reasonably priced, atmosphere and landscape upkeep still lush and beautiful with great improvement and expansions. Belle and Nisha in the front, thank you for making us feel welcomed.

However, the combative and insensitive treatment we received from Robert was uncalled for and doesn't bode well for the image of HIGH END SPA. He needs to be placed in another position that's non "hospitality." He is the main reason why I wrote this review.  Extremely unprofessional, uncaring, unwillingly to listen, unwillingly to find a common ground. I won't return nor recommend HIGH END SPA because of this experience.

userReviewOnlyContent:
LOW COST GROCERY STORE Foods is absolutely awesome! I always seen this grocery store here and there but never really thought about going in and shop around for groceries.

Since I work nearby a LOW COST GROCERY STORE I decided to give it a try and go grocery shopping after work instead of going to my normal stores. When I went inside they I didn't really realize how big it was until I went pass their front isle and I must say the store is pretty big.

They have a huge selections of produce and items and snacks. Sometimes they have stuff on sale where it's cheaper than some store and sometimes they have the prices about the same. You do get lots of stuff cheaper at the store than you would at your other grocery store such as staters or Albertsons. They have sections for vegans and vegetarians and also meat lovers. They also have all kinds of stuff from bathroom supplies, kitchen supplies, all the way to medical and toys.

This is my number one go to store when I need to do some grocery shopping. I live about 7 miles away from here but it's always worth the drive when I need stuff for a good price.

userReviewOnlyContent:
DOCTOR is great and gives really good adjustments. But I would strongly recommend not getting a prenatal massage here. It's cheap, but you get what you pay for. The tables are rock hard and after laying on my side for an hour, my hips and shoulders were sorer than when I came in. She also didn't ask where I needed her to focus so just did her own thing with very little pressure or relief. And I'm not sure if it's the pregnancy hormones, but it really grossed me out to have her lightly rub (there was zero pressure and my feet are killing me!!) my one foot and then have me flip over on my side and rub my face. Next time I'll just add on the extra foot massage when I get a pedicure because those are way more relaxing and more pressure.
Thanks for reaching out so quickly, CHIROPRACTIC. I look forward to coming again and trying another massage, using the proper pregnancy setup

userReviewOnlyContent: As a serious consumer I ultimately love saving money on high cost expenditures in our household. Food has gone up so much over the last 2 years so I needed a change. Switching  to LOW COST GROCERY STORE has saved me at least $250 month comparatively to shopping at the local market. With the savings  I can take my kids camping, to baseball games, and other family activities. LOW COST GROCERY STORE has a large selection of grocery items. We are healthy eaters and love making home made meals every night. This is the perfect place to stock up on healthy foods and the green labeled price tags offer extra unbelievable savings. The stores are super clean. The staff are always friendly. The shelves are well stocked everyday. Try it out, you'll love it too. I can fill a cart for less than $200. Even our snobby friends shop at this store. The savings can add up to a car payment.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Absolutely would avoid. My friend REALLy wanted to come here so we went, but quickly it went downhill.

I'll start with the Pro since it's short. The Club Mud was cool.

The rest are cons. Remember that I'm here on a weekday in the off season.
- the grotto is $30 extra
- crap nachos to share are $30, drinks $15/drink and are pre mixed, weak
- the mineral baths are very small and are absolutely packed (again, on the off-season, on a weekday)
- the mini pools were all super packed by 11am as well
- we were told to make a reservation and pre pay so we did. Guess what, you wait in line anyway! The line is akin to a Vegas nightclub. They even section off the line and "allow" people to check in only as they see others leave. It's insane.
- after you check in you go to the bathhouse and change, which is so inefficiently setup all the girls flow in and out of the same tiny doorway. Non stop traffic jam.
- you then are told to put a credit card of file for drinks. Fine. But then they tell you to go to yet another location, carrying your DL, to get a wristband to go to yet another location to actually get a drink. All while having to carry your drivers license around a water park. So stupid. All this could be solved at checkin checking IDs and giving wrist bands.
- overall the entire thing is akin to a water park. Maps everywhere. Extremely loud and packed. Nowhere to relax and unwind.  
Would absolutely never return

userReviewOnlyContent: I spent 25 years in the bar/restaurant industry, so I know food and managing a team to serve it. LOW COST GROCERY STORE is unrivaled in the grocery industry in SoCal, their prices nearly across the board are cheaper than any store, Vons, Albertsons, even Smart & Final which used to be a restaurateurs secret... take your pick. The produce is always fresh, and there are always great sales...98 cents for grapes this week! Try finding deli hot wedge fries for $2 anywhere, or chicken strips for $4? If you bake, their barrels of bulk items are a steal, baking chocolate chips, shredded coconut, the price of nuts has skyrocketed in recent years (pecans about $13 a pound in packages? ) not at LOW COST GROCERY STORE. Ask for Greg if you want help selecting the best beef for your BBQ or a rub for your ribs. They all treat you like friends and I know several staffers by name. My regular store is a 30 second drive, I drive from another city (Corona Hills) to visit Norco LOW COST GROCERY STORE, I won't even go locally for 1/2 gallon of milk, not when it's just $2 at LOW COST GROCERY STORE. This is my #1 Yelp review for any business, anywhere.

userReviewOnlyContent: Myself and my friends went in to the store to get some alcohol shortly after midnight. We frequently shop here and love it because of the prices and selection. Our friend, who was our designated driver, came into the store with us. He was going to the restroom and getting some energy drinks. He left the store before we ever made it to the register. Once we got there, the cashier asked for all of our ids. Which was fine. But she also asked for our drivers id. I explained that he was just the driver and not purchasing or consuming alcohol. She refused to serve us. I asked for a manager. Which i have never done in my life. And tommy came over. I explained to him that our friend was not purchasing alcohol, had not touched the alcohol, and had made no attempts to purchase alcohol. He still refused to serve us. California law only requires those purchasing to have identification. This night crew was rude and disrespectful and made up their own rules. I've never left a bad yelp before. But it was just so astonishing how they went against our rights. For no reason.

userReviewOnlyContent:
My sister and I brought my mom here for her birthday and overall, we really enjoyed our time here. We're used to going to Korean spas, but this was definitely an upgrade.

PROS:
- The resort itself is beautiful and so relaxing. Like seriously such a pleasing escape from reality that I needed. It's set up so nicely and feels very luxurious.
- It was my mom's birthday so she received free admission on birthday with a purchase of a service. Admission is $52, so she booked a manicure for $50 and got in for free. WORTH. My mom had gone 52 years without ever getting her nails done, so it was kind of heartwarming to see how much she loved her experience.
- The three of us took a Yin Yoga class and really enjoyed it. We definitely want to take advantage of the other class options next time we come.
- CLUB MUD. We had so much fun there and even made a little clay sculpture. It really does do wonders for your skin, and the area is suprisingly very well-kept.
- The shower and locker facilities can get pretty crowded, but overall, they are super nice and clean. They have an ample amount of showers, so we didn't have to wait at all.
- All the staff seemed really friendly and helpful. There's always staff members roaming around, so you always feel somewhat taken care of.
- I really appreciated the towel and water stands located throughout the resort. So handy and necessary.
- Parking is free, thank God.

CONS:
- We went on a fairly cold day (around 60 degrees), so the hot pools were CROWDED,. Like there were a couple of times I touched other people's body parts I definitely did not want to touch. I feel like some of the hot pools exceeded capacity, and I'm sure it was mostly because it was a cold day, but I do wish there were more of the hot pools or they should just be larger!
- The food is incredibly expensive. Like as ridiculous as Disneyland, which is saying something. Plan to spend around $20 per meal per person. The one thing that was worth it was the nachos ($16 for the small, but this thing is huge).
- The kitchen moves VERY SLOWLY. Especially the salad section because I came before the lunch rush and still waited 20 minutes to order my salad. The kitchen staff seems a bit incompetent, or maybe it's just run inefficiently.
- This is more of a side note, but I wish there was a more streamlined reservation system. I made the entire reservation over the phone, which was fine, but it wasn't laid out as clearly as I would have liked it with the premium admissions prices, services, etc. The online one also just seemed really confusing.

Overall, we had a positive experience with just a couple of kinks here and there. We love that there's just a lot to do here and time FLIES when you're here so come as early as you can. We definitely want to try coming back in the summer months when it's warmer!
businessReplyContent:
Amber P. of HIGH END SPA Hot Springs

Business Customer Service

3/25/2019Hi Cathy,

Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your day at HIGH END SPA. We appreciate all feedback and will share these concerns with our team. We hope to see you back this summer!

With kind,
Amber Peyghambari

userReviewOnlyContent:
While I'm incredibly flattered to have been carded at my age, I wasn't the one buying beer. I was with my fiance, both of us well over the legal drinking age, he was carrying the beer, he had his wallet out to pay, he handed the checker his ID, and then she asked for mine.

I've been there with my kids and purchased alcohol without a problem. Why not card my kids or deny me the ability to purchase liquor with them in tow? How is it even remotely okay to deny an adult the ability to buy alcohol just because they're with another adult, who may not even be consuming the drinks, because they don't have their ID with them in the store?

Even worse was the way the checker, Stephanie, handled the situation. She snapped pretty aggressively at my fiance, demanding my ID from him and not even addressing me. She was obviously prepared to jump on this opportunity to deny the transaction as she lashed out her demand while scanning the product and refused to accept our insistence that I am in my mid-This is the worst customer service I've ever experienced from a traditionally fantastic store to shop at. It is my hope that LOW COST GROCERY STORE reevaluates this awful policy and the backwardness of its implementation.

userReviewOnlyContent:
It was impressive for our middle class, bedroom community of Corona. A new market for the masses. And in a part of town that was  residents. Good planning!

So, yes, LOW COST GROCERY STORE was smart moving in here, and seems to have snatched a large chunk of business away from the "other guys". Good old all-American competition.

It's big....almost to the point of being overwhelming, still clean from being so new (time will tell how that goes), priced low, and well stocked with just enough choices, from dry goods to fresh produce to fresh meats that are appealing to a middle class demographic.  

And I have never seen such a huge bread section.  My greatest pleasure was finding on their shelves a particular brand of bread that I fell in love with in Oregon.  Dave's Killer Bread, if you must know. And it befits its name.

Their Produce Department had many employees scurrying around, restocking hard and fast. The meat department is vast and nicely displayed, but don't expect to find prime meats here.  There were hard working individuals everywhere trying to keep up with the chaos of customers.  And the cashiers seemed maybe a bit inexperienced (and ours was unfamiliar with artichokes). They were cheerful and determined, and the check out lines moved quickly. There are even self-checkouts for the impatient and control freaks of this world (you don't want to know this, but I fit in that category).

I will give them time. I may not shop here for everything, but I appreciate having yet another option when I am driving through that part of town.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Best grocery store ever! As many have said, it's cash and debit card only. Also, you're expected to bag your own groceries. They don't usually have courtesy clerks standing by to do it for you. If you bring your own bags, they give you Their produce is a fantastic bargain and it all keeps very well. I actually have a week-old cucumber in my fridge that is still crispy and ready to go. I've never had a problem with things going bad in a day or two like I've had happen at Sprouts.

Beyond the produce is heaven...I mean the bulk food area! Not only do they have candy, but they have an entire endcap of sugar-free treats! They also offer tons of dried fruit, nuts and granola. My mom likes to make her own mixed nut assortment since you can fill a large mason jar for about $Their cheese section is fantastic. They offer bulk cuts of several types of cheese for around $Here are my Don't-Miss items from LOW COST GROCERY STORE:
-Coffee (In the bulk section) $7.50/LB, ANY variety! Even organic! You can grind it right there as well. They have flavored, unflavored, decaf and lots of roast levels.
-Honey (Also in the bulk section) - About $5/pint. Fresh and delicious!
-Spices (In the bulk area) - Single spices or mixes to choose from. You can get just a tablespoon or fill up one of the provided containers ($0.58, $0.78 or $0.98 for the shakers, depending on size).
-Boneless skinless chicken breasts - $1.99/LB (About $10 for a pack of 6 breasts). Always in stock! The breasts are large and don't contain a ton of fat/skin hidden underneath.
-CoffeeMate creamer - the 64oz bottle is only $3.99! Compare that to $7.19 at Vons!
-Deli meats (from the deli counter) - Almost all the meat is under $6/LB! They have turkey and chicken options for under $5/LB. They taste great and the deli employees are so nice!
-Pre-made sandwiches/salads - $We've never received poor service and the lines are typically short. They're open 24 hours so you can come in anytime! This is definitely a great place to get stocked up on a budget.
userReviewContent:
8/5/2015
Best grocery store ever! As many have said, it's cash and debit card only. Also, you're expected to bag your own groceries. They don't usually have courtesy clerks standing by to do it for you. If you bring your own bags, they give you 6 cents per bag off of your purchase! They also advertise their prices, along with their competitors' prices, in store so you don't have to wonder if you could get an item cheaper elsewhere. Plus, they accept manufacture's coupons, so bring them in!

Their produce is a fantastic bargain and it all keeps very well. I actually have a week-old cucumber in my fridge that is still crispy and ready to go. I've never had a problem with things going bad in a day or two like I've had happen at Sprouts.

Beyond the produce is heaven...I mean the bulk food area! Not only do they have candy, but they have an entire endcap of sugar-free treats! They also offer tons of dried fruit, nuts and granola. My mom likes to make her own mixed nut assortment since you can fill a large mason jar for about $4 with all premium nuts. After that, there's a huge variety of grains, pastas, even dried potatoes! They sell good quality baking mixes and chocolate as well. Plus, they have dog treats and bird seed at the end. As if that's not enough, they sell individual bowls of cereal plus individual K-cups and tea bags!

Their cheese section is fantastic. They offer bulk cuts of several types of cheese for around $5, both blocks and sliced. Their Tillamook and other brands are also cheaper than my local Ralphs or Stater Bros. We found Frigo string cheese for $4.60 after paying $9 at Ralphs. Ouch!

Here are my Don't-Miss items from LOW COST GROCERY STORE:
-Coffee (In the bulk section) $7.50/LB, ANY variety! Even organic! You can grind it right there as well. They have flavored, unflavored, decaf and lots of roast levels.
-Honey (Also in the bulk section) - About $5/pint. Fresh and delicious!
-Spices (In the bulk area) - Single spices or mixes to choose from. You can get just a tablespoon or fill up one of the provided containers ($0.58, $0.78 or $0.98 for the shakers, depending on size).
-Boneless skinless chicken breasts - $1.99/LB (About $10 for a pack of 6 breasts). Always in stock! The breasts are large and don't contain a ton of fat/skin hidden underneath.
-CoffeeMate creamer - the 64oz bottle is only $3.99! Compare that to $7.19 at Vons!
-Deli meats (from the deli counter) - Almost all the meat is under $6/LB! They have turkey and chicken options for under $5/LB. They taste great and the deli employees are so nice!
-Pre-made sandwiches/salads - $3. The turkey and swiss croissant is loaded with meat and cheese! They have lots of different bread and meat options.

We've never received poor service and the lines are typically short. They're open 24 hours so you can come in anytime! This is definitely a great place to get stocked up on a budget.

userReviewOnlyContent:
As said in hy I never made it to see the doctor.

I asked about my insurance and was told it was ok, but after being in the back and continuing to ask I found out that they don't check the insurance now its later, I was told they charge you a set fee after your visit then once they find out about your insurance they will refund or credit later.

This is not right, if I have a co-pay I expect to make my co-pay not a higher amount. Why wouldn't they tell you this before treatment or at time of booking like most places do? I would of walked out owing money I didn't have waiting for a credit later.

I was told by the staff this is standard practice EVERY WHERE, this is a lie. I have always paid my co-pay not a set amount prior to checking insurance, at a doc or dentist or even a pharmacy, I always paid my co-pay.

What if for some reason they came back and said owe we don't take your insurance and then charge more.

But I didn't find this out until I pushed and pushed and was all the way in the back almost starting treatment till I could get a straight answer

Please do not trust this place and stay far away as the office staff are crooks.

Notes:
After seeing their reply to this
1. I think they just committed a HIPAA violation as to disclosing my insurance company and personal information I will check with HIPAA on Monday. I am asking now that you delete all my personal information from your system
2. I always was in pain and needed to go and called days prior and even filled out the paperwork online before hand and asked about my insurance at time of booking.
3. I have in my age been to plenty of Chiro docs and EVERY single one has called and verified insurance and copay amount as I was checking in or before. I don't think I should have to ask over and over while sitting there in treatment room to find out after asking about 5 times that you are charge a set price, that alone should of been told to me the first time I asked.
4. Thank goodness I was able to find someone local that could see me and accept my insurance.
Please don't fall for this
businessReplyContent:
R. of CHIROPRACTIC Chiropractic Spa

Business Owner

6/2/2017Mike, my name is , owner and I am very sorry for your experience at our office.  It's our practice to charge our cash fee for all patients on their first visit until we can verify the specific insurance coverage.  Our cash fee for the 1st visit is $40. It's not our practice to take someone's "word for it" when it comes to specific amounts of deductible or co-pays.  I know your specific case because although I wasn't treating patients when you were here, I was here and was made aware of your situation.  Specifically with your insurance, we enter your information into their system and they fax us back your specific benefits within 72 business hours. This is not our practice but rather your insurance practice.  It's the same process for all patients with your insurance.

We do typically charge $40 and ALWAYS refund back the difference if the copay or deductible is less than that amount.  I must apologize if this was not explained in detail when you scheduled your appointment.  Most patients do not have an issue with this or if they do, they will typically ask us to verify insurance prior to their 1st visit.  Many of the patients that we see are in a lot of pain and choose not to wait an additional 3 days to schedule an appointment while this particular insurance is being verified.  

I was here when this occurred and it was brought to my attention.  I told the lady that was helping you to honor your word about the amount of your copay but at that point, I think you were too upset and refused care.  

I do not like to respond to these publicly, EXCEPT when we are accused of being crooks when I can assure you that we would not have been in business for 10 years at this location as crooks.  I sincerely apologize for your experience and apologize that our policy was not communicated with you more clearly prior to your visit.

6/2/2017
As said in previous reviews they are crooks. I am not sure about the doctors as I have never seen them but the office it self is.. That's why I never made it to see the doctor.

I asked about my insurance and was told it was ok, but after being in the back and continuing to ask I found out that they don't check the insurance now its later, I was told they charge you a set fee after your visit then once they find out about your insurance they will refund or credit later.

This is not right, if I have a co-pay I expect to make my co-pay not a higher amount. Why wouldn't they tell you this before treatment or at time of booking like most places do? I would of walked out owing money I didn't have waiting for a credit later.

I was told by the staff this is standard practice EVERY WHERE, this is a lie. I have always paid my co-pay not a set amount prior to checking insurance, at a doc or dentist or even a pharmacy, I always paid my co-pay.

What if for some reason they came back and said owe we don't take your insurance and then charge more.

But I didn't find this out until I pushed and pushed and was all the way in the back almost starting treatment till I could get a straight answer

Please do not trust this place and stay far away as the office staff are crooks.

Notes:
After seeing their reply to this
1. I think they just committed a HIPAA violation as to disclosing my insurance company and personal information I will check with HIPAA on Monday. I am asking now that you delete all my personal information from your system
2. I always was in pain and needed to go and called days prior and even filled out the paperwork online before hand and asked about my insurance at time of booking.
3. I have in my age been to plenty of Chiro docs and EVERY single one has called and verified insurance and copay amount as I was checking in or before. I don't think I should have to ask over and over while sitting there in treatment room to find out after asking about 5 times that you are charge a set price, that alone should of been told to me the first time I asked.
4. Thank goodness I was able to find someone local that could see me and accept my insurance.
5. Beware people never be seen by a doctor or dentist without them verifing your insurance and coverage. you can find out later its not covered or they dont except your type of insurance and be on the hook for thousands of dollars.. How many people in this word have been told "Oh don't worry it will be fine" to get messed over.

Please don't fall for this

Comment from  R. of CHIROPRACTIC Chiropractic Spa

Business Owner

6/2/2017Mike, my name is , owner and I am very sorry for your experience at our office.  It's our practice to charge our cash fee for all patients on their first visit until we can verify the specific insurance coverage.  Our cash fee for the 1st visit is $40. It's not our practice to take someone's "word for it" when it comes to specific amounts of deductible or co-pays.  I know your specific case because although I wasn't treating patients when you were here, I was here and was made aware of your situation.  Specifically with your insurance, we enter your information into their system and they fax us back your specific benefits within 72 business hours. This is not our practice but rather your insurance practice.  It's the same process for all patients with your insurance.

We do typically charge $40 and ALWAYS refund back the difference if the copay or deductible is less than that amount.  I must apologize if this was not explained in detail when you scheduled your appointment.  Most patients do not have an issue with this or if they do, they will typically ask us to verify insurance prior to their 1st visit.  Many of the patients that we see are in a lot of pain and choose not to wait an additional 3 days to schedule an appointment while this particular insurance is being verified.  

I was here when this occurred and it was brought to my attention.  I told the lady that was helping you to honor your word about the amount of your copay but at that point, I think you were too upset and refused care.  

I do not like to respond to these publicly, EXCEPT when we are accused of being crooks when I can assure you that we would not have been in business for 10 years at this location as crooks.  I sincerely apologize for your experience and apologize that our policy was not communicated with you more clearly prior to your visit.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Just wanted to update my review to reflect my latest experience at the spa. It was my friends birthday today and she received ary admission for the day :) it was a rainy day at the spa but that did not take away from the experience at all. If anything, it made us appreciate all the hot pools even more :) I'm gonna break it down as simply as I can:

Had an amazing massage by Ricardo: +1!
Margaritas are strong and seemingly bottomless: +1!
Food at the main restaurant was yummy: +1!
The floating bean bags in the lounging pool! Omg that was the best. You can totally set your drinks on the floating loungers too and they won't sink: +1!
Free parking: +The biggest negative that sort of put a slight damper to my day was my run in with a security guard first thing in the morning when I got there.

Some backstory:
So I always back in to whatever spot I'm parking in unless there are signs in the lot that say "head in only"

There are no such signs at HIGH END SPAn , so I went ahead and did my thing

The security guy walks literal circles around my car and gives me the eye and looks me over

Then he stopped in front of me and asks "why are you parked like that????"

Mind you, there are cars all over the lot that are parked head in, head out, all sorts of directions. But he singled me out and is like "you can't park like this. It's wrong. And it isn't allowed."

I kindly mentioned that there aren't any signs advising against how I parked and pointed at another car parked like mine and asked him, "you mean that guy can't park like that either then right? Because he backed into his spot too."

He looked at the cars and was like "no no, they are okay. That is fine but you cannot park like this. Fix it"

....that was a bit disappointing tbh. So for that unfortunate run in, I'd have to subtract a star. I've included photos of how other cars were parked

This place gets my vote for grocery store of the year. They have a huge, fresh produce section. They're prepared food section is pretty nice too. But the cool thing about this place is the bulk food section. They offer candies, grains, pastas, trail mixes, snack foods, dog food, etc. it's a pretty good selection for all of the different things that you could possibly buy in bulk without having to buy all the packaging. The spices in this area are without compromise. They have so many rubs and spices and herbs for all of your cooking needs.

The only downfall to this location is that they only take cash or ATM. But if that's what keeps the price is low, so be it.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I booked a Winter Warm Up package at HIGH END SPA hoping for a day of relaxation and tranquility and was fortunate enough to have my expectations met. First of all, the value was terrific. Admission, a plush robe (came in handy on a chilly day), a facial, and a hot chocolate + cookie from the Goco cafe (they substituted a coffee for me) for $159. The facial was thorough with a massage of the neck, shoulders, and arms. My skin glowed and my eyes were refreshed with the added eye soothing treatment. Overall it was worth the expense; however, the experience was diminished by the sales pitch at the end when the esthetician tried to sell me expensive products. No wet bathing suits are allowed, so you may want to change before your appointment.
Since we came on a Tuesday in winter, the crowd was lighter and perhaps more subdued than usual. There were two larger parties that had volume control issues, but the noise was tolerable. At the bar, the prices were decent, but the cocktails were pretty sweet and the pour is weak (even with a double). Next time I'll stick to beer or wine. If you're looking for a Palm Springs party vibe, I'm sure you'll find it here on the weekends. If a day of serenity is what you're seeking, I would call ahead and ask which day would best suit your needs.
Tip: The food is good but expensive. Plan on spending ~$

userReviewOnlyContent:
So, I don't have a LOW COST GROCERY STORE near where I live... but that didn't stop me from hearing about it in excess before I ever actually made it to one. From my mother. From my father. From my brother. From my sister. My mom said that they had every brand of everything ever. My dad said for me to just wait and see; I'd be impressed. My brother and sister explained to me that this place was as close to Willy Wonka's chocolate factory as any of us would ever get (which I could have done without hearing, to be honest, because that book/movie creeps me the hell out).

These assertions filled me with a weird sense of dread, as I feared I could not possibly be as impressed with any grocery store as my family so desperately wanted me to be. In fact, I thought that their weird championing of this place was a little on the off putting side. Sounded like koolaid drinking talk.

Anyway, no. This place is pretty neat. They sell things that you would never find at other similarly sized stores in a million years. Well, I guess I can't say that for sure, but I can certainly postulate. In any case, they carry all sorts of awesome stuff. They sell shredded tilamook cheese, for heaven's sake! Usually I have to shred it by hand, and who has time for that? I do, usually. But that's not the point. Furthermore, any incarnation of an item that takes the manual labor out of my hands is my favorite incarnation of that item.

Also, we ordered a couple sandwich trays for my brother's baby shower from here, and the woman in the deli was helpful and friendly. The sandwiches themselves were actually surprisingly good, and a big hit at the party. I gutted a couple of them just for the pretzel bread... Which I'm sad to think of now, because I don't have any. But I should have some. And so should you.

You win this time, family.
userReviewContent:
1/23/2014
 2 check-ins

So, I don't have a LOW COST GROCERY STORE near where I live... but that didn't stop me from hearing about it in excess before I ever actually made it to one. From my mother. From my father. From my brother. From my sister. My mom said that they had every brand of everything ever. My dad said for me to just wait and see; I'd be impressed. My brother and sister explained to me that this place was as close to Willy Wonka's chocolate factory as any of us would ever get (which I could have done without hearing, to be honest, because that book/movie creeps me the hell out).

These assertions filled me with a weird sense of dread, as I feared I could not possibly be as impressed with any grocery store as my family so desperately wanted me to be. In fact, I thought that their weird championing of this place was a little on the off putting side. Sounded like koolaid drinking talk.

Anyway, no. This place is pretty neat. They sell things that you would never find at other similarly sized stores in a million years. Well, I guess I can't say that for sure, but I can certainly postulate. In any case, they carry all sorts of awesome stuff. They sell shredded tilamook cheese, for heaven's sake! Usually I have to shred it by hand, and who has time for that? I do, usually. But that's not the point. Furthermore, any incarnation of an item that takes the manual labor out of my hands is my favorite incarnation of that item.

Also, we ordered a couple sandwich trays for my brother's baby shower from here, and the woman in the deli was helpful and friendly. The sandwiches themselves were actually surprisingly good, and a big hit at the party. I gutted a couple of them just for the pretzel bread... Which I'm sad to think of now, because I don't have any. But I should have some. And so should you.

You win this time, family.

I go to spas, where I sit in hot tubs and saunas all the time, and never have I gotten itchy welts all over my body. I doubt this is a chlorine or heat rash, since I'm accustomed to hot tubbing, and suspect contaminated water to be the cause of my itchiness.

I feel gross...as if I have a million parasites living on my skin and I can't do anything about it except take my anger out on this review.  

Buyer beware!

userReviewContent:
12/4/2013
Happy to finally get a store open 24 hours, as many of us want to avoid the masses during normal business hours.  Was impressed with the better-than-expected selection, particularly with the massive array of bulk bins for candy, pasta, spices and even doggie treats.

Many items were similar in price to nearby Stater Brothers and there were no bargains in the meat selection (why no filet mignon?  Not all of us who shop there want lesser cuts like sirloin or skirt steak).  Other items like bread, veggies, candy, spices, etc. can be up to $1 cheaper than you will find at other major grocery stores.

I did take advantage of their amazing turkey sale on Thanksgiving at only 25 cents per pound and bought several of them to give away to the less fortunate.

All the workers I have encountered on my 2 recent visits were super helpful and friendly...perhaps because it is an Employee Owned company.

My only issues are as s:

1. Really difficult navigating the isles around midnight when they are busy restocking the shelves,with stock and empty boxes everywhere you try to move your cart.....AND, some isles closed down entirely with forklifts in operation there).

2.  NO Credit Cars accepted!! That is just plain crazy, as most high volume operations of that nature only have to pay 1% to VISA or MasterCard.

3.  Many low life customers who allow their kids to run wild in the aisles and put their grubby, booger-laced fingers into the bulk bins.  What ever happened to parents controlling their kids when out it public.  I see the very same thing happening at almost all restaurants I go to....They just tune out and don't care about anyone but themselves.  This issue alone will drive many customers back the the TWO nearby Stater Bros.

userReviewOnlyContent: If you have a family of four or more, LOW COST GROCERY STOREs is the place to shop! There is plenty of parking at this location, especially for the disabled. There must be hundreds of shopping carts. It's open 24 hours. Most items are less expensive than they are at VONS and Ralphs. Some things at regular price are cheaper than the sale price of their competitors. Lots of items offered that other stores don't carry. Clean store and bathrooms. The customers are mixed clientele. So what you have to bag your own grocery? That's just one less person toughing your stuff! Take my advice and re-use the bags. I usually put paper inside of plastic and get several uses before they fall apart. The only reason I don't give this store 5 stars is because sometimes the produce doesn't last as long. But I go elsewhere for organic anyways so it doesn't matter!

userReviewOnlyContent:
Dr.  is honestly the best thus far! I was referred by my lawyer, ing an accident. Today marked my second visit and must I say, they have the best front desk workers, accident/work comp (Ann), and especially dr. .

After being in an accident, it can get extremely overwhelming. Ann literally went the extra mile to sincerely talk to me and calm me down. (My fianc was in an accident last June, so I have prior knowledge of some other chiropractor in corona). You mostly hear horror stories of bad front receptionists and workers at a medical office, but I can sincerely say this is one of the best, if not the best medical office I have been to.

Now onto the work of Dr. , he knew I was overwhelmed, nervous, and in pain. He was so calming, caring, and his touch is just right. He knew how to distract me, but also took his time to do my adjustments. I didn't feel like he rushed through his adjustments with me, like some others do.

I will add to this review for the massage therapy, once I start next week.

userReviewOnlyContent: I was first suspicious of this place when I walked in and saw signs trading yelp reviews for raffle tickets for a Ring Doorbell. I still gave the place a chance. I saw the acupuncturist there. They checked my insurance and told me I had coverage for services for a copay of $15 a session. I was shocked because any service should have been a $40 copay. I went for a few weeks. The acupuncturist diagnosis for my condition kept changing when I would come back with  actual medical information from other doctors appointments. When his diagnoses were proven wrong, he finally told me I was creating a condition from stress.  This was untrue and after further testing from a specialist, I received a diagnosis that explained my symptoms. I stopped going after he said that. He made a very difficult time in my life worse by suggesting I was creating symptoms.  I wasn't going to write a review after all that, but months later I received a bill when I thought I had no balance. TURNS OUT I HAD NO COVERAGE FOR THEIR SERVICES.  I would not have gone 2xs a week for as long as I did if I knew I had zero insurance coverage.

userReviewOnlyContent:
My first visit to LOW COST GROCERY STORE was today and they are now my favorite grocery store!
On initial entry this store can be overwhelming. It is BIG, no frills, but super clean.

Huge selection of produce, meats, breads - more so then at any regular area supermarket. and all very reasonably priced.  All the produce and meat looked fresh.
They even sell lamb. Lamb shanks at regular price of $ As ers noted, a  large variety of candy, pasta, flour, cereals, rice, etc. etc.  - you name it - sold in bins.

Noted with interest:

They sell whole prepared chickens for $ Different vinegars/oils/barbecue sauce//spaghetti sauce/ketchup  - big selection - and at prices last seen in regular supermarkets many years ago;

Some canned items - things i buy -  tuna ($ .The wedges and little boxes of Brie cheese - my favorite cheese - each at least $ And sometimes it is the little things one notes. Their egg cartons, again lesser priced then at area supermarkets, are stacked in such a way that the expiration date is displayed and immediate to see. The egg cartons tonight had expiration dates of Added bonus - they are open Their customer service is impeccable. I got there around Not all is perfect:
Seafood Dept. limited, but that's okay - better limited and fresh fish then large variety;
i could not find any of my German dumpling nor sauce mixes - but fore those i have to frequent select local supermarkets anyway.

I just hope LOW COST GROCERY STORE keeps it up with the same pricing/quality/customer service!
And do they have a bakery department and I missed it? I shall return.
userReviewContent:
8/14/2014
My first visit to LOW COST GROCERY STORE was today and they are now my favorite grocery store!
On initial entry this store can be overwhelming. It is BIG, no frills, but super clean.

Huge selection of produce, meats, breads - more so then at any regular area supermarket. and all very reasonably priced.  All the produce and meat looked fresh.
They even sell lamb. Lamb shanks at regular price of $ 3.99/lb. from lamb raised in the US, i.e. USDA inspected.

As previous reviewers noted, a  large variety of candy, pasta, flour, cereals, rice, etc. etc.  - you name it - sold in bins.

Noted with interest:

They sell whole prepared chickens for $ 4.99 - so, cheaper then any other  area supermarkets;

Different vinegars/oils/barbecue sauce//spaghetti sauce/ketchup  - big selection - and at prices last seen in regular supermarkets many years ago;

Some canned items - things i buy -  tuna ($ .79) , water chestnuts ($ .79), mushrooms ($ .68) - bargains!

The wedges and little boxes of Brie cheese - my favorite cheese - each at least $ 2.00 less then at area supermarkets. Other cheese varieties, sliced/chunk and grated (parmesan) - very reasonable as well.

And sometimes it is the little things one notes. Their egg cartons, again lesser priced then at area supermarkets, are stacked in such a way that the expiration date is displayed and immediate to see. The egg cartons tonight had expiration dates of 10 days plus from today, not always so in area supermarkets.

Added bonus - they are open 24 hours.

Their customer service is impeccable. I got there around 5:30 pm tonight, the height of shopping hours, and stayed for a good 50 minutes. Employees were there walking in aisles and departments throughout the store and approached customers incl. myself immediately, offering to help,  if it looked like anyone was searching for something. When was the last time that happened in a local supermarket??

Not all is perfect:
Seafood Dept. limited, but that's okay - better limited and fresh fish then large variety;
i could not find any of my German dumpling nor sauce mixes - but fore those i have to frequent select local supermarkets anyway.

I just hope LOW COST GROCERY STORE keeps it up with the same pricing/quality/customer service!
And do they have a bakery department and I missed it? I shall return.

This is the first spa in SoCal that I've been to and I'm not sure what the hype is about... maybe I'm just not a spa person.

You pay general admission ~$55, which gives you access to the general areas e.g. hot and cold pools, mud bath, etc. You pay $100+ extra for massages on-site, which is somewhat comparable in price to other massage places, but not so much in quality. The food is pricey and you can't bring any food in. And all robes and slippers cost extra.

Was it relaxing? I guess it could be, but I didn't think it was worth the cost, especially when it's shared with a bunch of other people. To each their own.

userReviewOnlyContent:
This review is long overdue. Our very first visit was   On Upon arriving at our cabana, there was a fruit basket waiting for us. Overall, the cabana seemed clean, but it had a cushiony double-lounger that sadly looked very dingy, as if not properly cared for. Our individual services were okay. It was a very busy day, yet we felt like we could have done without the cabana. This visit was during their high season; therefore, the hours were longer so we got to enjoy more of the spa.

We returned on , for a couple's day. This time we reserved On After my facial was done, I noticed that the nail polish on all of my left toenails was chipping away. I asked about this in the salon and they assured me that the polish is suppose to last a few weeks. WEEKS, not hours. They reapplied nail polish, at no extra cost, but didn't reapply to all my toenails. On Overall, we enjoyed our visits; however, I don't believe the services we received were up to par with the price tag and the hype. Also, since March is part of their low season, the hours are shorter; therefore, everything feels rushed; consequently, did not feel very relaxing. Also, during this slow season, there truly is no advantage in reserving a cabana or lounger, as there were plenty of empty loungers all over the property.
userReviewContent:
3/13/2020
 1 photo

This review is long overdue. Our very first visit was   9/16/16, after many friends and coworkers recommended this place. Our most recent visits took place on 03/08/2020  & 03/09/2020

On 09/16/16, my fianc and I decided to treat ourselves to some pampering & relaxation. In celebration of our anniversary, we reserved the Date Palm Cabaa, which at the time cost $200. The cabana rental included reserved parking and access to a semi-private pool, We also booked the Cabana Celebration package for $150 per person (plus an additional $60 upgrade for 80 minute services) and included our services, the admission, robe rental and the activities for the day. The services we received were the Detox Body Treatment, for myself and the Gentleman's Body, for my partner.

Upon arriving at our cabana, there was a fruit basket waiting for us. Overall, the cabana seemed clean, but it had a cushiony double-lounger that sadly looked very dingy, as if not properly cared for. Our individual services were okay. It was a very busy day, yet we felt like we could have done without the cabana. This visit was during their high season; therefore, the hours were longer so we got to enjoy more of the spa.

We returned on 03/08/2020, for a couple's day. This time we reserved 2  Loungers, instead of the cabana. We booked their "It Takes Two" deal, which includes: (2) Taking the Waters admission, (2) 50 minute services (each valued at $115 each,) (2) Grotto Treatments, (2) Robe rentals, (2) Breakfasts and freshly squeezed orange juice from the  Kitchen. (For the breakfast, we were given a voucher, at the time of check-in.) Total for the package was $458. We booked the Aromasoul Massage, for each of us. I must admit that I got lost on my way to the massage villa, thankfully one of the staff members was kind enough to walk me there. So I was about 5 minutes late, which cut my massage short. I also had a pedicure, which I paid $10 extra to get the better quality "fast drying nail polish." I like the cleanliness of the salon & the measures they take to sanitize their tools and prevent exposure to unnecessary infections. For example: all of their nail and foot files are peel on, this way none of these are reused.

On 03/09/20, I returned to the spa, after being invited for an all girl's visit. For this visit, we booked the Healthy Balance Package which consists of: (1) Taking the Waters admission, (1) 50 minute service (valued at $115,) (1) Moisturizing Grotto treatment, (1) Fresh pressed juice from The Chill Zone. (It wasn't after we had left the spa that I realized that I was never given instructions and/or the voucher for the orange juice.) Total for this package was $215. Additionally, I booked a $125 Illuminating Solution facial, and added the Hand & Foot Soother Enhancement, for an extra $25. (I would not recommend the latter, it really isn't anything you can't do at home with body scrub and hand lotion.) I had the warm stone massage, which I LOVED.  However, this time the masseuse was late, and she cut my session short.

After my facial was done, I noticed that the nail polish on all of my left toenails was chipping away. I asked about this in the salon and they assured me that the polish is suppose to last a few weeks. WEEKS, not hours. They reapplied nail polish, at no extra cost, but didn't reapply to all my toenails. On 03/12/20 a good chunk of the nail polish from my big right toe, chipped off. I am beyond disappointed, as I expected way more from an $80+ pedicure. I have paid $20 for a pedi at my local mom & pop salon and it has lasted weeks.

Overall, we enjoyed our visits; however, I don't believe the services we received were up to par with the price tag and the hype. Also, since March is part of their low season, the hours are shorter; therefore, everything feels rushed; consequently, did not feel very relaxing. Also, during this slow season, there truly is no advantage in reserving a cabana or lounger, as there were plenty of empty loungers all over the property.

How could I not give HIGH END SPA I treated myself to a nice massage for my birthday and ended up getting SO MUCH MORE. If you want a great spa experience, coupled with excellent customer service, HIGH END SPA is the place for you to go.

If you go on your birthday, you get in for free and also get a free robe rental!!! You will have access to all the amenities that are free except The Grotto, which is $There was a minor snafu upon my arrival...When I walked in I thought I was standing in line and was behind two other African-American women who were being served by someone. I guess the lady at check-in didn't notice that I came in alone and asked me if I was with them. After she realized her mistake, she checked me in and all was well.

I spent almost the whole day in a trance-like mode of relaxation. It was just what I needed when I needed it. Amanda was my masseuse and she was excellent! She gave me info for a chiropractor and gave me a very nice tea hook up! My time at HIGH END SPA was the best and I can't wait to go back!

userReviewContent:
1/7/2020
 1 check-in

My sweet boyfriend surprised me with a spa day. He bought the BETTER WITH FRIENDS package that includes: Taking the Waters admission, 50-minute services, HIGH END SPA Robe rentals, and Breakfasts and freshly squeezed orange juice from the  Kitchen all for two people. It truly was the perfect day for two. Since he paid a whopping **$398** (Saturday and Sunday price) to treat me, of course I chose him to experience it with me. It was our first time at HIGH END SPA Hot Springs. He planned the entire day for us which included 10am aroma massages ing breakfast. BTW, the breakfast voucher cannot be redeemed past 11am.

We had arrived before doors opened at 9am Sunday morning. As we sat in our car, we watched a line forming in the winter cold. We decided to stand in line before it got super bad. Not sure whyyy but it takes about 15-20 minutes to get in. Staff makes every group stop and wait to ask if they have a reservation and conduct bag checks. You will probably NOT be allowed in without one.  Once you're in, the helpful staff behind the counter answer your questions and give you a map to the FREEEE lockers which is located at the same place you will be given and return your robe rentals. (My rental robe had a hole in it.) Front desk/check-in woman circled on the map where the kitchen is for breakfast and where to go for our massages.

10am massage appointment means they want you to check in around 9:45am to give you enough time to fill out a questionnaire and use the bathroom if you need to. Considering that we spent most of the 9 o'clock hour trying to check-in and walk over to the kitchen, that only gave us 20-25 minutes to order and eat breakfast. WORST PART: We were informed that they were out of orange juice!! Who knows how they were making mimosas  ?\_(?)_/?

That massage though! Heidi was absolutely lovely. Very skilled and I had the best massage. Thank you, Heidi!! PRO TIP: When you book your massage, request to be in the same village (building) as your friend/significant other. Not like it makes much of a difference since you'll be in different rooms, but I had to walk further to village #2 LOL.

We spent the rest of the day in the hot/cold pools, spas, hot saunas, club mud, etc. Towels are abundant, so thank you HIGH END SPA. The two of us were able to relax and really enjoy our day because we intentionally focused on relaxation. You WILL NEED to be able to block out your surroundings (i.e. noise, laughter, convos, drunk people) in order to truly have a relaxing time here. It was fairly crowded, especially for such a cold, windy day. If you wanted to get away from the crowds, you would've had to enter the lap pool or cold pools (heated to 80 degrees). Club Mud became more and more packed as the day went on. Staff is very nice.

TIPS:
- Eat breakfast at home  
- Bring your own robe from home
- Wear sandals or flip flops
- Don't lose your locker key
- Bring CA$H to tip
- Don't leave your patience or humor at home
- HIGHLY recommend their therapeutic pools
- Try the Grotto at least once in your lifetime

I had the opportunity to check this place out courtesy of my best friend!  We attempted to check this place out prior to my last visit and was turned away because we did not have a reservation.
Check out their website prior to coming here because they offer specials. They have a twilight special where it's buy 1 get 1/2 off. This place gets very crowded expressione on the weekends.
Upon arriving I was a little discouraged by the long line of people waiting to get in. Once we got in line it only took minutes before they collected our funds and we were on our Merry way. The staff and layout was very organized for easy check in. Once inside it was very crowded!!
Our overall experience was great because we were in good company... as for as relaxing?!?! Not happening that day. It was more like a Vegas pool party minus DJ Pauly D

userReviewOnlyContent:
Had a wonderful day with a friend a few months ago and loved pampering ourselves silly! Our day began with each of us having no problem finding parking, which was a relief. We then preceded to chat with a kind employee in the gift shop who assisted us with the day's activities and explained the lay of the land. He put us both in a great mood by his own positivity, and we were thrilled to explore and relax.

There were so many pools and activities to choose from, I hardly knew what to do first. We did have to wait for a bit to enjoy a few of the hot tubs, as it appeared that they had reached capacity fairly early in the day. Once we were able to dip in, it was smooth sailing and we allowed our worries to melt away.

In the middle of the day, we had our appointment at The Grotto. Things were a bit disorganized when we arrived to check in, and the woman who explained the rules and logistics kept getting rudely overpowered by a cackle of older women in the room. I was irritated that the employee didn't say anything to bring attention back to her, and even more irritated that no one seemed to care about the signs everywhere in the grotto area about the volume of speech. People were talking so loudly in what was meant to be a soothing environment that I could hardly wait to leave and escape the noise. Side note: The mud treatment was cool, but it burned as soon as I put it on my face! Luckily an employee nearby had a towel handy so I could wipe it off!  

The only thing I found majorly disappointing was the quality of the alcoholic beverages and the long lines to get them. They were either super watered down or had such a minimal amount of alcohol in them that they were hardly enjoyable as a cocktail.

Overall, HIGH END SPA was great, but I would recommend going on a weekday to get the full experience without the crowds!
