userReviewOnlyContent:
I came here with a group of girls for a bachelorette get away earlier this month. I was worried that it might be a bit cold to enjoy all the pools but it was actually very nice. From reading ouldn't be fun for me.

My friends and I did the Grotto Experience and it was worth it. Only precaution is that the under ground cave area is slippery so be careful down there or wear your sandals (which will need to be able to get wet). We also did the Club Mud, which I thought wasn't as good as the Grotto and I probably wouldn't do it again. It was very hard to get off. That said, it did not stain my bathing suit.

We had lunch at the cafe there and it was pretty good. We got a variety of things including sandwiches, pizza, soups, nachos, salads, etc. It was confusing when we first walked in though. It's like a walk up cafeteria style. But first you have to find which station is serving what you want. And it's really a pain if you want two different items from two different stations. The stations should be more clearly marked so there wouldn't be so much confusion.

Overall, I found my experience to be very nice. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I had a great time with my friends and I would love to come again...but not during the busy summer months.
userReviewContent:
1/31/2020
I came here with a group of girls for a bachelorette get away earlier this month. I was worried that it might be a bit cold to enjoy all the pools but it was actually very nice. From reading previous reviews I can tell there is a big difference from winter to summer as far as being too crowded and being able to enjoy the facilities. I was told that there was only 300 people on the day that we went the and maximum capacity (which it reaches in the summertime) is 1,000 guests.  As it was with 300 people, the mineral pools were hard to get into as they were always full. A lot of the pool areas seemed full but not over crowded. With 700 more people, it wouldn't be fun for me.

My friends and I did the Grotto Experience and it was worth it. Only precaution is that the under ground cave area is slippery so be careful down there or wear your sandals (which will need to be able to get wet). userReviewOnlyContent:
This place was AMAZING. I booked a cabana and the celebration package over the phone a week in advance. It was a breeze. I got emails with my itinerary, waivers, and general info.

Upon arrival you get reserved parking with the cabana. You make the line so they can check your bag and we told the bag checker that we had a cabana. We skipped the line to pay for entrance and went straight to check in. We had booked the celebration package which included a The massage was fantastic! The pedicure comes with a bourbon rub that was great. My wife loved her facial. The grotto was amazing! Staff even let us book our lunch ahead of time and had it ready for us when we got out of our massage. The place was not crowded at all. The pools are heated which is nice for winter time. The robes were super cozy!

Overall a fantastic experience and will be coming back. We will continue shooting for off season though since it is less crowded. We each had three services and still plenty of time to use club mud and all the other spas.

Thanks to HIGH END SPA staff for making this a great experience!

userReviewOnlyContent:
Honestly I'm very disappointed in our experience at HIGH END SPAn  and I really don't understand what all the hype is about. I don't think this spa day experience is worth the arm and leg you pay to get in. Maybe I had higher expectations, but when it ends up being about $Here's my view on HIGH END SPAn ...
- First off, the website is absolutely frustrating, and extremely difficult to book a reservation. It kept kicking me out and deleting my shopping cart. After trying several different times over a 2 day period I finally decided to give up and just call them.
- If you buy a gift card online, they either mail it to you, or have it waiting U for you at the register when you get there. This is annoying if you want to buy it as a gift for someone last minute. It's 2020 and they should really look into an E-gift card or something.
- They usually have offers where you can buy a gift card and get $20 off, which is what I recommend doing.
- I was able to buy the gift card over the phone, and she was able to apply my gift card to our reservation fees which was nice.
- They make you buy an extra service if you want to reserve your admission spot. So basically if you don't buy the extra service, you are risking not being able to get in.
- We ended up choosing the Grotto Service which is $30 per person, on top of the admission fee. So it ends up being about $100 per person just to get in. Also, be aware that you have to select a specific time frame before you make your reservation. IMPORTANT** I recommend doing the grotto at the end of the day, because once they put the clay on you, they say you shouldn't go in the mud or the spa for 45 minutes. ***
- Honestly, after the whole reservation experience, I was already turned off at that point.
- I also booked a mani/pedi for my cousin since we came here to celebrate her bridal shower. ** Please do not waste your money on a nail service here! ** Holy crap this was by far the WORST mani/pedi I have ever seen. I can't even believe they get away with this. She literally had nail polish left around her skin! We were furious because it was $65 for the shellac mani, and $60 for the pedi, plus a tip. Which is an insane up charge compared to your typical nail salon! And it wasn't even a good job.
- The grotto experience was pretty cool, and the clay that they rub on you feels amazing, but if you don't like saunas, then you might not want to try it. They recommend sitting in the sauna room for about 20 minutes but I was only able to do 5. They have a bunch of showers in the cave so that was nice to rinse off after.
- **Warning**, you have to fill out a waiver and answer afew health questions before you go in, and the employee reviews them, and gives you tips before you enter. They are not at all cautious about keeping your medical info private! My cousin made a note on her waiver that she was Overall, I just felt like all the spas and pools here were just pretty average. Nothing super exciting. It felt like you were at an adult water park, but I didn't get a "luxury" feeling at all. Also, the food here was horrible, and WAY over priced. It's also a bummer that they don't let you bring your own food. Make sure to bring a robe, flip flops, and a hydroflask so that you don't have to keep refilling your water cup. But atleast the water is free ;)

Ps. They check your bags before you enter...so don't even waste your time trying to sneak anything in. We even had to throw away our granola bar

userReviewOnlyContent: HIGH END SPA is a hidden gem tucked away in the mountains. Basic admission was $52 per person and that gave us access to all the pools which include a sulfur pool, hot and cold pool, a relaxing mud bath, a steam room. You can pay a little extra and get access to the grotto which is a relaxing skin treatment or you can pay a little kore for a facial or massage. Overall this place is great for a little getaway form the city. Quite relaxing and a good quiet environment.

HIGH END SPA is a hidden gem tucked away in the mountains. Basic admission was $52 per person and that gave us access to all the pools which include a sulfur pool, hot and cold pool, a relaxing mud bath, a steam room. You can pay a little extra and get access to the grotto which is a relaxing skin treatment or you can pay a little kore for a facial or massage. Overall this place is great for a little getaway form the city. Quite relaxing and a good quiet environment.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I am so impressed with CHIROPRACTIC!  Found them on Yelp when I needed some help with a strained hip. Was a little apprehensive after reading one person's review, but glad I went in and had an experience that was opposite of the negative review.
This is the most on-time clinic/med facility I have ever been to. Have been in twice now and enjoyed how prompt they were at getting me through the treatments, etc. Have hardly had to wait for anything.
Had a great first impression right off the bat. Emailed them at 7a in the morning, got a respinse from the doc within an hour, and got a phone call from the front desk before they even opened for the day. They got me in that day for an appointment which was a Godsend due to the terrible pain I was in.
Very clean, nicely furnished, good parking, convenient location, nice staff, warm and personable docs, effective treatment.
I wish I had come in sooner for my pain since I had a huge improvement just the ing day. Had to do a fake bow to the doc at my  up appointment since I was so thankful.
The doc was very effective with the treatment. I googled and YouTubed some stuff when I got home and they said to do the exact same stuff that the doc did. (Not that I didn't trust the doc, but I like to take my health into my own hands too and be as educated as possible).
The consultation and x rays were very informative and eye opening. I had no idea that I had a bulging disc in my lower back and early stages of arthritis!!! Now I can be more proactive at protecting my wellbeing before I become a crippled and pained person later on.
Really am so impressed with this place. Looking forward to coming here for more treatment, massage, acupuncture, and overall maintenance for years to come.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Almost every year I love coming here to celebrate milestones...
Let's start with they're experiencing website difficulties, which resulted in my reservations switching to another day, other than my birthday....
When I checked in on my birthday they claim to tell me my reservations were a no-show and I cannot get refunded what I paid. (Due to their website)

I ask to speak to a manager, i spoke with the so called manager named Dwayne and He said it's against company policy to refund the money when I sign something online stating this.

However no one called me about this no call no show and they didn't  up with me. I received emails knowing that it was for my birthday specifically, even screenshot my receipt. After going back and forth at registration nobody was helpful. As I walked out they gave my friend a business card to a David Lynch.
I called and got in touch right away. Come to find out David is on site and was able to turn everything around and have my friend and I came back.
He honored my reservations and that was it... bare minimum... Nothing over and beyond customer service that was expecting from a place like HIGH END SPA.
With that said, will never return back to this poorly run down resort. I've told all my friends and people who have never been to HIGH END SPA to never go. Better places out there full of dignified services .
Hello Golden door !

userReviewOnlyContent:
I've been wanting to come here for years and finally got to do so with my hubby last week. We decided to go during their twilight hours, which is from If you only pay for admission, which is referred to "taking the waters" this just gives you access to their We got there early and couldn't go inside until it was They suggested changing into our beach attire and soaking in the mineral waters before heading to club mud. Club mud is where you slather red clay all over your wet skin. You can wait for it to dry in the Wafa cave and/or by the sun. After the clay dries up, we rinsed ourselves off and it was time to go to our grotto appointment.

We already signed the waivers ahead of time, so we only waited about We checked out a few more pools before grabbing some dinner at  Kitchen. I got the BBQ chicken flatbread and he decided on the margherita one. I saw some people get the nachos, which looked scrumptious.  Kitchen is more like a cafeteria, so I was surprised how good the flatbread was. When we were done eating, we changed back to our regular clothes and headed home. I enjoyed spending our anniversary here and felt extremely relaxed afterwards. Pretty cool place to go to if you're looking for an outdoor escape that is not too far from SD.
userReviewContent:
7/17/2019
 5 photos

I've been wanting to come here for years and finally got to do so with my hubby last week. We decided to go during their twilight hours, which is from 4-9pm and has live entertainment. Walk-ins are not permitted once they reach capacity, so I suggest buying one of their services to guarantee entry. Luckily, we made reservations for the grotto moisturizing treatment!

If you only pay for admission, which is referred to "taking the waters" this just gives you access to their 19 pools, club mud, and lounge areas. Anything else you want to book like massages, facials, are an extra cost.

We got there early and couldn't go inside until it was 4pm- by then, there was already a long line outside, but it moved fairly quickly. After checking in, we were given a map and tips on what to do since it was both our first time at HIGH END SPA.

They suggested changing into our beach attire and soaking in the mineral waters before heading to club mud. Club mud is where you slather red clay all over your wet skin. You can wait for it to dry in the Wafa cave and/or by the sun. After the clay dries up, we rinsed ourselves off and it was time to go to our grotto appointment.

We already signed the waivers ahead of time, so we only waited about 10 minutes before it was time to descend to a secret cave. This was where an employee painted us from neck-to-toe with a warm aloe vera, coconut oil, eucalyptus, shea butter, and lavender masque. They gave us extra formula to put over our faces or anywhere we wanted to add the extra masque. Then we sat in a heated cavern to open up our pores. When it got too hot, we rinsed ourselves off and then sat in a cooler grotto to relax with tea, water and green apples. My skin was super soft afterwards!

We checked out a few more pools before grabbing some dinner at  Kitchen. I got the BBQ chicken flatbread and he decided on the margherita one. I saw some people get the nachos, which looked scrumptious.  Kitchen is more like a cafeteria, so I was surprised how good the flatbread was. When we were done eating, we changed back to our regular clothes and headed home. I enjoyed spending our anniversary here and felt extremely relaxed afterwards. Pretty cool place to go to if you're looking for an outdoor escape that is not too far from SD.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Reasons to take away stars. First, upon having my breakfast burrito I had huge pieces of the onion skin in my burrito (see attached photo). Second, we rented a cabana thinking we would have a more peaceful experience however another guest brought in a portable speaker (wasn't allowed) and she was playing Dj the entire afternoon.

Tips
1. Arrive early. If you book a cabana, you get your own parking spot and you get to bypass the line to get in. It also comes with a personal server who brings you whatever you need with the push of a button.
2. Do the mineral bath first, mud second, grotto last.
3. Lockers are free. If you have a cabana you can store all your belongings in the cabinets.
4. Don't be late to your scheduled treatments or they will pass you up. I saw a lady throw a tantrum because she was 30 minutes late.
5. Caution, Mud club could stain your swim attire.

userReviewOnlyContent:
They have towels and water throughout the premises. No outside food or drinks. I took two water hydro flasks. I had to empty both of them before entry. A robe would come in handy. You can borrow one from here but I think it's $$There's only one restaurant which is cafeteria-style. There is a coffee shop that serves Starbucks, sandwiches, and snacks. The food at the cafeteria was overpriced. I ordered the chicken nachos, which was huge. It had dry chicken pieces and fake guac. It wasn't good at all. My daughter had the quesadilla, which was terrible.

I went here on Friday. It was very crowded. It was noisy from all the chatters. I plan to return, but I won't return on a Friday, Saturday, or Sunday. I would probably go on a Monday-Wednesday. The staff told me that it starts getting very busy from March. The staff is very friendly.

They have towels and water throughout the premises. No outside food or drinks. I took two water hydro flasks. I had to empty both of them before entry. A robe would come in handy. You can borrow one from here but I think it's $20.

$52 per person, which includes the mud bath, mineral spa, and the use of pools and hot tubs. The grotto is $30 per person. They apply various moisturizers and you go into the hydration room. I enjoyed the mud bath and the mineral spa, but it was just too crowded.

There's only one restaurant which is cafeteria-style. There is a coffee shop that serves Starbucks, sandwiches, and snacks. The food at the cafeteria was overpriced. userReviewOnlyContent:
I go to HIGH END SPA often.   I love it there, the atmosphere is so luxurious.   In the summer I go during the twilight hours, it's not as crowded and has a different vibe.   During the summer it is at capacity most days.  I also go during the winter, it's not as crowded and they have robes you can rent, or you can buy your own.  You really can't go in the lounge pool during the cold season, it's too cold.   I LOVE LOVE LOVE the Club Mud and the Grotto.  Doing those two makes your skin so soft and silky.   I went over the Thanksgiving weekend and tried their yoga class.  I was not impressed with the instructor.  I could have taught the class with more flow and accuracy.   I was seriously considering getting a yearly pass so I can do the yoga, Club Mud and the Grotto during the year and am going to pass because the yoga is not that great.  I hope they get another yoga instructor soon.  

The food, is good quality and typical spa type food. You also get a good amount of food to each order.  Their drinks are good as well.   The price for the drinks and food is pricey, but it's the spa, so it's expected to be overpriced.  

I would absolutely recommend HIGH END SPA, just not the yoga instruction or during the summer months.

userReviewOnlyContent:
You can spend a lot of money on services, entrance fee, and food here in a day. I splurged here for my mom's Below are some tips from personal experience:
-get there at least 1 hr early, long line already by 8 and they start letting people in before the designated opening time 9 around 8:30
-first thing is to use your own towel to stake lounge chair, preferably with lots of shade (can get very hot in the afternoon)
-get a lounge chair, since by noon there will be no open seats
-bring flip flops, don't recommend walking barefoot
-eat lunch early, like around 11. The set up is inefficient so there will be a long line by 11:30  
-make reservations for services early via phone (I called 2 mos in advance since it was summer time), they're usually fully booked if you call too late

userReviewOnlyContent:
We used to love coming here. It used to be such a nice place to retreat. The past few times we've been it's been crazy over crowded with groups.
Lots of drunk birthday or bachelorette parties... if you are planning to go & relax I would not recommend!!! It was really disappointing to pay extra for The Grotto and have a group of drunk girls screaming and laughing the whole time. They seemed to be enjoying themselves but managed to ruin everyone else's time.

The spa itself is pretty nice and seems well maintained. Although I think the food has gone downhill over the years as well.
It was a great escape while it lasted, but I don't think I will be returning.

userReviewOnlyContent:
HIGH END SPA is kinda sad now and it's mostly the service and some of the upkeep.

I had a one star experience booking everything as no one will get back to you via email or phone until you are beyond upset. When you physically get to HIGH END SPA everyone has been trained to say that they're "understaffed" or "at capacity." I can tell you that neither of those things are true and that the employees really don't care and aren't being managed correctly.

I don't know when the landscapers work because I never saw any of them but it must be super early in the morning. They do a great job and I didn't see any plants or other landscape areas or beds that needed attention. That all looked pristine.

I feel like the hot tub pools that you sit in -especially in the mineral baths - needed some resurfacing. I could feel them scraping my bathing suit up but they would have to close them to do this which they will never do. That would be way too much revenue lost.

There are lots of employees around but they're not very helpful. They mostly just congregate and talk to each other. When we were in line at the bar there were two bartenders. One of them was helping the line the other one was a male who was just talking to two girls for a good The product that is used on the facial smells bad. When she first started I thought she maybe just came back from a cigarette break. Then at the end some of the same product was being rubbed on my face when I asked what it was scented and she said it was tobacco scented. Why in the hell would you have that at a spa? She even said it was their brand new line. Ew.

There was construction as half the locker room sinks and lockers were taken down to rubble. They didn't have this section blocked off in anyway or cover it up. It's just what you got to look at while you were in the locker room. There was also no signage directing you away from it as it in the middle of everything. It was in line with the rest of the experience.

Besides the landscaping it's pretty run down here and there are much better spas in the area. The customer service was so bad at every point in the process that I'll never come back.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Absolutely fabulous spa day! We came on a Thursday and did the weekday deal ($Starting from the beginning, the day was super cloudy and rainy and we were concerned. Surprisingly, the cold rainy weather made getting into the super hot pools awesome. There are the mineral baths which have the mineral water with sulfur. There's a saline bath (Epsom salt) and a hot and cold set of pools (We enjoyed the pools in the morning and then got ready for our massages. We got the hot stone, but next time I would get the deep tissue probably. Feel like I enjoy strong pressure which was not the point of the hot stone. After our massage we went to a club mud where you smear your entire body with mud, let it dry, and wash off to expose soft exfoliated skin.

After club mud we did the Grotto experience which is a Shea butter body mask, steam room, and rinse. Loved it!
After that, we changed and grabbed dinner.

Tips:

-Order the nachos at their restaurant (big portion and yummy)
-Bring your own robe and slippers
-Order of the experiences: baths, massage, clay/mud, grotto
-Go early (they open at 10 but we got there at 9 and they let us in early when there weren't that many people)
userReviewContent:
5/20/2019
 6 photos

Absolutely fabulous spa day! We came on a Thursday and did the weekday deal ($160 for 50 minute massage, body mask at grotto, entry to spa and access to pools and club mud).

Starting from the beginning, the day was super cloudy and rainy and we were concerned. Surprisingly, the cold rainy weather made getting into the super hot pools awesome. There are the mineral baths which have the mineral water with sulfur. There's a saline bath (Epsom salt) and a hot and cold set of pools (60F and 103F in temp). There are also assorted lap pools and lounging pools.

We enjoyed the pools in the morning and then got ready for our massages. We got the hot stone, but next time I would get the deep tissue probably. Feel like I enjoy strong pressure which was not the point of the hot stone. After our massage we went to a club mud where you smear your entire body with mud, let it dry, and wash off to expose soft exfoliated skin.

After club mud we did the Grotto experience which is a Shea butter body mask, steam room, and rinse. Loved it!
After that, we changed and grabbed dinner.

Tips:

-Order the nachos at their restaurant (big portion and yummy)
-Bring your own robe and slippers
-Order of the experiences: baths, massage, clay/mud, grotto
-Go early (they open at 10 but we got there at 9 and they let us in early when there weren't that many people)

My massage therapist talked the whole time about her children, labor etc and while doing so she talked with her hands or stood there looking at me while talking. I mean she was nice but I didn't pay to chit-chat but to receive a much needed massage. I've had plenty of massages in the past and when therapist talk they don't stop working on me, but this wasn't the case. Now, I just want to cry because today was horrible and I still need a good massage. I spoke to Jessica the manager at checkout and she offered to speak the massage supervisor.

I have a HIGH END SPA trip planned with 10 of my girlfriends next month and after today's experience I'm considering moving our spa day to Pechanga or even Grape Seed Spa.

userReviewOnlyContent:
We've been coming here every year the day before Thanksgiving and love it every time.  Most times we rent a cabana and enjoy the concierge staff who are always on top of things. Everyone breaks away for a private service during the day and closes with the grotto experience.  

Pluses:
Roman baths and double headed showers in bath house.
Food exceeds expectations for a resort and the lemon cookies are a must.
Lots of towels available!
Water aerobics class held 1-2/day is always fun.
Assortment of pools to choose from.
Red Clay (club mud) is an experience in itself
Cafe / Restaurant on site
Plenty of bar areas
Plenty of covered areas is rain.

So-so's:
Lockers are pretty small even for a standard gym bag.
No in/out privileges
Lots of chlorine in jacuzzi pools

userReviewOnlyContent:
Been here a couple times over the years and have a blast! I suggest coming early and on a weekday if you can as it's easier to get in and less packed.

This place is like the Disneyland of spas. I usually get a package when I come.  Their massages are great as is the grotto.

My favorite pools are the hot and cold plunge.  It's so meditative. Aside from the variety of pools, they also offer water aerobics classes and yoga.

In terms of what to bring: beach coverup or robe, dark bathing suit (clay can stain suits), flip flops for showers,  hair ties and hair brush. Their locker rooms are spacious with free locks.

The restaurant is also very good providing various healthy options too. I love the nachos.  The portions are huge!

A great place to relax and unplug.

Both of my visits to HIGH END SPA have been amazing. The staff always provides excellent customer service and everyone always has smile here.
Although it is a little pricey , it is definitely worth visiting for a spa day! They also offer packages that help you save if your coming with a friend or partner. I also love how they give back by offering free  admission on your birthday.
On both my visits I had a massages booked which left me very relaxed. I also enjoyed the breakfast and lunch at the cafe  definitely worth eating there. Also make sure when visiting the bar you try to the special drink they are making because they are very tasty.
I would also advise in making a reservation prior to arrival to insure you are able to enter in case they are at capacity when you arrive , which is something I really enjoy  since it's not over crowded. Also make sure you relax in the Roman Bath at the end of your day before leaving !
Definitely a place to visit if your looking for a Spa day with your girls, partner, or even on your own .

Just to be clear, this review is only for their restaurant. I find it odd that they don't have a Yelp page.

Anyways, the problem that I had here is that one server came off very rude when I asked for an update on one of the items we ordered. My breakfast burrito came out within She didn't bother to ask what I ordered or what table I was at. She dismissively waved me off saying that they're working on it and it'll be done soon. 5 minutes after that, a manager comes over to apologize for the delay. Well great, my food was already done with and my GF had to watch me eat. To make up for it they offered only a small OJ which I found pathetic. There wasn't anything else they could have offered? A comped meal? Something for my GF to snack on while waiting for her food to come? I would expect their level of service to match the high prices they charged. But they failed miserably.

Just to be clear, this review is only for their restaurant. I find it odd that they don't have a Yelp page.

Anyways, the problem that I had here is that one server came off very rude when I asked for an update on one of the items we ordered. My breakfast burrito came out within 10 minutes so we were only missing one omelette. After 20 minutes I finally walked over to a server at the window to ask for an update. I mention that we've been waiting a long time and other patrons who ordered long after we did had already received their food.

She didn't bother to ask what I ordered or what table I was at. She dismissively waved me off saying that they're working on it and it'll be done soon. 10 minutes later I saw one of the kitchen staff point out to that same server that I still had a number on my table, indicating that my order wasn't completed. That's when she finally decided to stop being lazy and check, only to realize that my food was brought to the wrong table.

5 minutes after that, a manager comes over to apologize for the delay. Well great, my food was already done with and my GF had to watch me eat. To make up for it they offered only a small OJ which I found pathetic. There wasn't anything else they could have offered? A comped meal? Something for my GF to snack on while waiting for her food to come? I would expect their level of service to match the high prices they charged. But they failed miserably.

userReviewOnlyContent: My first experience and definitely won't be my last. The pools were wonderful and clean. I am so glad that there were warm pools for the wintery weather. It was also exhilarating to go to the Plunge pool too. I would suggest going to each pool at the suggested time limits. The best place was absolutely Club Mud. The warm pools was a safe haven from the cold. A thin layer of mud will do, dry in the Wafa near the mister and definitely rub the clay off the skin so it became ashy. Then, we rehydrated at The Grotto with the creamiest moisturizing formula. I loved it and will love to come back during a time when it isn't crowded. I couldn't imagine being at HIGH END SPA with so many people during the summer months. There is food and a store. Bring your own robe or rent one for $20. Be prepared to spend about $10 per meal or more to drink. It is great!

userReviewOnlyContent:
Totally worth 5 stars! Came for their "Better with Friends" February package deal.
This was a Birthday gift to my BFF. We ditched work and the kids to spend a Tuesday at HIGH END SPA!
So great. It was quiet and peaceful. The grotto was closed for maintenance, but everything else was open.
Our package included breakfast, robes, treatments, use of the pools and the mud!
Make sure you give yourself the time to use everything. We were there for about 6 hours! Bring a swimsuit and sandals to wear.
The shampoo and body wash isn't the best, so if you need to really wash up, bring your own.
Even when its busy, they have lots of little quiet areas to hideaway in and relax. Bring a book or take nap. Enjoy the relaxation!

userReviewOnlyContent:
If you are looking for a getaway treat yourself type of day, look no further. This place has it ALL!
The landscape is truly beautiful and feels like you are in an oasis.
My friend and I decided to do the Grotto. We called a day in advanced to reserve this. The staff was very friendly and helpful over the phone. She recommended doing our treatment towards the end of the day.
The locker room: there are a lot of lockers. I suggest bringing nothing bigger than a duffel bag since they are not very big. You do not need a lock; the provide locks. They provide lotion, q tips, & disposable combs as well as towel service. The showers have shampoo, conditioner, & body wash.

The Food: if you are lucky to catch the attention of a staff member around the resort, you can order food & drinks from them. The prices are what you would expect. The small nachos are big enough to feed The Drinks: They have a good selection of drinks that are decently priced. The mixed drinks are made with wine based liquor so they are not very strong. I recommend the lava flow. They also have beer and wine available.

The Atmosphere: It is no doubt that HIGH END SPA is beautiful. The pools are lovely and the foliage makes you feel like you are in an oasis. The guests outside were quiet and everyone keeps to themselves. The only loud guests I encountered were in the grotto and in the Roman baths inside the locker rooms. I understand if you come in a large party it can get loud but some people were just obnoxiously loud. I tried not to let it ruin my experience. The towel service at each "attraction" is a very nice touch. The mineral pool was always full so unfortunately I did not get to try that. In the secret garden, I would like to see more hammocks. There were only two.

The Grotto: Try to schedule this at the end of your day! It is a moisturizing treatment and it would be a shame to ruin it by visiting club mud after. This was my favorite part of the day as the mixture they brush on your body smelled heavenly. Towards the end, they offer you tea and fresh fruit. Stay in the sauna room for as long as you can to ensure that your body absorbs in all that heavenly concoction!

TL;DR: Try the Grotto, Club Mud, the Lava Flow drink. Enjoy your day!

Amber P. of HIGH END SPA Hot Springs

Business Customer Service

1/16/2019Hi Kelly,

We want to thank you for sharing your experience. We are glad to hear that you had a great time with us! We hope to see you join us again shortly.

With kind,
Amber Peyghambari

userReviewOnlyContent:
I had a wonderful and much needed ladies day here after a stressful academic term. My group of Pros
- spacious, but not TOO spacious. if you wanted to run back to the locker room to grab something, it's not a huge amusement park where you need to plan ahead
- convenience of paying for food and beverages. you put a card on file and obtain a wristband for alcohol. every transaction simply requires your phone number
- mud spa is a new experience for me
- water and towels provided throughout the facility
- the liquor in your cocktail is wine based. you can enjoy an extra mojito in the sun and still stay classy
- free parking

Cons
- price. i would've loved to reserve a massage but it's not something i was able to afford after paying $65 entry fee.
- the liquor in your cocktail is wine based, so your rum isn't actually rum. im okay with that, but some consumers may feel ripped off
- smoothie boy worked way too slow

Notes for next visit
- bring extra sunscreen and don't get too greedy about staying out in the sun THAT long
- bring a small bag so I can put my phone and sunscreen next to my chair
- arrive early to snag chairs, that was a good choice
userReviewContent:
9/3/2019
I had a wonderful and much needed ladies day here after a stressful academic term. My group of 9 arrived in the morning, checked in, placed our things in a locker, and headed out to snag a spot. The venue is spacious with a variety of different pools ranging from detoxifying to hydrotherapy. My favorite was the spacious 2 feet pool where you float around in the sun with a mojito in hand.

Pros
- spacious, but not TOO spacious. if you wanted to run back to the locker room to grab something, it's not a huge amusement park where you need to plan ahead
- convenience of paying for food and beverages. you put a card on file and obtain a wristband for alcohol. every transaction simply requires your phone number
- mud spa is a new experience for me
- water and towels provided throughout the facility
- the liquor in your cocktail is wine based. you can enjoy an extra mojito in the sun and still stay classy

Cons
- price. i would've loved to reserve a massage but it's not something i was able to afford after paying $65 entry fee.
- the liquor in your cocktail is wine based, so your rum isn't actually rum. im okay with that, but some consumers may feel ripped off
- smoothie boy worked way too slow

Notes for next visit
- bring extra sunscreen and don't get too greedy about staying out in the sun THAT long
- bring a small bag so I can put my phone and sunscreen next to my chair
- arrive early to snag chairs, that was a good choice

userReviewOnlyContent:
This place has really gone downhill. With as much as they charge for admission you would think they would keep up on the grounds cleanliness and maintenance. Before my visit on 12/15/19 I hadn't been there for
years. We were greeted by an unfriendly member of the staff that expected us to know she was standing there to check our bags. I learned later there is a sign, however not located near where she was standing. After check in we are given a map and told to check in for lockers. I purchased the package with robe rentals included (normally a $20 additional charge). The robe my mom was given was wet, and the other 3 robes given to my party were heavily used. When my sister in law arrived she was told we already checked in and pressured to simply use the map that I had been given when I checked in. The package I purchased also came with breakfast and freshly squeezed orange juice. The orange juice was good and the portion size great. The only food option worth eating is the pancakes. The potatoes on the other entrees were cold and the food comparable to a company cafeteria.

userReviewOnlyContent:
This was my second visit to HIGH END SPA. I brought two of my girlfriends here on a much needed vacation. The spa services were booked a week out but there must have been some cancellations since we were able to squeeze in the grotto experience, massages for two and a facial for me day-of. The staff was especially accommodating and friendly all across the grounds. We enjoyed the convenience of putting a card on file and associating it with your phone number to use throughout the day. We ordered cocktails to sip by the lounge pool which was so relaxing. There were also ample towel and water stations so you could always dry off and stay hydrated.

For me, this is a splurge kind of day that I would only go for a special occasion since it is so pricy. I would definitely recommend to other visitors looking to celebrate or just getaway with good friends.

It's a pretty cool nice place from what I can tell.

But the next morning I woke up with hives all over my body. I'm not allergic to anything so I'm puzzled. We had done the twilight package with the grotto, mud, all the pools and stuff. Maybe that's why there was a waiver, not sure, I didn't really read it.

Just wasn't what I expected to happen the next day, I showered and everything before I left. When I told the doctor they said that happens when you visit places like that sometimes because of bacteria etc. Gross.

Must not have been as clean as it looks.

Those hives pictured were covering my entire torso, neck, back, waist, etc.

Customer service wasn't an issue, but probably need to work on their micheladas a little bit.

userReviewOnlyContent:
The main reason for this review is reception and website. I'll start with the basics though...The HIGH END SPA grounds are a wonderful place to be. They've improved since the last time I was there with cocktails and a nicer restaurant/cafe atmosphere. The locker rooms are spacious with a steam room and Roman bath as well. Zero amenities, however. Being a past Burke Williams member I can't imagine, with an entry fee AND treatment fees, HIGH END SPA wouldn't be able to match what they offer (robes, sandals, hair/skin product, mouthwash, q-tips, fruit, cucumber water, etc.). Love all the pools and the mud bath (would be great to dip into mud rather than spread it on). Security at the gate is ridiculous since it can create a line up to get in with only one or two people checking bags. Peak days are packed. A daily limit on people in/out would be fantastic for those days, otherwise it's less of a spa and more of a backyard party with people you'd rather not hang with...and their kids.

On to the main reason. A friend and I ordered Look, it all worked out in the end and it was a really nice day but we lost 30 min at reception on a short day (they closed at 5p) and were pretty flustered by the people who were/are the first impression of HIGH END SPA. All of this could have been avoided if the website was far more user friendly. The receptionist said their POS system was old so the website had to remain as is in order for the two to work together. I say hurry up and fix the damn system and website and put those receptionists to good use at door check. Nothing like driving in traffic to be in more traffic. And in regards to traffic...man, what a difficult location to get to! Corona is nothing but crowded now. Not anyone's fault but just had to whine about it....

userReviewOnlyContent:
Pros:
* Website is very well constructed/designed, to the point where it's very misleading.
* staff is constantly replenishing the towels in the bath house.
* mud bath was fun.
* there were water stations for you to hydrate after the sauna or steam room.
* they provide shampoo and conditioner.

Cons:
* The spa was very dirty. There are hardly any mineral pools (which is why would go to a hot springs to begin with), and there are too many large chlorine pools. I didn't spend $72 to swim.
* showers aren't dirty and moldy.
* not enough rooms (I.e. sauna, baths, etc...) to provide for the guests. There are lines for many of the pools/services there, or people usually linger trying to give you a hint that they'd like to use whatever you're using. Website says they turn down people once it reaches max capacity, but doesn't seem that way considering how many people there were.
* staff is rude. No one is willing to help. If you ask a question they answer in a yes or no manner leaving you waiting for the "real" answer.
* food is terrible and overpriced for what it was.

Alright considering it's almost the only "hot springs" resort near the LA area but wouldnt go back.

userReviewOnlyContent:
This place is a great getaway to relax and get slathered in self care. Their service isn't that great though. I wouldn't blame the workers, they're doing the best with what kind of management they're given.

I had paid for a $50 manicure and was not informed that the paint was still wet but rather to just not get in the water. By the end of the day, my nail color was smudged and had air bubbles. We asked for a refund and the salon manager informed us that it was not the nail technicians fault and therefore was not their problem. Not even a partial or a discount was given. Lesson learned, just don't go to the salon period.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Had a gift card and decided to book a few services before the New Year. Parking was available through the place.

As soon as you walk up, you walk into the lobby where you check-in and find a small inventory of spa items for sale from clothes to accessories.

I booked a quartz massage and a grotto session. I checked into the bath house and obtained a robe and proceeded to the grotto session.

Check in at the Grotto was quick. We were taken downstairs and painted this special paint (forgot what it was) that helps your skin then you go down into a rock sauna before you wash off in the most relaxing shower ever.
After my grotto session, I had lunch at the  coffee house. I had the fish tacos which were good for a spa and the broccolli soup (wish it would have been the squash soup instead).

Then I decided to go and play in the mud at club mud. I didn't get into any of the pools as they were pretty full the entire time I was there.

Then off I went to my massage with Mitchell. I really don't know what the benefits of the quartz bed were besides it was warm and felt like you were soaking into the bed. Mitchell was gentle and made sure to unknot the tense area.

I will more than likely return but next time in the Spring or Summer.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I WILL NEVER GO BACK HERE, EVER. Came for a friend's birthday... She was unfortunately disappointed.

The Bad:
- SO SO SO CROWDED... The pics do no justice to how incredibly wall-to-wall crowded this place is
- Pretty gross. Clumps of hair in the pools, dead wasps everywhere, can wear shoes in the locker room... Just all around nasty.
- Some staff is cool (especially in the grotto) but otherwise rude, beaten down by life, and slow as molasses in winter.
- food was bland and drowning in sauce or salad dressing, etc
- drinks were processed (not like a fresh, craft cocktail). Hangover city.
- Who the f*@k came up with the layout of this place? I'm not kidding, it's this weird, convoluted maze trying to hide the fact that it's actually a lot smaller than you think
- Hot springs..? More like lukewarm to cold springs with an overcrowded hot tub

The Good:
- the people I was with! Love you girls! xoxo
- The grotto was nice
- Well maintained grounds (trees, rock garden, etc)... More so than the pools it seemed

Good and Bad:
- The mud! Makes your skin glow for the rest of the day, but it REALLY dries you out afterwards! Not good for dry skinned folks like myself. Also the pool is warmish, but also filled with people, dead bugs and probably dead skin... (shudder) If you're renting a robe and get mud on it, they charge to clean.

My advice: SKIP THIS PLACE and find a good Korean Spa! It'll be cheaper and more bang for your buck. Seriously, this place is YIKES!

*OR* if you're looking for an actual luxury experience and don't mind paying for it, try Terranea in Rancho Palos Verdes. That place is (kisses fingers) magnifique!!

userReviewOnlyContent:
I've been to HIGH END SPA a couple of times. Both were with a large group and we rented the cabanas on the  Terrace. It's super chill up there and it's nice to be able to sneak away from the crowds and receive personalized service. The waiters have always been super attentive and requests are delivered quickly.

HIGH END SPA itself is nice. It attracts a pretty diverse crowd and has a fun but relaxing atmosphere. The mineral pools and salt pools tend to get/stay crowded and it can be uncomfortable standing there waiting for space to get in. The mud area is nice and leaves your skin feeling super soft. One of my favorite spots is the float pool. It's shallow enough to sit and chill without getting your hair wet or you can use the rafts.

The services are ok. I've gotten a couple of massages, a facial, and a pedicure there. The massages have been alright. Nothing to rave about but relaxing. The facial I got hurt my face and the lady was super pushy about product. I had to tell her "look lady, I didn't come here to spent $$ on products." The pedicure was decent, but I'd rather pay my regular lady a fraction of the cost for similar service. The services are pricey and only moderately worth it.

Overall, I feel like HIGH END SPA is a cool day trip. I would go back, but maybe skip the services.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Sooooo relaxing. Enough said,  the staff, the facilities were awesome. Decided to celebrate my bday by celebrating at HIGH END SPA.  After a bit of research decided to use some gift cards to reserve some services.  If you have a party of more than 5, I highly recommend booking lounge chairs for you and your party.  30 bucks each but their yours all day.  We got our loungers above the  cafe. This includes service to your party.  I also recommend booking the grotto for a wonderful experience that leaves your skin soft and supple and only 25 bucks per person.
If you don't want to rent loungers, I recommend you get there early.  The early bird gets the good seating area.

Shout out to Xema (I think that's her name) for helping us out with our drinks and food and a suprise cupcake with candle.  She was so sweet and after several fail attempts to get waiters/waitress she kept coming back to see if we were good.

We tried out the yoga class. Totally worth it.  Feel asleep for Pros:
- Mineral baths
- Spring water mud pool
- Massage services
- Pools
- Food
- Drinks are reasonably priced
- Water stations everywhere
- Towel service stations
- Friendly staff
- Clean facilities
- Shampoo and conditioner in shower are awesome
- Plenty of parking
- Must try yoga class,  we feel asleep
- Starbucks but you can't use your app
- lockers to keep your stuff in

Cons:
- We had to hunt down our staff to get food and drinks
- I cut my finger on a bathroom stall
- People hog the mineral baths
- Gift shop is overpriced

userReviewOnlyContent:
For the amount it charges, you would expect something upscale but as a first timer-- it is looking dated with dysfunctional shower switches.

From what I experienced it looks like the rainfall shower heads are more of the norm and the side shower heads no longer work. If it doesn't exist in most people's household (ie most people would have removed the side tiles) then just remove it!  Saw this in the Grotto as well.

I went into the salt pool near opening and there was already a dead mosquito in it.  Is someone really cleaning it or is just done the night before?Annoying!

I like that most of the pools are shaded with the exception of a few in which you lounge around.  Mineral/ salt baths tend to be the most popular.

(+) loved the Grotto experience- it is a moisturizing experience; you need to pay extra and reserve ahead of time. If you're tight on funds and don't want a service, do this instead. The receptionist recommended we go to the mineral baths first, then clay mud, and lastly the grotto (start the experience about one hour before your Grotto experience). Sign the waiver beforehand to avoid a longer wait.

(+) there are about (+) liked that there was water + towels throughout the spa.

(-) food is over priced and how is it delicious from some reviews ? I had a turkey avocado sandwich and the bread was stale/ hard. Not worth $(-) there is lotion by the soap dispenser but hardly any lotion. People were getting super upset and while you do see attendants, there is no one refilling.

I booked a package which includes admission, a spa treatment up to $Overall, a bit disappointed by the visit as I was expecting it to be more upscale/ up to date. Upon closing time (near 5pm) when it closes at 6pm, it felt like chaos in the locker area just from the crowds.
userReviewContent:
4/13/2019
For the amount it charges, you would expect something upscale but as a first timer-- it is looking dated with dysfunctional shower switches.

From what I experienced it looks like the rainfall shower heads are more of the norm and the side shower heads no longer work. If it doesn't exist in most people's household (ie most people would have removed the side tiles) then just remove it!  Saw this in the Grotto as well.

I went into the salt pool near opening and there was already a dead mosquito in it.  Is someone really cleaning it or is just done the night before?Annoying!

I like that most of the pools are shaded with the exception of a few in which you lounge around.  Mineral/ salt baths tend to be the most popular.

(+) loved the Grotto experience- it is a moisturizing experience; you need to pay extra and reserve ahead of time. If you're tight on funds and don't want a service, do this instead. The receptionist recommended we go to the mineral baths first, then clay mud, and lastly the grotto (start the experience about one hour before your Grotto experience). Sign the waiver beforehand to avoid a longer wait.

(+) there are about 3 classes held daily. We went to aqua Zumba which uses weights and mainly arm workouts.

(+) liked that there was water + towels throughout the spa.

(-) food is over priced and how is it delicious from some reviews ? I had a turkey avocado sandwich and the bread was stale/ hard. Not worth $17, but only worth the convenience of not having to starve for the remainder of the day. Lol

(-) there is lotion by the soap dispenser but hardly any lotion. People were getting super upset and while you do see attendants, there is no one refilling.

I booked a package which includes admission, a spa treatment up to $100, and the grotto experience.  Robes are extra - not worth $18 rental; more people were using their own robes or towels to wrap around instead.  Thought about booking a cabana but glad we didn't since we were hardly lounging around during our visit. There's lots to do and we didn't make it a goal to just lay or sit around.

Overall, a bit disappointed by the visit as I was expecting it to be more upscale/ up to date. Upon closing time (near 5pm) when it closes at 6pm, it felt like chaos in the locker area just from the crowds.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Loved this place!!!! I have never been able to go and enjoy a spa but it feels so good here. I would go daily if I could. I felt so relaxed and completely comfortable after a full day of the healing waters. My mother and I brought my daughter here and rented a private cabana. Best service and we were well taken care of by our hostess.
Second review: rented a cabana for my mother's 75th birthday. Rented the exact same cabana that we did before. Didn't really receive a special cabana time as we did last time. Nothing special about this trip with the cabana except for being able to sit in a private area and receiving service at your cabana. Wasn't worth the money unfortunately I will always recommend going to the spa to enjoy the waters but I will never rent another cabana again. First trip 5 stars second trip 3 stars for cabana experience.

userReviewOnlyContent:
My friend and I came here for her birthday. We didnt get massages but we utilized all the different pools and saunas. If you can get past the rotten egg smell, the mineral spa was very relaxing(apparently it smells that way because of the minerals!) The mud bake was my favorite however I put too much on my face and I had an allergic reaction. It took about a week to clear up and all was good again! I dont think it has anything to do with the quality of the mud, or the facility. I think my skin just wasnt feelin it.
We got the loaded Bloody Mary's as a treat and they did not disappoint! Between the shrimp, bacon, and olives they garnished it with it was like a meal in itself! Good thing I didnt have breakfast...I wouldn't have been able to finish my drink! Haha
We shared a chicken ceaser salad for lunch and the size was perfect for each of us to have a good portion without left feeling hungry or wanting more. It was perfectly dressed and tasted great.
The grounds are beautiful and very relaxing. Everything was clean and I had no problems as far as any of that went.
All of the staff we encountered from the time we checked in to the time that we left was very accommodating and friendly with the exception of one. The bartender who made our epic Mary's. She was a little snooty and seemed like we were wasting her time.
All in all we had a great time and even though it was quite chilly when we went it actually made it nice because it wasn't crowded at all.

userReviewOnlyContent:
My mother and I went to HIGH END SPA for our annual mother daughter trip. With all of the stressors of life it was very appealing to have a little calmness and stress relief. This place was not the place to do it. It felt like a Las Vegas Pool party that I wanted no part with. Mind you there was some relaxing moments like the message and message area, the spa for facials and the grotto experience. Thankfully my mother and I got the Date Palm Cabana which I felt was the only reason we lasted the day because it was our peaceful spot amongst the chaos.

The Bad
- I felt the place was below my standards of cleanliness
For them to close at 9pm and open up the next day at 9-' it was quite apparent that they don't thoroughly clean the area.
- We arrived at 9:30 and the bathrooms were dirty, the elevator to the cabana was dirty, and the first pool we went into which was in the bathhouse had brown dirty bubbles forming with a light brown film.
- The cabana seating and chairs were dirty as well so we draped towels over everything before we sat down.
- Waaaay over crowded, the pools are not that big to begin with and each pool was packed to where all you could do is stand in one spot.
- everyone walked around barefoot and then go directly into pools and mud and what not without showering before hand thus bringing all that dirt from their feet into the pools. After my first pool in the bathhouse I couldn't bring myself to get in anymore water.
- the bathhouse was a madhouse and the bathrooms were really dirty. In the showers I saw mold on shower curtains and on the walls and borders. Everything just felt really dirty.

Th good

- I had an amazing Massage from Brad...I wish he worked at other locations besides just there because he's worth revisiting!!! And he was so kind and really good at what he does

- the Cabana is the way to go if you do come here!!! We had preferred parking right in the front, got to skip the line to enter the building and was taken right to the cabana hostess area that had some tea. After checking you in they escort you to your cabana as well as give you a lay of the land. We had a nice semi private cabana away from the crazy, a private jacuzzi just for cabana users, fresh fruit bowl, and the convenience of ordering crops and having it brought to you (which was great because the restaurant got absolutely crazy busy) This cabana made our trip and I'm so happy we opted in for this.

- the grotto was very cool and relaxing and I felt like I was at a spa there. I loved that green stuff they lathered on us and kept wanting to rub it all over...the cave itself is pretty cool too.

- The Nachos and Cupcakes,.....heard a lot about the nachos so I had high expectations which they lived up to but no one talks about the cupcakes which were amazing and soooo moist!!!

- the sax player that came for the twilight portion. He was EXCELLENT!!! We actually stayed longer to listen to him (in our private cabana deck)

Overall we had a decent time...I am most thankful for the time spent with my mom but I wouldn't come back unless just for a massage which the entrance fee to get in for a massage isn't worth it.

userReviewOnlyContent:
This place has fallen in mine eyes since being taken over by the GOCO group. It used to be very chill, serene, and relaxing. Now, they let people in beyond capacity. The alcohol is rampantly flowing. The loud ratchetness is above and beyond. All so they can make a buck. I get it yo, times is tough, you gotta make that paper.. but really though?

The sheer number of people at the spa must make it difficult to maintain the facility in a timely and cleanly manner. Detritus floating around in and on the bottom of all the pools. People just leaving their crap around anywhere and everywhere. Guests being loud, disgusting, and overall unaware of anything outside of themselves is not something the spa can control, I get it, but maybe don't let THAT many people in all at once so you can make that paper? All these social media obsessed individuals with their phones out constantly. Drunk people being loud and obnoxious. This does not make for a relaxing spa experience, that I dropped a huge chunk of change for.

Also, seems pretty unprofessional for your staff to be hovering in a group in the locker room, airing out their grievances with each other, when there are clearly quite a number of guest around everywhere. I get it boo, I get stressed with work too, but do that on your break time, away from guests. That's just unprofessional; entertaining for me, but really unprofessional.

The staff, by and large, were friendly enough when approached. But no one really went out of their way to provide that bit of extra customer service. Like, Boo, I can tell you hate your job right now.

The food at the on-site cafeteria style... "restaurant"... umm... it was just whatever. Very lackluster. Just expensive for what you get, for truck stop/gas station-esque quality.

Am I being too self-entitled, snobby, first world problems, complaining? Perhaps just a smidge. Long story short. The staff is friendly enough. The facilities are pretty on the surface, at first glance. Was not a relaxing time or vibe due to the sheer number of people jam packed into the place. Too much alcohol and instagrammers for my tastes. I miss the HIGH END SPA of old.

userReviewOnlyContent:
How have I lived in the Inland Empire for so long and I have never been to HIGH END SPA?! This place is truly a magical oasis!

We started the day by getting to the hot springs right when they opened which was perfect! We were able to get first picks and enjoy the pools for a few hours before bigger crowds came. There are The day moves by so quickly as you are just lost in relaxation land! Before I knew it the day was over and I was so sad to leave. Honestly, though the place is pricey, its worth every penny as this is the best experience I have ever had.

Last thing. The Hot Springs recommend that you disconnect to get the full experience and Must Do's? Everything! My top top favorites were:  lounging pool, the grotto, the saline pool and the vista pool!

If you do anything at all, I personally recommend just getting admission and the grotto (separate price from admission,$I cannot CANNOT wait to come back here again!

Things to keep in mind:
- Weekends are very busy! A few friends and I came on a Friday and the crowd level was just perfect. Busy but not too crowded. So I recommend a weekday if you can.
-Come early! I would recommend at least 20-30 min before opening because there is a line! It went pretty quickly as they take "peeks" inside your bags.
-There are free lockers inside of the bath house to keep your belongings. The bathhouse also has showers that have hairdryers, lotion, body wash and shampoo and conditioner and a bathing suit dryer! All free!
- Free towels are all over the spa so no need to bring your own!
- Bring a cover up if you have one! They also have robes you can rent that a lot of people rocked all day!
- They have a cafe and kitchen there so you can order lunch and things!
- At check in, they ask you to keep your card and cell phone number on file so they if you make purchases through the day, you don't need to hold onto that.
-If you are interested in doing any of the services and couldn't book online, they have same day bookings as well! You can talk to the staff at check in about that!

If you know that you have been holding onto a lot of stress, you NEED this! Treat yourself please!
userReviewContent:
4/7/2019
 9 photos

How have I lived in the Inland Empire for so long and I have never been to HIGH END SPA?! This place is truly a magical oasis!

We started the day by getting to the hot springs right when they opened which was perfect! We were able to get first picks and enjoy the pools for a few hours before bigger crowds came. There are 19 pools here and each one is different! Hot tubs, epsom salt pools, hot and cold plunge pools, heated pools, lounging pools and more! All of these pools plus Club Mud (red clay treatment) is included in the price of admission!

The day moves by so quickly as you are just lost in relaxation land! Before I knew it the day was over and I was so sad to leave. Honestly, though the place is pricey, its worth every penny as this is the best experience I have ever had.

Last thing. The Hot Springs recommend that you disconnect to get the full experience and 100% agree. I tried to take very few pictures here and there but the next time I go, full disconnect! So I really recommend this!

Must Do's? Everything! My top top favorites were:  lounging pool, the grotto, the saline pool and the vista pool!

If you do anything at all, I personally recommend just getting admission and the grotto (separate price from admission,$30). I went all out and also got a service but if you do just those two, It's so worth it.

I cannot CANNOT wait to come back here again!

Things to keep in mind:
- Weekends are very busy! A few friends and I came on a Friday and the crowd level was just perfect. Busy but not too crowded. So I recommend a weekday if you can.
-Come early! I would recommend at least 20-30 min before opening because there is a line! It went pretty quickly as they take "peeks" inside your bags.
-There are free lockers inside of the bath house to keep your belongings. The bathhouse also has showers that have hairdryers, lotion, body wash and shampoo and conditioner and a bathing suit dryer! All free!
- Free towels are all over the spa so no need to bring your own!
- Bring a cover up if you have one! They also have robes you can rent that a lot of people rocked all day!
- They have a cafe and kitchen there so you can order lunch and things!
- At check in, they ask you to keep your card and cell phone number on file so they if you make purchases through the day, you don't need to hold onto that.
-If you are interested in doing any of the services and couldn't book online, they have same day bookings as well! You can talk to the staff at check in about that!

userReviewOnlyContent:
If there was a zero star option, I would've gladly chosen that.

If you're looking for a place to relax and unwind, please DON'T come here. After years and years of rave reviews and hearing wonderful stories from my parents, uncles, and aunties who've all came here repeatedly in the past, I decided to spend my After being welcomed by Belle and Nischa, there was a complete turn in atmosphere as soon as my family and I walked to the cabana reservation concierge. Robert, the manager of the day, berated my mother with no upon no, telling her repeatedly that nobody without a cabana wristband was to be served, set foot into a cabana, and had to wait in line with the other guests who didn't have reservations, even after clearly stating that my other family members were a part of our group.

Even after my mom had told Robert that she initially reserved a bamboo cabana for The poolside service was lacking, but whenever someone did arrive, it was pleasant- until the later hours of the afternoon. My, the employee who took our twilight order, counted heads, and again we were greeted by none other than the smug and all-knowing Robert, who told my aunt that she wasn't allowed to sit in front of a neighboring cabana which was currently empty and unused, and also threatened both my mom and aunt that he would charge them $He continued to berate us, and yelled at my family in front of a pool filled with people, saying that we disregarded everything he told us in the morning, and threatened us with security to escort us out of the establishment even though we were not being loud, disrupting, not playing any music, or using foul language. When my dad asked if Robert was redirecting his anger from being short-staffed and taking it out on us, he nodded his head and said yes. My mouth was instantly agape, and I was beyond both shocked and appalled to hear this from a manager of such an esteemed establishment. We asked him again if we heard that correctly, and he said yes and stood by his word. Absolutely disgusting behavior coming from a manager.

Robert is a sad and sorry excuse for someone working in customer service, let alone for a manager, and sadly ruined what could've been a relaxing birthday celebration. HIGH END SPA will always leave a sour taste in my mouth because of what my family and I had to endure. I wouldn't recommend HIGH END SPA to anyone if that meant they'd have to suffer Robert's unprofessionalism.
userReviewContent:
9/15/2019
If there was a zero star option, I would've gladly chosen that.

If you're looking for a place to relax and unwind, please DON'T come here. After years and years of rave reviews and hearing wonderful stories from my parents, uncles, and aunties who've all came here repeatedly in the past, I decided to spend my 20th birthday here.

After being welcomed by Belle and Nischa, there was a complete turn in atmosphere as soon as my family and I walked to the cabana reservation concierge. Robert, the manager of the day, berated my mother with no upon no, telling her repeatedly that nobody without a cabana wristband was to be served, set foot into a cabana, and had to wait in line with the other guests who didn't have reservations, even after clearly stating that my other family members were a part of our group.

Even after my mom had told Robert that she initially reserved a bamboo cabana for 8, and had been relocated to two poolside cabanas, and that she was told over email that HIGH END SPA would accommodate our stay and let our party of 8 relax in those two cabanas, Robert kept interrupting and talking over her, and would not listen to anything she had to say. It was very rude and unprofessional, and it was horrible to see my mother being disrespected like that. After that, he didn't even bother to apologize for his mishap, and instead blamed it on someone else getting the reservation wrong. Talk about welcoming and professional.

The poolside service was lacking, but whenever someone did arrive, it was pleasant- until the later hours of the afternoon. My, the employee who took our twilight order, counted heads, and again we were greeted by none other than the smug and all-knowing Robert, who told my aunt that she wasn't allowed to sit in front of a neighboring cabana which was currently empty and unused, and also threatened both my mom and aunt that he would charge them $200 for merely sitting in front of the cabana to get out of the sun.

He continued to berate us, and yelled at my family in front of a pool filled with people, saying that we disregarded everything he told us in the morning, and threatened us with security to escort us out of the establishment even though we were not being loud, disrupting, not playing any music, or using foul language. When my dad asked if Robert was redirecting his anger from being short-staffed and taking it out on us, he nodded his head and said yes. My mouth was instantly agape, and I was beyond both shocked and appalled to hear this from a manager of such an esteemed establishment. We asked him again if we heard that correctly, and he said yes and stood by his word. Absolutely disgusting behavior coming from a manager.

Robert is a sad and sorry excuse for someone working in customer service, let alone for a manager, and sadly ruined what could've been a relaxing birthday celebration. HIGH END SPA will always leave a sour taste in my mouth because of what my family and I had to endure. I wouldn't recommend HIGH END SPA to anyone if that meant they'd have to suffer Robert's unprofessionalism.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Service has diminished within the past year.  Last year, a group of my friends and I (total of 5) visited HIGH END SPA for a day of relaxation.   We rented a cabana, had massages, and experienced the grotto.   We had such a wonderful time, that we decided to make it an annual event.   Well this year when we visited HIGH END SPA, our experience made us rethink our decision.   The customer service was absolutely horrific.   We made our reservation in July, to ensure we would have the same experience we had last year.   Well upon our arrive at 8:45, our initial experience was a precursor to the remainder of our day.   There was a long line to check in, once we made it to the front of the line, to our amazement there was one security person, checking each person purses and bags with a fine-tooth comb.  She put her hands on everything in my spa bag, even though when I opened it, you could clearly see there was nothing but a bathing suit and some water shoes.  I felt actually invaded.  But I thought to myself, "the day will get better, move on and enjoy the wonderful relaxing day".   Well when we went to check in to get our cabana, we were told there was an additional charge of $50 for the fifth person in our party.   I explained to the manager, we were there last year and had the same amount of people and there was no additional charge that time; and when we reserved, paid for the cabana back in July (and I had communicated that there was 5 of us), the additional charge was not communicated to me.   The manager stated the $50 is a new charge.  So we paid the additional charge, and was guided to our cabana.  When we arrived, there was a lot of bees in the cabana.   The attendant told us they are having a bee problem, because there is a hive close by.  Therefore, keep our food covered, because food tends to attract the bees. Then we noticed that there were only 4 table chairs and 4 loungers.   When we requested an additional chair for our 5th person, we were told they could not provide additional chairs.  I said we paid an additional $50 for the 5th person.   Why are you charging an additional $50 if you are not going to provide the amenities necessary?  The attendant told me because it takes more time to provide service to 5 people.  I thought to myself "nonsense".   We ordered breakfast and several platters, and when our food arrived, we requested additional plates, for the platter, so we could all share, and we were told they did not have any.  
Although the pools at HIGH END SPA and massages are wonderful, something needs to be done about customer service.   1st and foremost, with the amount of money that HIGH END SPA makes each day, they could have hired a professional to come in and take care of the bee problem.   2nd why charge an additional $50 for extra people if you are not going to provide the same amenities.   3rd the check in was an absolute horrible and violating experience and needs to be changed.  Lastly, the communication with the guest needs to be improved.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Spent the whole day on a Monday here. It was raining lightly. I was so worried it was going to spoil our day and it didn't. We managed to do everything we wanted to do. It was I'm guessing less crowded than it normally was. The only thing is maybe it was a little cold when you got out of the pool onto something else.
We got there around 9.45 am. Short line- it went very quickly. Check in was a breeze. Got the total wellness package.
We went to the wine bar and got our wrist bracelets first. Once you get that there's no need for them to check ID every time you order a drink. Got a mimosa and then went to put our stuff away in the lockers which was right next door.
Next stop mineral pools. We managed to snag an individual one that just fits two but why so few? It must be an awful wait for it during the weekends. The mineral water was lovely.
I then had a nourishing facial at the salon. Hailey was wonderful!! My face felt amazing after we were done.  my boyfriend lounged in the bean bag type floats at the lounge pool. Next up was his massage. He got the aroma soul and really loved it too. I waited in the saline pool while he was done.
We then had lunch. While a little pricy, the food was good. Had a chopped salad with some tortilla soup and a glass of Chardonnay from the wiens winery. The line took forever initially because there was only one cashier. They really shouldn't do that during the lunch hour. We sat inside because it was cold. We then went to the hot and cold pools and the vista pool. We made our way to the lap pool for the aqua tone class. Never done a class with weights under water. What fun!! it's just half hour.
We then made it to club mud. There's 4 steps to it.  it!! We went straight into the pool - Not what we were supposed to do. Supposed to go towards the right. Slather yourself with mud and dry yourself in the sauna and then pool and then shower. Oh well.
It would have been nice if the guy in the front had told us that when we came in.
Finally, we went to the grotto. Just loved the grotto!! What a wonderful experience. My skin felt so smooth after all the slathering of lotion.
Had a wonderful day here. Would definitely come back.

userReviewOnlyContent:
My husband and I have been going to HIGH END SPA for about I was planning on taking my daughter out to HIGH END SPA for her birthday, so I went online to look at spa services. I immediately noticed a ticker across the top of their web page announcing, "pre-booked reservations for admission required EVERYDAY". I have never seen this so I called the number given.

I was told that if I wanted to go to HIGH END SPA I would have to either book spa services, or pay a premium on the entrance fee. I asked if I just came out without either, if there would be a problem and I was told that I would NOT be admitted. I confirmed that without booking spa services, we MUST pay the higher entrance rate just to come in, not their posted rate. The customer service rep said that she is "literally not able to say it's mandatory" but that I wouldn't be admitted without booking one or the other, as they "expect to hit capacity". I asked what capacity is and was told HIGH END SPA is creating this "sold out" situation. Without booking a spa service to generate more income, you MUST at least pay an inflated entrance rate or you WILL NOT be let in. They say it's so that they don't have customers drive out, and then be turned away if they're sold out. If that's the case why charge a premium entrance fee? Why not pre-sell admission at the standard entrance rate?

This kind of greed isn't necessary. Furthermore why would you charge customers an inflated rate to contend with huge crowds and long lines? Sorry HIGH END SPA, you can keep your long lines and large crowds.

userReviewOnlyContent: Had to make a spa trip while we were visiting California. I have been seeing pictures of my friends going here and just had me curious for a while, especially the mud bath! We added the Grotto service on to our admission. The Grotto mask was amazing! It was warm and so thick so made your skin feel great after, however it's a so hard to rinse off after. In all reality, I would say the extra you have to pay for the Grotto isn't really worth it. I would just suggest the regular "Taking on the Waters" admission. It's more bang for your buck. The reason I gave 3 instead of 5 stars, was because the locker rooms and bathrooms weren't as clean and they probably could have been. The pools were decent however they should have timers for people on certain ones cause you could spend so long waiting for space in a pool. The drinks were sooo high priced and you have to pay extra for robes which I thought was different since every spa I've gone to has given you ary robes. Little things that added up, however still a fun experience!
