userReviewOnlyContent: Ok, so I've been here a million times and have loved it! I'm not sure if they've changed management or if they have less staffing in January because it's not peak season but today was a pretty nasty experience. For starters when I got into the Jacuzzi this morning there was nasty white scum clods and rings of hair around the bars/rails. It was like 10am lol. I remember in past visits that they would shut down the Jacuzzis and pools every couple hours to clean them so I thought maybe that it was getting close to the cleaning time so I left and came back later in the afternoon around 4 PM and there was even more scum them before and the same hearing was there. Guess they don't clean the pools/jacuzzis anymore and it shows and is disgusting. Next, my husband and I LOVEEEEE The chicken nachos, we get excited to eat them every time we come. Today they were total letdown. Not only are they in a smaller dish now (but same $18 price!) but it was a soggy soup. I couldn't even eat them like nachos because my chips were soggy by the time I got to my table, I didn't even eat half of them. I decided to let it go because I was here to relax and not worry about drama. At the end of the day when I went inside to take a shower the shower nozzle was loose and wouldn't stay in place so if I didn't hold it the entire shower it would scold me with hot water. That was pretty annoying because I enjoy the shower at the end of the day because of the wonderful rain showerheads but it was kind of lame since I had to hold the handle the entire time. Earlier in the day when I was in the caf I asked if I could get a copy of all of today's transactions somewhere at HIGH END SPA and they told me that I could go to the front counter and get a copy of everything that I paid for today (you can put your card on tab and charge all your purchases which is nice so you don't have to carry your wallet around. After showering and getting ready to leave I walk to the front counter to get my print out and she told me that they couldn't do a print out of the food and then I would need to go back to the caf to get a receipt. I want to back to the caf and it was closed. When I told her this she said that she could do a print out but it would take 45 minutes. Ummm what?! What kind of ancient computer system do you have that it takes 45mins to print a copy of my transactions for the day. All of these were little things but then I realized at the end of the day there were about 5 really annoying things that added up to me not having a great experience. Enough to make me wonder if the hour drive and high prices are really worth it anymore. Best part of the day by far was the staff, everyone was super nice and amazing. Even the lady who told me it would take her 45mins to print my receipt was nice lol. Hoping it was just a perfect storm that added up to a lame day for me and that this isn't the norm anymore. Anyways, I WANT THE OLD HIGH END SPA BACK!! I was texting my husband when I first got here that I would prob come here every few months to detox and chill but prob not anymore. If you come to get a massage ask for Alexandra!!!! She was amazing!!

userReviewOnlyContent: Super overpriced and overhyped day spa. There is nothing relaxing about having to fight crowds to get to the bathroom, showers, and bar/restaurant. I feel i spent most of my "relaxing" morning just waiting in lines...to eat, to drink, to pee. The property is not well maintained considering the amount of people they can have just in one morning. Things get really dirty real quick and it seems they cant keep up. The food was mediocre at best, and there's not that many options so you're basically stuck eating whatever bland food they have to offer. The massages are OK nothing amazing or out of this world. This just seems like a spot where instamodels come to take pictures and where people come for bachelorettes to get drunk and sloppy. Walked out feeling everything but relaxed.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I went to HIGH END SPA maybe 12 or 15 years ago and loved it.  So when it was suggested to me as a little respite from the craziness of the world for a day, I was all in.  While we did have a good time, it was pretty much as many of these other reviews talk about:
***Incredibly expensive: From the entrance fee of $75 to the high cost food/drinks and then services on top of it...ugh I just felt like I was getting ripped off all day
***Incredibly crowded: Like so crowded we had trouble finding 2 chairs together at 10 in the morning.  
***Hard to enjoy the cool amenities with max capacity being met: I know I just said it's incredibly crowded but I feel like I should make a special note that during the summer they are often hitting max occupancy.  That means people are getting turned away at the door and that everything the facilities have to offer, is being used to the max.  It's just not relaxing...it's Disneyland.

So there are still bright spots of course:
***The wellness areas are cool: I like the mud area and the hot springs and the hot/cool plunges.  They are included in the entrance fee and without them there would be no point in coming here as opposed to another day spa.
***The Grotto: I loved the Grotto treatment where they paint you with this moisturizing goodness and then you sit on these damp rocks for as long as you want until you have a fantastic shower and tea/apples.  It's all underground and gorgeous and novel.  Not sure it's worth the price but it is certainly a one-time must-do.
***Free Parking: For as much as they rake you over the coals on everything else, I appreciate that the parking is free if you self-park.

So I am not sure when we will come back.  I had a group of girlfriends that wanted to do a spa day and we coordinated with HIGH END SPA to secure cabanas here....but as we were adding up the cost of paying for the cabana PLUS entrance fee PLUS services PLUS food/drinks we quickly discovered that we could go somewhere else for half the price and much nicer, less crowded facilities.

***Incredibly expensive: From the entrance fee of $75 to the high cost food/drinks and then services on top of it...ugh I just felt like I was getting ripped off all day
***Incredibly crowded: Like so crowded we had trouble finding 2 chairs together at 10 in the morning.  
***Hard to enjoy the cool amenities with max capacity being met: I know I just said it's incredibly crowded but I feel like I should make a special note that during the summer they are often hitting max occupancy.  That means people are getting turned away at the door and that everything the facilities have to offer, is being used to the max.  It's just not relaxing...it's Disneyland.

So there are still bright spots of course:
***The wellness areas are cool: I like the mud area and the hot springs and the hot/cool plunges.  They are included in the entrance fee and without them there would be no point in coming here as opposed to another day spa.
***The Grotto: I loved the Grotto treatment where they paint you with this moisturizing goodness and then you sit on these damp rocks for as long as you want until you have a fantastic shower and tea/apples.  It's all underground and gorgeous and novel.  Not sure it's worth the price but it is certainly a one-time must-do.
***Free Parking: For as much as they rake you over the coals on everything else, I appreciate that the parking is free if you self-park.

So I am not sure when we will come back.  I had a group of girlfriends that wanted to do a spa day and we coordinated with HIGH END SPA to secure cabanas here....but as we were adding up the cost of paying for the cabana PLUS entrance fee PLUS services PLUS food/drinks we quickly discovered that we could go somewhere else for half the price and much nicer, less crowded facilities.

userReviewOnlyContent:
We had an amazing time here at HIGH END SPA. I took a team of employees for a relaxing day at the spa. What started out as a day to relax quickly became hectic as one of my team members shoes had been taken from the first pool we went into. We asked security to check for lost and found and they weren't there either. They could tell my guest was visibly upset as these were expensive sandals and she did not want to be barefoot all day. As one person was checking another person went to the gift shop and brought a new pair of sandals for her to wear.

We continued to relax in multiple pools and stopped for a delicious drink. I highly recommend their lava flows. The line was a little long and didn't move as quickly as we would have liked but after that we switched to having the server around the pool get drinks for us. Hector was great! He was genuinely nice and laughed with us as he got our orders.

After pool hopping a few more times we went to the cafe and had the nachos that are to die for! The flavor is amazing and the size is huge! We could have easily split the large one between the After lunch as we were walking around security came to find us and they had found my employees shoes! They still let her keep the ones she had been wearing but we were so happy that even though half the day had passed they had not forgotten about us and didn't give up!

We finished in club mud and it was an experience in itself! We can't wait to go again and are already planning the next outing!

userReviewOnlyContent:
Wow! My vacations are usually fast paced, but our friends invited us to HIGH END SPA after our Disney trip and it looked too good to pass up.
We started by grabbing drinks at the bar- all cocktails are wine based and $10.50. You can put a card on file and just use your phone number which is much easier than paying with a card! A few of the pools we hit were the mineral, sulfur (remember to remove all jewelry), hot/cold baths (my husband did those and loved it) and of course club mud! The mud was surprisingly relaxing and fun. Definitely wear a suit you don't mind getting dirty!
The Grotto was a fun experience as well! No drinks are allowed past the entry to reach the elevators. Basically you stand in a stall and an attendant paints you with hot green oils/lotion! After that you go into a room that is similar to a sauna and hang out to let the moisturizer soak in (you put it all over your hair and face as well for the full benefits). They didn't tell us, but they recommend staying in that room for 15 mins (we had to go ask). Unfortunately there were other people who were being loud, even though there were many signs, which made it hard to totally zen out. Once everything is washed off, you go into the cold room where they have tea options and yummy green apples!
Lunch was also fabulous! I had a chopped salad and carrot cake. So good! They offer many options, such as wraps, flatbreads and sandwiches.
An added bonus is the Starbucks they have right near the entrance! Perfect when you're on the way out!
I can't wait to return to HIGH END SPA in the near future and hopefully book a massage or another added experience to our day!!!

userReviewOnlyContent:
This spa was a lot smaller than I thought. With that said, I was still able to spend a whole day there. The spa actually provided many toiletries such as shampoo, conditioner, soap and unlimited towels - all the basics! They also provide free lockers which was helpful since I was in and out of mine all day.

In the locker room, they obviously have a lockers and showers but also a wet sauna and a huge indoor jaccuzi tub. I found the jaccuzi temp to be comparable to some of the ones outside. I hung out in the lounge pool where they had mats and beanbags for you to lay in the water which is where I read a lot of my book.

They also had:
*A hot tub and cold plunge pool next to it which I was too chicken to go into since it wasn't the warmest day
*2 more Jacuzzi which I felt were pretty much the same temperature so I alternated between those just to get a change of scenery
*A couple dry saunas that can fit about 6 people each
*An area with some mats and a couple of hammocks
*Some couple sized sulfer baths
*A massage area which I didn't use/can't afford

My favorite was Club Mud. You put mud on yourself, go into a slightly heated room to let it dry and then wash it off. My skin felt sooo smooth after and I couldn't stop touching it!

I came in early Jan on a Fri and luckily the weather was not too cold to sit out. It also didn't have as many people as I know it could. It was mostly couples and bachelorette parties. I would highly suggest going on a weekday if you can since it'll be a lot less crowded and more comfortable.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I used to love HIGH END SPA, but it has seriously deteriorated.

Like others have mentioned, it can be overcrowded and ghetto, with many drunk people being obnoxiously loud (without being cut off, appropriately). The resulting chaos is not something any sane person would enjoy, especially when HIGH END SPA is advertised as some quiet, zen paradise.

Staff is so-so. Some servers have been great -- and if you find one that is attentive, hold on to them, because most are in their own world, and too busy chit chatting/flirting with each other to actually pay attention to you.

I have seen wads of thick hairs and other unidentifiable gunk, in the pools. The water looked cloudy, dirty, and disgustingly unhygienic.

My sister and I caught a cold the last two times we were here. Staff should not be working with food and beverages while obviously sick!

Good luck if you have any concerns or complaints. Management is rude, lacks integrity, and is incompetent. They lie to cover themselves. It's all about the money. They don't seem to honestly care about the guests.

HIGH END SPA is sadly a disappointment. If you had been here years ago, you would have loved it. This is not the mother-daughter spa day, it used to be.

8/12/2019
I've been to HIGH END SPA during the day, several times in the past, but not within the past 5 years or so. I always loved it, until recently. This past weekend I went to the Twilight portion for a friend's birthday. We were all VERY disappointed. Every pool and spa was completely overcrowded, no chairs or lounges were available, they all had multiple towels stacked on them.

POOLS/SPAS: The water in every pool and spa looked dirty and cloudy from being used and overcrowded all day. Coming at 4 pm, It felt like getting into someone's dirty bathwater.

SERVICE: People in our group were also double charged for drinks after the waiter told them there was an issue with their phone number being set up and it wasn't allowing him to charge it. The nachos were good but not as good as they used to be. We were also told to exit the pools and spas at 830, when we paid for entrance from 4-9. It should be our choice if we want to spend that last 30 minutes in the pool, when it was FILLY not crowded.. or showering and getting dolled up. (Not me!)

We probably won't ever come back for twilight. I think they should be totally separate. Day people should have to leave, and they need to totally close to clean and filter/clean the water before twilight groups can check in. VERY disappointed.

My check in experience was seamless, but it started to go down hill almost immediately. My friend and I got croissant sandwiches from Starbucks which was not good at all. There were more grapes and cucumbers on the sandwich than chicken. In addition, the chicken was poor quality. It was definitely not organic and was fatty, fat should not be in chicken salad.

I then had a pedicure, which was great. She was very nice and professional. She did an amazing job and was very thorough.

I later went to the north pool and ordered a drink. I saw the charge for the Over the course of the next couple of hours, I saw multiple charges hit my credit card. I hadn't purchased anything else after two failed attempts at food and drinks. So I was very baffled as to why I had additional charges to my credit card. I later went to the front check in desk and requested to speak to a manager to understand why my card was charged so many times.  The manager looked over my charges and I spoke to her about my experience with the drink. I didn't bring up the sandwich because they look like they weren't made in house, so that is just probably just poor purchasing from from a corporate level. She took off the tip I gave for my drink since there was an issue with the So there should be a charge for my pedicure, the starbucks croissant sandwich, and the The whole experience is not seamless at all. I definitely feel that carrying my card around all day and just swiping it each time would have been way easier. It is extremely apparent that you guys don't have this process down packed. userReviewContent:
8/5/2019
I had a very lackluster experience. I was under the impression that HIGH END SPA was a supposed to be a luxury experience, but I have have a better experience at Chic fil a....... which says a lot. I was very underwhelmed.

My check in experience was seamless, but it started to go down hill almost immediately. My friend and I got croissant sandwiches from Starbucks which was not good at all. There were more grapes and cucumbers on the sandwich than chicken. In addition, the chicken was poor quality. It was definitely not organic and was fatty, fat should not be in chicken salad.

I then had a pedicure, which was great. She was very nice and professional. She did an amazing job and was very thorough.

I later went to the north pool and ordered a drink. I saw the charge for the 1 drink get posted to my credit card but didn't receive my drink  for another 10 to 15 minutes.  Once it came out she said an additional drink was accidently made and asked if I wanted it. I said sure and signed my receipt for 1 drink and I added a tip.  I then got another notification for the charge of the 2nd drink. Not only did the server not mention that she would be charging me for the 2nd drink that I didn't order, but she didn't even bring me a new slip so sign with the new amount. Charging someone's card for an amount that they did not agree to is very unethical.  I have worked as a server and bartender and I have never charged someone for something they didn't explicitly agree to pay for. In addition, she sold it to me as a mango margarita, the drink came out spicy which was not something I would ever order. But I didn't make a big deal about it because I knew she was busy. But when the server came back out and wasn't busy, I asked her if she had in fact charged me for the  2nd drink and she stated that she did.

Over the course of the next couple of hours, I saw multiple charges hit my credit card. I hadn't purchased anything else after two failed attempts at food and drinks. So I was very baffled as to why I had additional charges to my credit card. I later went to the front check in desk and requested to speak to a manager to understand why my card was charged so many times.  The manager looked over my charges and I spoke to her about my experience with the drink. I didn't bring up the sandwich because they look like they weren't made in house, so that is just probably just poor purchasing from from a corporate level. She took off the tip I gave for my drink since there was an issue with the 2nd drink and assured me that there were no additional charges to the 3 mentioned below. She said the additional charges on there would fall off.

So there should be a charge for my pedicure, the starbucks croissant sandwich, and the 1 drink. That plus the pending charges that she stated were going to fall off. Upon leaving the resort, after what was supposed to be an relaxing and enjoyable end to my birthday celebration, I received another charge to my credit card. At this point I am in my car and still have not made any purchases since the last drink which was hours before I last spoke to a manager. I don't know what that charge is for and why there were additional charges after I went over everything with the manager?

The whole experience is not seamless at all. I definitely feel that carrying my card around all day and just swiping it each time would have been way easier. It is extremely apparent that you guys don't have this process down packed. There is only 3 receipts that you guys should have with my signature on it, so what are the other charges for? Disappointed is an understatement to say the least.  

Overall the views and property are gorg, the representatives at the front desk are great and the woman who did my pedicure was bomb.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I have heard about this spa so it has always been on my list to check out. I finally had a chance to try it out and was it disappointing. I understand they get busy over the summer so that wasn't the reason why HIGH END SPA gets 3 stars. My reasons for the 3 stars are:
1.  Not a spa feeling at all!! I've been to many spas from high end luxury to the Asians ones and they all have one thing in common. A spa is a quite place but not at HIGH END SPA. Every pool was a party, the sauna was so loud, the indoor spa was echoing from the yelling of the people at the spa. If you are looking for a quiet spa feel this is not it.
2. It's old and really needs a renovation. I was really disappointed in everything. I checked in for my spa service and sat in a room that looked like a dentist office. No comfy lounge chairs with cucumbers waiting for you. It did not smell like a spa but more like an old building. They have a crazy amount of bees!! EVERYWHERE!! It was so annoying sitting having lunch and bees were all over my food.
I have no desire to return unless they make some changes.

userReviewOnlyContent: Another world type of place so close to home! My best friend and i have been multiple times over the years, we make it a girls getaway every year. This place is absolutely beautiful , its so relaxing and so much to do, the day flies by. The staff is very friendly and helpful , the services are vast and they never disappoint.  We love to go and dip in every pool while sipping some wine. They have activities like water aerobics and things like that. There is no need to book a service , you can pay for entrance and just enjoy the beautiful setting. During the summer they have a live band in the evening which is very neat and entertaining. There is a few bars just around the spa and a cafeteria which has a large selection of food, the portions are pretty large so they are shareable. I cant wait to go back soon!

userReviewOnlyContent: I have mixed feelings about the spa. It was truly a nice and peaceful place. However, for the price I definitely expected more especially for $300+ for 3 people and massages. The facility is big, but not as big as I expected. The pools look a bit out dated and I felt like the water got darker as the day came to a close, meaning it looked dirtier. The food was decent, but the food court look doesnt really go with the ambience of the spa. I was expecting something more upscale, not a mall like feel . Over all it was okay nothing spectacular. I would maybe comeback for a chill Sunday nothing more. For the same price I would prefer a spa in Vegas at a high end hotel.

userReviewOnlyContent:
"Thank you for calling HIGH END SPA hot springs. At this time we are experiencing a higher call volume than normal. I assure you our agents are working diligently to accommodate all of our guests. We do sincerely apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your patience. Our queue is currently full"

I've called over I had planned on booking a cabana and services for my wife's birthday. HIGH END SPA made this impossible.

Perhaps implement a call back feature or hire more of your diligent agents to actually pick up the phone?  As a relaxing destination, the struggle to book anything is the exact opposite of what HIGH END SPA aims to be.  What a disappointment.

UPDATE:  I Finally got through (!!), selected "reservations" in the options menu and............. the line went silent as it went straight to someones message box and they hung up on me.  Why am I still trying?  How do I give zero stars?  Somehow the lost and found phone number has a separate reservations line that I waited in for BOTTOM LINE: their main phone number rarely works.  Call lost and found, select option 2, select the option for a call back and you'll be talking to someone at HIGH END SPA within a few hours.  Unfortunately, that appears to be the best one can expect if you need to call for reservations/cancellations.  Best of luck!
userReviewContent:
7/2/2019
"Thank you for calling HIGH END SPA hot springs. At this time we are experiencing a higher call volume than normal. I assure you our agents are working diligently to accommodate all of our guests. We do sincerely apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your patience. Our queue is currently full"

I've called over 75 times over the last few days and received this automated response every single time. Morning, afternoon, right before closing.. doesn't matter. They are apparently flooded with phone calls at all times of the day. I also tried emailing them directly, no response to either. Simply put, their reservation and customer service systems are a joke.

I had planned on booking a cabana and services for my wife's birthday. HIGH END SPA made this impossible.

Perhaps implement a call back feature or hire more of your diligent agents to actually pick up the phone?  As a relaxing destination, the struggle to book anything is the exact opposite of what HIGH END SPA aims to be.  What a disappointment.

UPDATE:  I Finally got through (!!), selected "reservations" in the options menu and............. the line went silent as it went straight to someones message box and they hung up on me.  Why am I still trying?  How do I give zero stars?  Somehow the lost and found phone number has a separate reservations line that I waited in for 45 minutes. Someone eventually answered and was able to assist.

BOTTOM LINE: their main phone number rarely works.  Call lost and found, select option 2, select the option for a call back and you'll be talking to someone at HIGH END SPA within a few hours.  Unfortunately, that appears to be the best one can expect if you need to call for reservations/cancellations.  Best of luck!

userReviewOnlyContent:
I see so many bad reviews. I've been twice in the last Sure its a little crowded, but that's because its a popular and lovely place to be. I actually thought the playful energy was great! It is definitely something different from the classy, quiet, swimsuit-optional hot spring resorts like many I have been to. I recommend going on a weekday.

The food is a little overpriced, that I agree with. Otherwise it was nice and clean and such a respite from daily life. I snuck in a bottle of wine using The Force, and my girls and I had a blast! (Don't worry HIGH END SPA, we still bought booze from you too ;-)

userReviewOnlyContent:
Went here for the first time and was seriously impressed all around! I knew this place books up fast so I called a few weeks early to schedule a massage and admission on a summer weekday. The checkin process at One drawback was the lounge chair situation, there are not enough for how many people are there. I didn't take off a star though, because you honestly don't need a lounge chair, there are so many pools to go into and relax. My massage was great and our experience with the kitchen was awesome and quick on the day we went. Make sure you have them add a card on file so you don't have to lug one around :)

I was mostly impressed with the value to the dollar. I know some reviews are contrary to that, but for about $This is a quick drive away from San Diego (we hit no traffic!) and I definitely plan on being back. This would also be a totally comfortable place to treat yourself to a self-care day alone :)
userReviewContent:
7/18/2019
Went here for the first time and was seriously impressed all around! I knew this place books up fast so I called a few weeks early to schedule a massage and admission on a summer weekday. The checkin process at 9:30 AM was less busy than anticipated which was nice! Make sure you read your email on "what to know" because the front desk doesn't give you info on lockers, alcohol wristband etc. The facilities are overall maintained incredibly well considering how many people are there! It could get gross really fast but every area was clean, including the bathrooms.

One drawback was the lounge chair situation, there are not enough for how many people are there. I didn't take off a star though, because you honestly don't need a lounge chair, there are so many pools to go into and relax. My massage was great and our experience with the kitchen was awesome and quick on the day we went. Make sure you have them add a card on file so you don't have to lug one around :)

I was mostly impressed with the value to the dollar. I know some reviews are contrary to that, but for about $50 admission you get consistent towels available, water stations and shower stations at club mud along with nice toiletries, qtips, blowdriers etc in the bathrooms. They could easily nickel and dime for all of those but I felt truly pampered and VIP with just general admission.

This is a quick drive away from San Diego (we hit no traffic!) and I definitely plan on being back. This would also be a totally comfortable place to treat yourself to a self-care day alone :)

userReviewOnlyContent:
Spent the day here for a girlfriends birthday!

I had a fun experience here. HIGH END SPA is huge. They offer many things to do when you pay for your package. I was able to go to the mud spa, sauna, heated pool, and many other mineral pools. They also offer other amenities such as a massage but it would cost extra. This is a nice getaway to relax. We were able to order food and drinks at our cabana.

One of our girlfriends ended up drinking way too much mimosa. She fell over the stairs and hit her head. She got immediate attention and the ambulance came. After that, we went to the nearest hospital to get her examined. She got a minor head injury. Thankfully she was ok and the day was already ending.

userReviewOnlyContent: I've been going to HIGH END SPA for years.  I believe they changed ownership/management a few years ago which means they are marketing it more and it is always more packed so it's harder to get a lounge chair.  We went today because we thought there would be less people there on a Friday than on a Saturday or Sunday.  There were a lot of people there when we arrived around noon.  We made reservations to ensure we didn't get turned away.  Our bags were checked and I was politely asked to empty the contents of my water bottle prior to entering.  There are signs that state that no outside food or drink are allowed inside.  Everyone was extremely polite.  We got our lounge chairs right away.  There is plenty of free ice water with cups available for patrons.  Servers frequently pass by and ask if they can get patrons food or drink.  I got a frozen blended peach Bellini.  It was $9 but it was also delicious.  The servers are very nice and professional.  They deliver the drinks pool side.  We ate a late lunch at the cafe.  We shared the large chicken nachos which were a value at $25.  The portion was huge and big enough for 4 people to share.  We had reservations for massages.  They don't do deep tissue massage.  They do aromatherapy massage.  I was given my choice of CBD oil, basil citrus oil, or jasmine vanilla oil.  I chose the jasmine vanilla oil.  It was very pleasant.  The massage was good.  The gift shop at HIGH END SPA is one of my favorites.  Everything is pricey and overpriced but the women that work in there are so nice and they have really cute things.  The overall experience today was wonderful but I gave them four stars because it's a little pricey and they are always trying to upsell.  If you've never been, I recommend going but be prepared to spend some money when you go.

userReviewOnlyContent:
DISGUSTING! This is NOT a REAL SPA! Ever been to Raging Waters? HIGH END SPA is just like that! It's a joke! An overpriced public pool. The waters were nasty! Thick film of urine and sunscreen floating on top,not to mention all the dead bugs. The mud bath looked like sewage. People are disgusting folks! I wonder how often they actually
REPLACE the mud pile? (everyone shares the SAME mud AND people were rubbing the mud all over their bodies and rubbing between their legs, their armpits etc. and then they rub it on each other and then
put their nasty hands BACK into the mud pool to grab grab MORE and rub it on their faces??! do people even realize they're rubbing other people's germs and dead skin cells all over their faces?! The worst part is that these idiots go back into the mud pool to RINSE and pass all their filfth onto the next moron that rubs it all over themselves! You should ONLY take mud from the mud pile on the OUTSIDE of the mud pool. (Even this is disgusting but at least it's not used mud. At least I hope? Who knows how often they put out a new supply of mud?) This "mud attraction" should be shut down and banned from the health department! Trust me I'm a licensed esthetician! This place is STY! It's not a true spa experience  It's for amateurs. And they do nothing about noise control either. It's more of a place where loud obnoxious girls come to bachelorette parties. also, they serve alcohol here. Which is nice, but most of these loud obnoxious b's are dumb and drunk. There is no control over this. To make matters worse, MGMT TOLD me that they OVERSELL their day passes, which means that anyone arriving after 9 a.m. has to RUN  for a chair or you will not get one. It's a theme park. Disneyland is more relaxing. This place is a joke!

userReviewOnlyContent:
I had a nice day here with my friends. My review is slightly bias because my friend treated me for the day, so I literally did not pay for anything. Had I payed my own way I likely would be more bothered by things I experienced. I came on a holiday weekend (Labor Day) so perhaps that is why it was so chaotic. It definitely had more of a loud party atmosphere than a quiet relaxing one (fine with me considering my circumstances) but if that's what your after maybe go elsewhere or when it's not so busy. Every other group had portable speakers, the quiet signs were not enforced, long line to get in, long line for drinks, our grotto appointment felt rushed, workers seemed tired. The grotto amenities were lacking. Tea station was lazy and they give you apples afterward. Just seems lazy and for the price they're asking seems like they'd do more.

On the flip side the grounds were clean, food (chicken nachos) was yummy, the other spa goers were nice and fun. I love the concept of the natural hot springs and there's lots that comes included with general admission (club mud, mineral baths, several pools, sulfur bath)

I'd go again, but maybe on an off season.

I was extremely excited for a day of relaxation but was disappointed in the service I receive at the South Spa. My appointment was at In regards to the kitchen, the people working there are not trained on preventing cross contamination. When I came to counter to order food, the guy working the area was preparing an order for the person in front of me. When it was my turn, I stated I wanted a poke salad. Instead of washing hands and changing gloves, he changed one glove and then proceeded to grab a knife off counter and wipe it with a wet towel that looked soiled from the back counter. I instantly changed my mind and went for the pre-packaged items.

On a positive note, the pools are well kept and the staff is very approachable and friendly throughout the resort. The Bath House was clean and towels were always readily available.

I was extremely excited for a day of relaxation but was disappointed in the service I receive at the South Spa. My appointment was at 5:00 pm so I arrived 15 minutes early as recommended by the front counter staff, but therapist did not bring me back in the room until after 5:00. During the massage I asked if it was possible to adjust the temperature on the bed because it was extremely cold. She informed me that it was on the highest level. I explained to her that I was extremely cold but she continued with the massage. The lotion and oils were cold as well. When she was finished I looked at the time and it was 5:50 which means I did not get my full 50 minutes of therapy.  

In regards to the kitchen, the people working there are not trained on preventing cross contamination. When I came to counter to order food, the guy working the area was preparing an order for the person in front of me. When it was my turn, I stated I wanted a poke salad. userReviewOnlyContent: If you haven't been to HIGH END SPA, STOP WHAT YOU'RE DOING and GO!!! The facility is incredible. So many different pools and spaces to relax. I absolutely love floating on the giant bean bags in the main pool and relaxing in the California sun. The services are amazing as well but you can easily enjoy the facility without doing anything extra. I highly recommend the Grotto, it's pretty inexpensive and it's a truly enjoyable experience. They start you off by taking you down an elevator into what feels like a real cave. After they lather you down with a warm combination of creams and oils with a giant paintbrush (feels amazing) you head over to a heated part of the grotto and relax and let all the oils soak into your skin. You can let it soak for is long as you want and after you're done there are showers you can shower off with and they send you to the next part of the grotto where they provide apples, hot tea and water. It is a divine experience and your skin feels like baby skin afterwards! Club Mud is also very soothing. It's pretty fun to hop into the mud bath and coat yourself with a nice, thick layer of therapeutic mud. After laying in the sun and letting it bake until it gets hard, you can peel it all off and reveal glowing, exfoliated skin! The cafe has really good food and the dressing rooms are top-notch. Well worth the entry fee! If you're thinking of checking this place out, stop thinking and schedule an appointment! My best friend and I have made this an annual trip to celebrate our birthdays and it's something we truly look forward to every year!

userReviewOnlyContent: This was a spa day long overdue. With work being extremely hectic and holidays around the corner our boss decided when needed a day away from work. I've heard of HIGH END SPA before but just thought it was only pools. I got to go with two coworkers who are amazing ladies. We all met up at our office at 9am and fasttraked it to corona which definitely saved time. Upon arrival we checked in and changed into our swimsuits. It was a great weather day not too hot or too cold. The first one we tried was the ice plunge. Which is 5minutes in a hot spring jazzuci and then 60seconds in a cold pool. It was intense. But I did it five times and after that my back pain and muscles were non-existent. Next we made it over to the lounge pool and grabbed some floaties and I fell asleep. Then off to lunch to nibble a bit. We all shared nachos, pizza and sandwiches. Nachos were to die for. After our tummies were satisified we played in mud and helped cover each other head to toe when then left to the sulfur baths (my coworker called them fart tubs) and let it take out those yucky toxins and open up pores. We had a standing 2pm appointment with the grotto. Signed some waivers and were led underground by a sweet guy named bryan. I think we made his day he was laughing with us when my coworker asked him to paint her like one of his french girls (like jack in titanic) he just laughed with us and kept going. After we were painted we did a hotttttt sauna for 15minutes then showered off and relaxed in the cold room with barrels of apples, teas and waters. Overall a great day I feel like im a lot closer now with these two coworkers and its a fun place to go with a group or as a couple. Ill go back when I really need that ice plunge bath again and the grotto.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Oh HIGH END SPA, the oasis of the IE. A place where you truly enter a world of bliss and pure relaxation. Tucked away in the hills of Corona, this spot is unlike any other. From it's beautiful landscaping to its many pools, there is something here for everyone. Free parking is provided. Little ponds throughout the ground even
provide a home for some tiny friends, turtles.
Entry fees are higher on the weekends and have a birthday special with free admission with certain terms and conditions. With your entry fee you receive use of the locker room, access to HIGH END SPA's many pools, the mud bath, water aerobics, and much more. Upon entering your bags are checked by an employee before you step into the lobby to pay. From there you can browse the gift shop or head to the locker rooms.
 Inside the locker rooms it's HUGE! A changing area, bathrooms, lockers, a Roman bath, showers, and a sauna. This place is epic! So once you change to your swimwear it's time to check everything out! You can book massages, facials, or grotto services with the attendants outside the locker room. I HIGHLY recommend booking your services in advance since they tend to book up fast. The grotto is an underground cave where you receive a body treatment applied to your skin by an attendant, painted on like a body mask. Then you hangout in an underground rock cave for 20 minutes or so while it dries before finding off in one of the beautiful rock showers. While you wait to dry they serve ice water, hot tea, and apples.
One of the best things about HIGH END SPA is the food. From the amazing sangria to the chicken nachos, you can't go wrong. The nachos are huge!!!! Two people could easily share a full order and still get full. The food is a little pricy but well worth it with freshness and portions.
My favorite part of HIGH END SPA I'd say is the mud bath. You dip into a giant pool full of muddy water where you cover yourself in the red clay mud and laugh as you look at one another like a swamp monster. If you'd rather not go into the mud pool they have a separate clay station for our more skeptical friends.
So if you're looking for a fun bachelorette activity, a pre baby day with your friends, or just a romantic day with your honey this is the place.

userReviewOnlyContent:
First time visitor, so I cannot compare and contrast on what it used to be like.  However I suspect any changes were done to accommodate more people more efficiently, and such is the curse of becoming more popular.  We went mid-week in the summer, and it was certainly full of people, but we did not feel that we were overly crowded.  The one area that probably should have expanded is the mineral baths in front.  They always seem to be at On arrival to the facility we felt very welcomed. The front desk staff was very helpful in planning our day. The grounds look beautiful and were immaculately cared for.  We felt very special and privileged to be there. We utilized both the salon and the massage services, and were very pleased with our therapies.  Everything was handled professionally.  

The Grotto was an interesting experience as well. Club Mud seemed fine to us, and reminded me of the red clay beach at Gay Head on Martha's Vineyard!  The food and drink prices were not cheap, but nothing I didn't expect at a "resort". The food was quite good, and it is prepared fresh to order, buffet style - again designed to serve a lot of people efficiently.  

My wife pointed out that the male to female ratio was about 1 to 40!  That might be a slight exaggeration.  If you were at all worried that you don't have the best physique for a spa like this, you can rest assured that you have nothing to worry about.  The odds are very high that you will not be the most out-of-shape person sporting a bathing suit at this facility!  I consider that a good thing, and really nobody is judging you - so come and have a great time no matter who you are.

userReviewOnlyContent:
My first time here was been nothing short but amazing. Everyone that worked here was friendly and helpful. The services I booked where right on time for the appointments. Loved the aloe vera grotto. It's a must try! Club mud leaves your skin feeling so soft! Food had big portions and was delicious. Massages and treatments were wonderful.

The only con is having to still pay for admission even if you booked treatments for the day.

Tips- check the calendar online to see what activities are planned that day, in case you wanted to book your appointments around it.

Bring two bathing suites. Especially if you're doing club mud and getting massages.

If your car is dirty, you can get a car wash here for $30, which includes valet. They did a fantastic job at washing the outside and inside of my car.

userReviewOnlyContent: I love CHIROPRACTIC!! I have been a patient for over 6 years! I even worked here for 3 years! I started seeing DOCTOR for a car accident i had back in 2011 DOCTOR is very patient and knowledgeable! DOCTOR is also amazing! They have helped me stay healthy and taught me a lot about the spine and nervous system and the importance of maintaining it. I no longer work there but still go in at least twice a month for massage and adjustment. Dr.Bahng the acupuncturist has helped me alongside DOCTOR with anxiety and pms issues! Its the most effective and long term treatment I've ever done! Im 8 months pregnant and have been going for pregnancy adjustments and will go see Dr. Bahng for induction.  They cover most insurances and of they dont they have a great cash option. They are upfront and honest with billing.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I've been to HIGH END SPA three times. My review is for my most recent experience. I will say that the first couple times I have gone I'll admit it gets sooooo packed, and it's kind of gross, you literally can't see the bottom of the pool bc there are bodies everywhere cramping in every possible little corner. You can't put your towel on a chair... actually good luck in finding a chair, the lines for the food and drinks are ridiculous and of course overpriced. It ruins the experience bc you are seriously just waiting for space in any pool. BUT....

Today I don't know if it's because it's December and people think it is cold, but it was not packed at all. My experience when it wasn't like sardine packed was amazing. My husband and I got to go to every pool more than once and got to fully experience the whole area with as much time as we wanted. I even discovered there was something called a secret garden, which I didn't even know existed the last couple times I went. It's a cute little area in like a grass section with two huge hammocks, which yes bc it wasn't so crowded me and my husband both got to chill on a hammock as long as we wanted, I fell asleep actually ahhaha. I was so relaxed.

The experience this time gets four stars because I really enjoyed the whole place and got to spend as little or as long of a time I wanted at ALL of the areas. My personal favorite pool is the mineral baths that smells like sulfur and the Epsom salts one. I really felt it cleansed my skin and helped relax my muscles. My husband loved the hot and cold pools, he felt it really helped with his blood circulation and his tense muscles (he plays a lot of basketball). The saunas are actually a cool experience too with different oaks burning, it was different. The mud area is definitely an experience, it really exfoliates your skin and leaves your skin super soft, and it makes for great photos!

The facilities itself is very clean and kept up. I did not meet one staff member who wasn't super friendly and welcoming...good job on the customer service skills!! The  kitchen which is the only area you can buy food, actually serves really good food, but again it costs like an arm and a leg. My favorite item was the ahi burger, a huge slice of seared ahi, and their aoli sauce/slaw was super flavorful on a toasted brioche bun.

Besides the many different pools, the saunas, different areas to relax in and the mud area, HIGH END SPA offers extra services such as personal massages, pedicures or manicures, facials etc. My husband and I did a couples massage and we both wanted to shout out our therapists. Both were super professional, respectful and did a great job on our massages. If you want a good massage at HIGH END SPA I highly recommend Cheri and he recommends Samantha. Thanks girls!

In the end, I love that this is offered in this area. It was an amazing experience.... again when it is not packed. I do think it IS pricey, for the price we pay for all the services I think a ary robe should be included. We rented the robes for $Tip: if you book a massage you get a discount on the admission. Also if you are a nurse, you get a discount too, just show your badge!

You are pampered here tho, it does just come with a pricetag, our grand total was about $500 dollars for about 5 hours. This place is more of like a once a year or even every 2 years kind of place for me because of the price.

Tip: if you book a massage you get a discount on the admission. Also if you are a nurse, you get a discount too, just show your badge!

userReviewOnlyContent: Came here for a second time yesterday for my boyfriends birthday. We arrived later in the day around 3pm and the receptionist was kind enough to offer a 10% discount since we didn't have much time before they closed at 6. We were able to enjoy and explore all of the pools as well as the mud bath. Everyone we encountered was so friendly and hospitable. The grounds were well kept and we constantly saw workers picking up towels/drinks/etc. to ensure a clean and relaxing environment. I have no complaints, just wish I could come more often.

userReviewOnlyContent:
The little things add up. I really hope the management is taking constructive reviews into consideration but it doesn't seem to be so. Wanted to pull out all the stops and treat my mom to a "just because" mother daughter day. Big thanks to my masseuse Valentina and Tammy in the salon. We thoroughly enjoyed the services we received, though the check in At the nail salon was super hectic. Obnoxious people crowding the front desk all trying to check in at the same time talking loudly. This is not a relaxing place to be.

For the luxury price tag on entry and cabana rental in addition to This is not a quiet, serene place to unwind. The vibe was very "rose all day". Too many loud party people. Even in the off season. Also, please figure out a better system for re entry. People who smoke cigarettes are still human beings. Paying customers. Treat them as such. We will be spending our future spa days elsewhere.
userReviewContent:
11/22/2019
The little things add up. I really hope the management is taking constructive reviews into consideration but it doesn't seem to be so. Wanted to pull out all the stops and treat my mom to a "just because" mother daughter day. Big thanks to my masseuse Valentina and Tammy in the salon. We thoroughly enjoyed the services we received, though the check in At the nail salon was super hectic. Obnoxious people crowding the front desk all trying to check in at the same time talking loudly. This is not a relaxing place to be.

For the luxury price tag on entry and cabana rental in addition to 400$ in services I would at least like to feel valued as a guest. The pillows in our ($200 per day) cabana were stained with fake tan. My mom requested no tomato on her sandwich, it was delivered with tomato (no biggie, it was promptly replaced) Then I discovered that my (albeit, tasty) chicken Cesar salad had no chicken. I politely alerted our concierge who informed me that they just yesterday began charging an extra 5$ for chicken but had *not yet* changed it on the menu. They honored the old menu and brought me some refrigerated deli cubed chicken. Not warm or freshly grilled. 17$ salad. (Sorry I work in a nice restaurant, I notice).

This is not a quiet, serene place to unwind. The vibe was very "rose all day". Too many loud party people. Even in the off season. Also, please figure out a better system for re entry. People who smoke cigarettes are still human beings. Paying customers. Treat them as such. We will be spending our future spa days elsewhere.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I came to HIGH END SPA a few years ago and had an absolutely amazing and tranquil time. This time, however, when I came back with two girlfriends, I had a completely opposite experience. Truthfully, the very first interaction I had upon arrival ruined my entire day. The woman who greeted us in the front was so unpleasant, looked like she wanted to be anywhere but there, and actually gave us dirty looks.

My friend, who is a smoker, had cigarettes in her bag, and she was told that if she smoked on the property she would be kicked out. I'm not kicking, she actually used the words kicked out. Guess just simply stating "No smoking on the premises is allowed," was not an option for guests.

There was a gentleman who was next to her who went through our belongings. While I understand that some places choose to search customers' belongings, I'm not sure why a spa needs to be more thorough that the TSA. I have to say that it was very uncomfortable when a man would open my bag and went through publicly inspecting my undergarments and other personal possessions in front of everyone else. It felt violating and very uncomfortable.

Inside, it wasn't much better. The showers were absolutely disgusting, with hair and dirty band aids and overstocked towel bins - really not the feel of an experience I would expect for $To relax, we wanted to have a drink and walked over to a bar, only to be told that we have to walk across the property to another bar to get a wristband. Why force your customers to walk through more hoops? Isn't the point to make your guests relax and spend more money? Had to spend time to walk to another bar, show my ID, get a wristband and only find out that they only serve wine and beer, which meant we had to walk back to the other bar to get a well drink. Just silly and annoying.

Overall, I won't be back and definitely won't be recommending to others. Honestly, a Korean spa which is half the price is cleaner and provides better service.

Avoid!

userReviewOnlyContent: This spa is an amusement park for adults, pure luxury. There is something about the mineral water, the sunbathing, and good spirits of everyone around that lifts my mood each time I come. I've had a massage here, but I don't think that necessarily makes the trip distinctly better. Just being on the property, drinking the fruit infused waters, slabbing mud all over the body, and getting steamed in the sauna is worth the entrance fee. It gets very busy in the summer, so highly recommend during winter months.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I generally come here a few times a year as a girls getaway or just a break from reality to float around, lay out and play in the variety of pools.

When you get here, the parking is plentiful and a beautiful entrance greets you. After a walk up to the front and quick bag check you go through the store area if you are not a spa pass holder. The check-in/payment process is painless. You can also put a card on file at this time so that you do not have to carry any cards or cash with you to make purchases during the day- which is very convenient.

At my last trip, which was this past Sunday, we arrived early (around After finding our spot, we went to the locker room area. At the front lobby area of the lockers you can get your wristband after a fast ID check (for The locker rooms have many amentities including free lockers, changing areas, vanity stations (which amazing blow dryers), restrooms, showers, steam room and inside spa area (women only).

I don't often use the steam room, but I do utilize the restrooms, showers and lockers. The showers include shampoo, conditioner and body wash and have both a wall shower head and a rainfall (above your head) one. Towels and a bathing spinner/wet bags are also available in the locker area. Also- if you are a pumping mother, the front will hold your milk for you during your time here.

There are plenty of towels and cold water all around the resort, so you do not need to bring your own. You generally will not be allowed to bring in a reusable water bottle if it has liquid in it. I had an unopened plastic bottle, and they didn't have an issue with that one.

There are many different pools and spas that you can try out, including but not limited to, a floating pool (with rafts and bean chairs available), cold pools, warm pools, swimming pools (with lanes), mineral baths and a various other assortment. You can find more info online if you so desire.

I also always eat here during my stays. I eat at cafe sole, so this review is specific to that. This trip I ordered the Ahi Burger, side of fruit, and the chocolate coffee cupcake. I also got a bottle of vitamin water (hydrating is important). All of the items were delicious. I would definitely order all of them again.

Just a note: my party and I noticed that they are limiting the number of guests in order to preserve the experience to much fewer guests than they have in the past. By Overall, if you need a quick local getaway- this is your place!  Come, rest, relax, sun and enjoy!

At my last trip, which was this past Sunday, we arrived early (around 8:15am).  The Spa officially opens at 9am, but we were checked in early and off to scope out our spot for the day.

After finding our spot, we went to the locker room area. At the front lobby area of the lockers you can get your wristband after a fast ID check (for 21+ patrons only).

The locker rooms have many amentities including free lockers, changing areas, vanity stations (which amazing blow dryers), restrooms, showers, steam room and inside spa area (women only).

I don't often use the steam room, but I do utilize the restrooms, showers and lockers. The showers include shampoo, conditioner and body wash and have both a wall shower head and a rainfall (above your head) one. Towels and a bathing spinner/wet bags are also available in the locker area. Also- if you are a pumping mother, the front will hold your milk for you during your time here.

There are plenty of towels and cold water all around the resort, so you do not need to bring your own. You generally will not be allowed to bring in a reusable water bottle if it has liquid in it. I had an unopened plastic bottle, and they didn't have an issue with that one.

There are many different pools and spas that you can try out, including but not limited to, a floating pool (with rafts and bean chairs available), cold pools, warm pools, swimming pools (with lanes), mineral baths and a various other assortment. You can find more info online if you so desire.

I also always eat here during my stays. I eat at cafe sole, so this review is specific to that. This trip I ordered the Ahi Burger, side of fruit, and the chocolate coffee cupcake. I also got a bottle of vitamin water (hydrating is important). All of the items were delicious. I would definitely order all of them again.

Just a note: my party and I noticed that they are limiting the number of guests in order to preserve the experience to much fewer guests than they have in the past. By 10-10:30am they were no longer allowing guests to enter, unless you had a service or reservation booked. So if you are planning on coming later in the day, I recommend booking a service, otherwise you may want to get there right at or before opening to ensure your admission.

Overall, if you need a quick local getaway- this is your place!  Come, rest, relax, sun and enjoy!

userReviewOnlyContent:
My girl friend told me about this place, just by what she said with the different pools and the services that were offered I was in! No twisting my arm!
We had to call to make a reservation and expect a long wait to even talk to someone (annoying).
HIGH END SPA had a great wellness package for all pool access, the grotto, and a 50 minute spa service all for $165 which is a great deal! Especially since I couldn't have been happier with the experience we had.  
I got there an hour after opening there was a good long line to get to the reservation desk. But this place is so organized, the line only took 20min to get checked in at the desk.
The lady checked my group in gave us a map of the grounds and where to go for the services. She was very thorough! Every staff member I came across was super friendly and helpful!
So then we enter the grounds find a seat and get drinks. The place was busy but not overly packed at any pool. I was able to get pool side service (took a long while to get my drinks and finding a staff member was a little painful) but it was still completed without mess ups.  The lines for drinks moved fast enough but still a 5-8 minute wait.
We did the grotto which an appointment time was made and and again streamlined easy to get checked in and move on to the fun.
My spouse got massages, the staff kindly greeted us and got us In the massage room with hardly any wait time in the lobby.
Best massage I've had in a long time! First time I've actually fallen asleep and the guy really worked a bunch of kinks out! I wish I knew what his name was!
The grounds were clean and I really felt like a valued customer! I felt like I received quality In every penny spent :) the most amazing part of this whole experience is NO KIDS! no kids crying, making noise and slashing the crap out of you.
This is the ultimate adult place!
I am already looking to book my next visit!!

userReviewOnlyContent:
Treated myself to a birthday spa day!! Well needed. Free birthday admission on your actual birthday ($50 value) with the purchase of a spa service. I bought 2 spa services. An organic facial ($110) and aroma therapy 50 min. Massage ($100).
I arrived on a busy Friday mid morning. Very friendly, inviting young lady checked me in. I had not pre paid my spa services, luckily they did have a facial and massage opening.
Pretty packed. Busy day at the spa.
I put my stuff in the ary locks and enjoyed the Roman pool located in the women's locker room. Only 2 occupants. Enjoyed this for 30 minutes then off to my next stop. Dry sauna!! Smelled very refreshing and relaxing. I only lasted 7 minutes!!! Extremely warm inside. But good for you.
Lunch was delicious. I ordered a salad ($18). Scrumptious salad with green goddess dressing. Quite pricey yet nice portion size. Incredibly nice gentlemen customized my salad, thank you.
Facial. Good but not great. The lady was very friendly and knowledgeable. But she was a little rough. Not very tender. I was getting a facial not a Swedish massage. Not as quite relaxing as I desired.
Massage. Was good not great. I get massages on a monthly basis. And this was average. I requested light light pressure, a relaxing massage. This particular massage therapist light pressure was more like medium pressure. Overall good massage.
Overall exceptional experience and will return soon!!! Maybe not for a facial but definitely for the other amenities such Roman baths, mineral baths ( often very full), wet & dry sauna, the grotto extra $25, red clay pool bath, Starbucks cafe, fabulous cool & warm pools. Refreshing ice cold water with lemon coolers available all throughout the spa grounds.
ary lotion, towels, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, lockers and q-tips in bath house!!!

userReviewOnlyContent:
My husband and I went here for the first time today and I have to admit, I loved it! I'd love to go there every month if I can.
We got "winter warmth package" which comes with Entree fees, robes, The robe was comfy and thick which kept us warm even it is December! I was worried I might be cold because I get cold very easily but the robe did a really good job. You could also bring your own robe if you don't wanna pay extra $The grotto was fun. They brush green moisturizer and with a warm brush and you go into a warm room to open up your pores, then rinse off, then to the cold room to close up the pores.

I loved the mineral bath and saline bath the most. They are so warm and peaceful. Most pools are heated during the winter season. They also had like warm lounge pool which they had floating bean bag and blue floating boards. I'd suggest to go while it is still warm (Around noon). We tried around The massage was also disappointing. They give you a from to ask which part you want to be worked on and not but i don't think my therapist looked at it. She didn't work on my shoulder much and she worked on my feet which I wrote on the from "no". I'd probably not try the massage here. It wasn't worth it.

Besides that, everything was nice, relaxing, very clean. You can use free towels everywhere, the locker room is so clean with tons of mirrors, dryers, lotion, shower room and changing room.

My skin is super soft today and i'd love to go back again just without the massage.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I actually kinda love this spa! Is it upscale? No. Robes by rental only, no slippers, no teas or snacks, basic lounge chairs, basic bath house amenities, expensive services that, at least for me, are a hit and miss. So why do I love this place?

17 pools, club mud, eucalyptus steam room, 2' float pool, mineral baths, 2 saunas, grotto moisturizing treatment (just $30). All but the grotto are included with the "take the waters" admission and the landscaping is beautiful! Just bear mind, it gets crowded on the weekends and it's a total party ambiance compared to a traditional spa. I suggest you skip the overpriced massage, skip the onsite restaurant (but if you can't, stick with the poke or chicken nachos). Grotto is worth it. Onsite Starbucks is nice. Definitely not the best spa I've been to, but definitely the most fun! Love my girl days here.

My girlfriends surprised me with a day at HIGH END SPA for my birthday! We had so much fun. We grabbed some mimosas and enjoyed everything that the entrance fee had to offer. The entrance fee includes a lot and would be plenty to keep you busy for the day, however, my friends splurged for the Grotto and that was so relaxing and fun! We grabbed some lunch that afternoon at the cafe and the food was soooo good! We all really enjoyed our lunches. I highly recommend a day at HIGH END SPA. You get so much for the price!

userReviewOnlyContent:
Winter time is probably the best time to come here as the crowds are low and the experience is better than sweating all day during the summer. The facility has numerous pools and a variety of spas and mineral type pools.  

Expect to spend the entire day if you can and enjoy everything geared towards helping your skin. I spent all day here and you'll find that you won't want to leave.

Food is a little pricey but then again your paying for convenience. Water which is spa type refreshment type water is located through the park and you'll also notice plenty of towels and staff everywhere to help

userReviewOnlyContent:
I came here before I was diagnosed with MS. I have been going through aggressive pharmaceutical treatments to halt the progression of MS, but I am still dealing with physical symptoms that may or may not be part of the disease. I came to see DOCTOR again because a pill isn't the answer to everything. The adjustments have been helpful with my shoulders, lower and upper back pain, and I have even had some improvements with sensations in my lower body. I have also been seeing Dr. Bahng for acupuncture. It isn't painful; it is relaxing and peaceful. There are massages available, as well.

My Kaiser plan covers everything but massages!!

userReviewOnlyContent: I wish this could have been a better review. BUT due to poor communication between workers its not. We had booked our grotto for NOT happy and even more reason why I will continue to go to Burke Williams at least they listen when I say I am allergic to something !
userReviewContent:
10/22/2019
I wish this could have been a better review. BUT due to poor communication between workers its not. We had booked our grotto for 12:30pm . When we arrived they where running 15 mins behind no big deal . It was supposed to be a day of no stress. We where then told to fill out our waivers which we did. I put down that I cannot have Eucalyptus oil. We then get called back . I tell the lady at the door to take us down , hey I am the lady that cant have eucalyptus oil. She goes perfect I will let them know when we get down to use grape sead. Perfect. We go down she makes sure to tell them stall #9 needs grape sead oil and they repeat it back . Stall 1 starts to get her gel painted on and then a gentleman comes out and straight for me . Thinking ok hes got my special stuff. He started to paint it then tells me to hold out my hand and put it on like my face and stuff but not my forehead or bottom of my feet . Perfect ready for this stuff to make my skin feel great. Not 20 seconds after i have now rubbed it all on my face , the girl walks out and says who needs grape seeds oil. Sheer panic. NO wonder i was tingling . The guy looks at me and say OH fuck about the same time I do . Rushes me to the showers and turns on all the heads and tells me to start scrubbing he will be back with soap . Which he never came back . My two friends now have come rushing to help me get this crap off faster. ( NOT relaxing ) . scrub it all off to go back in . Have the right stuff put on . I cant relax cause now im itching. He comes and checks on me and I ask him for special soap cause i never got it. He gives it to me . BUT not one employee comes and sees if I'm ok . Two employees knew that he messed up . I mean THANK god I am not so allergic that I went into shock but let me tell you I now look like a 16 year old in high school with how broken out I am .  So really what is the point of the waviers ? so they can mess it up even more?????

NOT happy and even more reason why I will continue to go to Burke Williams at least they listen when I say I am allergic to something !

Now I'm a Puerto Rican women and have diversity- this location needs some it.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I am so upset!
I came here for my bachelorette party and then again the weekend after from Orange County.
First we did the grotto which probably would have been amazing if this big group of girls weren't yelling (there are signs everywhere to whisper). To give the worker credit he did try to ask them to be quite but it failed. I have general anxiety disorder and PTSD so obviously I try to do things in a nice quite environment (they can't control my disorders but just giving you a understanding of how my body was feeling which is completely out of my control). It got even worse.... they can't control the weather BUT when I went to the front to book a massage there was only one available at 5pm. I booked it. Soon after it got really cold and windy. I was in a wind breaker coat and couldn't get warm. I decided that it was so unbearable that I would ask to cancel my message. I went to the front desk and was approached by a manager named David. He was so rude. No smile, no empathy and no kindness. I asked him if I could cancel my message and he said no- it's way to late because there is a policy. I asked why I wasn't informed of that information when ordering the message at the front desk. I also asked why the cancellation policy was not written on the receipt I signed. He rudely said "most people already know there is a cancelation policy". Obviously my anxiety started. He made it a argument instead of an understanding. He was awful and I don't understand why he is a manager. Then I talk to another manager who clearly saw I was really upset and I disclosed that at this point I wasn't going to get the massage as I was way to anxious to even enjoy it. If David started out nice- none of this would have even happened. I WILL NEVER GO BACK. I left before my massage and have the receipt. I will be contacting David's boss and reporting this to my bank. The girl at the front desk was kind and all of the workers BUT the manager who represents them completely ruined my experience. Customer service would have gone a long way.

I was very disappointed yesterday to find the shallow pool as well as well as the one of the pools in the rear of the property, filled with bugs/gnats.  It was gross.  I could not enjoy myself and the experience was disappointing.  It also left a bad impression with my friend who was excited to visit HIGH END SPA for the first time.  
In retrospect, I should've said something to the staff, but I was trying to make the best out of a disappointing day.

userReviewOnlyContent: Don't come when it's busy, it's SO crowded and totally loses its charm. No chairs, no shade and barely any room in the pools. We ordered lunch from the  kitchen for about $20 per person, two out of three we're missing items (poke salads), one was still missing items after round two when we gave up. The food was fairly bland. Also there is only one line for the full bar, and it's not even a real full bar! They fail to tell you that before you wait in the long line: there are currently 15 people in front of me. It's all "wine based" liquors, and I guess the liquor is not what most people would expect. I waited in line for 20 min to end up ordering wine I could have gotten at a less busy bar.

userReviewOnlyContent:
treated myself to the self-care day that's all the rage these days.. specifically on my birthday since admission is free ($I came on my own since I really wanted to just relax but seems like most folks come with someone else (mainly friends, moms/daughters, a handful of couples). There were also some groups - like bachelorette's, birthday parties - and folks mainly kept to themselves, I didn't feel weird coming solo.

Some of my tips/suggestions:
- Do your facial at the end of your visit (I definitely washed away all of my first professional facial loveliness)
- There are ary lockers, great shampoo/conditioner/body wash, lotion with hair dryers available, towels everywhere
- Check out the daily schedule - when I went they had zumba, qi gong, and yoga
- Definitely use the map to check everything out - hot springs (right behind the main pool that's at the entrance), club mud (there's a hot room on the side, the facial lady recommended not to put the mud on your face), mineral pools, roman bath and steam room, dry heat rooms, hot/cold pools
- I didn't do it since I felt there was more than enough to do but heard good things about the grotto - seems like it'd be especially good if you go in a group since you can stick together

For the classic facial: They recommend arriving 15 minutes prior, offer hot tea just to the right of the front door with private bathroom down the right hall. You remove your top including bra and get cozy underneath the soft blanket. I opted for the classic facial and was recommended to get the organic version for $15 more (felt a little up-sell-y), was relaxing however I'm breaking out a few days out.. not sure if this is typical? I'd say a facial is more worth it than a massage since they massage arms, scalp while you're waiting for the mask to do its thing.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I enjoyed every moment at HIGH END SPA Hot Springs. It was so relaxing and g experience. There are many different pools (hot, cold, mineral etc), sauna and float pool. After a busy holiday week, this retreat is definitely a must.
The club mud is really unique from other spa places I have been to. It dries out so fast that you need to either reapply another thin layer on your skin or so rinse it off before it dries your skin.
The Grotto treatment is a whole body mask treatment with additional $25. It adds the perfect ending to our experience.
The staffs by the pool sides are very polite and friendly. I see them constantly folding new towels for customers and taking away used one. I had not encountered any staffs that was rude or impolite. However, the kitchen staff who was tall and works as the one who takes orders that was a bit of inpatient when we requested vegan food. His facial expression was subtle and walked away when we requested changing lettuce wraps to slices of toast.
The food was okay but not so much vegan/allergy friendly. I guess better than nothing to choose from.
They also have juice bar and Starbucks for you to choose from.
There are some classes throughout the day such as Tai-chi, yoga, aqua fitness. These are few of charge. You can definitely make the best out of it.
The only thing I don't really appreciate is people don't respect the rules of being quiet. They talk out loud when there is a sign saying talk in whisper volume. And the staff don't really try to discourage this behavior. If you prefer tranquil experience, the one in NorCal called Refuge has better quiet policy.
businessReplyContent:
Amber P. of HIGH END SPA Hot Springs

Business Customer Service

11/30/2018Hi Kim,

We appreciate you sharing your experience with us. We love that you enjoyed your day at HIGH END SPA. We are working diligently to enforce our guests to  the rules. We hope to see you on your next visit!

Best,

Amber Peyghambari

userReviewOnlyContent:
Beware, the staff here is way UNDER TRAINED!! from the beginning of our planning process to even arriving and spending the day here. Every single staff member either responds to questions as "I don't know" or they say the opposite of the person before them. We booked this place for a bachelorette party and secured our space to plan. After we reserved for a date prices changed and hey tried to charge the new charges. Also once we checked in our card was charge THREE times!! The person at the front desk was training no biggie but later as our day went on and  we went to check into an appointment we were declined as we were NOT told to be there 15 minuets early. I guess they shouldn't be training new employees on peak business days if they can't handle it. Also don't say "we recommend you checking in 15 minuets early" if it's a requirement. Because you told us this as we were checking in for our appointment time when our check in paper says 4:00!
The manager Ashley was rude and basically stated she was in charge today and no body else so we had to deal with her. Even once we asked for the higher up managers info we were told "there's a card over there". Clearly rude. No customer service and clearly doesn't care about fixing issued that we're caused by her staff...
I will not recommend this place to anyone and I will not return!!!
Thanks for giving me the best bachelorette party ever Ashley, I appreciate your "great" attitude and the not so great experience you shared with me and my bridal party. The 8 of us will be sure to share this experience with all we know.
