Every single staff member either responds to questions as "I don't know" or they say the opposite of the person before them. We booked this place for a bachelorette party and secured our space to plan. After we reserved for a date prices changed and hey tried to charge the new charges. Also once we checked in our card was charge THREE times!! The person at the front desk was training no biggie but later as our day went on and  we went to check into an appointment we were declined as we were NOT told to be there 15 minuets early. I guess they shouldn't be training new employees on peak business days if they can't handle it. Also don't say "we recommend you checking in 15 minuets early" if it's a requirement. Because you told us this as we were checking in for our appointment time when our check in paper says 4:00!
The manager Ashley was rude and basically stated she was in charge today and no body else so we had to deal with her. Even once we asked for the higher up managers info we were told "there's a card over there". Clearly rude. No customer service and clearly doesn't care about fixing issued that we're caused by her staff...
I will not recommend this place to anyone and I will not return!!!
Thanks for giving me the best bachelorette party ever Ashley, I appreciate your "great" attitude and the not so great experience you shared with me and my bridal party. The 8 of us will be sure to share this experience with all we know.

userReviewOnlyContent: We booked the bamboo cabana on 11/02/19. I have nothing negative to say about the staff. They were all great. I am upset that there were mosquitos inside the cabana and it looked like the fan blades had not been cleaned since this place opened. We were hot at one point and could not turn on the fan in fear that we would all start having severe allergies with all the dust. Another negative is that we weren't able to bring any outside food and I would have liked to at least bring in a celebratory cake or cupcakes for our little get together. We were celebrating a bachelorette. For the price that we payed it was not worth it. This place is good if you're just paying for the entrance fee and maybe one of their spa services but it's not worth booking a cabana.

I want to help my wife celebrate her special day by spending a fun day feeling great. You can gain free admittance to HIGH END SPA hot springs on your birthday with the purchase of a 50 minute treatment. Despite any discount, I note how expensive it is to visit the facilities. For me to simply enter is over $70 on the weekends, without any service, NOT COUNTING food, robes, or any guaranteed seating facilities.

The overcrowding and rude staff are unfortunate. I'm involved right now in the spa/hospitality industry as well, and I know that mismanagement has wide-ranging effects on a work environment.

Here's to hoping my family can someday visit a respectable HIGH END SPA Hot Springs.

userReviewOnlyContent:
This is NOT a Check in -
We rented Cabana Service -
Very mediocre service.  No one is really interested in service with a smile and happy to help.  If someone is paying for a lovely experience, you would hope your staff is there to help with that.  Not here.
It was close to the Twilight menu which starts at 5pm.  We asked one of the cabana attendants if we could place an order and her response was, it's not 5 yet.  It was 4:50.  We asked can she come back then.  The correct response would be - Sure, I'll take your order now and put it in at 5.  Well, she didn't and she never returned.
We then sent a text to concierge asking if we can order.  They responded they will send someone over.  A cabana attendant arrived, who had helped us in the morning and was pleasant then.  Well come the evening hours she wasn't as pleasant.  We were clearly an inconvenience now and you can read it all over her face.  She took our order and   went back to inform the manager that I was sitting on a chair in front of another cabana.  Our cabanas were the only ones being occupied.  The remaining cabanas were zipped up and the chairs were stripped of their cushions.  My location of the chair I was sitting on was in the sun with no shade so I sat on one of the unused cabana chairs to get out of the sun.  Again,  the chair was not going to be used by anyone as the cabana was zipped up.  I didn't see this to be an issue, but it was.
Robert let us know, I can not sit there even though the cabanas are not being used or we will charged for a third cabana.  He also let us know that they are understaffed and at capacity.  Which has nothing to do with sitting on an unused chair.  My brother asked him, so you are taking it out on us because you are understaffed.  His response was yes.  Very bizarre behavior from any employee, let alone management.  We asked if we can speak to someone else because he wasn't interested in dealing with us and made it very clear verbally.  He said there is no one else, he's the main person in charge.  After more complaints to the front desk about how rudely we have been treated, they finally sent over the food and beverage director Jason.  Jason was very professional, listened and even offered passes for our next visit.  We declined, but appreciated the nice gesture.  We weren't looking for compensation, just good old fashion customer service.  I don't think that's asking for much, especially for a service driven facility.

userReviewOnlyContent:
We've been coming here for years and on our recent trip there were a few things that made us feel like this place isn't what it used to be. The woman checking bags in the morning was extremely unfriendly to both the party in front of us and us, which we have never experienced before. We left something in the car and my fianc went back out to get it and she rudely asked him "are you done for today?" It was 9:30... of course he wasn't done for the day. He told her he just needed to get something out of the car and she begrudgingly told him they'd make an exception and allow him back in but re entry was no longer allowed.
We booked a grotto appointment with a female employee in the locker room, we asked for the latest appointment time available and she gave us 3:15, but she said that one spot was available at 3:45 but we couldn't do that since there were two of us. When we went back to the grotto for our appointment they couldn't find it even though I gave my phone number and my fianc's phone number. What made it worse was that the lady who was trying to check us into the grotto was the same one that had made our reservation earlier in the day. I had to go back and get my phone to show the charge on my card because she couldn't find the reservation. When I came back with my phone to show that we were charged they had found my reservation under my name, so I'm not sure why they couldn't find it before. By the time that was settled we ended up going in with the 3:45 group anyway... which was the original time we wanted to go but were told we couldn't.
The service this time was just lacking compared to our previous visits.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Reservations and checkin process was overly convoluted and left a feeling of annoyance even before my visit. Upon arrival long lines and disorganization only confirmed this dysfunctional spa.  This was my first experience and impression of HIGH END SPA and it was a far departure from a luxury relaxing first impression.

Some of the showers and restrooms were not kept and being that the place was crowded the cleaning service needs to upkeep these places to continue to instill a sense of still being at a spa and to keep the image of luxury which HIGH END SPA failed to deliver.

The heat of the Day negated the need for a HIGH END SPA robe but nothing was offered up by the Spa as a replacement comp so there was a shortfall in satisfaction in my upgraded purchase with the Passport to Wellness Plus package.

The quartz massage was amazing and the facial although felt amazing didn't last long afterwards since there was still other activities to do that countered the benefits of the treatment. I would recommend having your a facial before a massage and closer to the tail end of your day.

There were not enough Keto friendly menu options at both the Cafe or Kitchen. So I was very limited as to what I was able to eat and the price points for the food cost more than you would expect for the size portions you receive so the food value was really not there for me either.

Overall on a scale of Spend your money at Red Door Spa, the Mandarin Oriental, or some other smaller boutique Spa who will provide you a customized unique spa day tailored a personalized for you at the cost you will pay at HIGH END SPA.

HIGH END SPA is overpriced for a subpar Spa experience, which was unorganized, not clean, super crowded, lacked greater food options, and far from a luxury Spa experience for the money you can spend elsewhere.

userReviewOnlyContent:
It was time for a birthday celebration and a friend decided to rent a cabana for the day!  It's just to bad that the weather did not play nice.  It was cold and wet all day :(  Luckily we had the best cabana was offered an enclosure and heat!  Thank goodness!!

Other than that, the experience was awesome. I had my first hot stone massage...amazing!  Jenny was great!!!

This was my second trip and everything was as good as the first time.  From the mud pool to the grotto, it was good times.

Sometimes the robes can be a little beat up, but the shower/dressing areas are huge with great lighting to spruce yourself up after a day at the spa.

For lunch I had the tuna poke salad and I would not order it again.  However, the nachos are delicious!

userReviewOnlyContent: This spa is pretty good but you will spend an extra buck or two. Like a typical spa they will try to get $$$ from you from the entrance fee, liquor, robes, and flip flops. To put it in perspective I saw flip flops costing as much as $27. So bring your own to save money or go barefoot. Doing extras like facials and massages will cost you more as well. I saw facials running as much as $100.  A general admittance will get you access to the mud baths and pools, which is good enough for me to be honest.  Its about $50 or so a person to get in. Lockers are available for free and towel access is everywhere.

userReviewOnlyContent: I came here for my sisters birthday, we got here early on a Wednesday. I was super excited to come here until I ordered my breakfast, I ordered a omelette with potatoes. My sister got the same meal and we both couldn't finish half of it. I would not recommend eating here. I also got nachos for lunch $30 not the yummiest nachos. The soda cost about $5.30 it did not have syrup, went back to pick another drink and both machines were out of syrup for soft drinks. Definitely come in a full stomach so you don't have to spend a lot money for horrible food. What I did love was the amount of pools they have and jacuzzi. Mud pool and hot/cool pool was my favorite. Also don't bring a hair dryer they provide that as well as towels and water.

userReviewContent:
3/30/2018Previous review
Been going here for over 27 years. I've seen all the growth and change. It's been bumpy and they are ironing out the kinks. Love the new bar - prob could use another one on other end of spa. I understand they are talking expansion though and even building a resort. I only hope it doesn't take away the private feel of this place. The area inside Starbucks (long hallway) seems like wasted space. Hardly anyone in there. Food was good, try the fish tacos (although I think they told me shells were gluten free and I'm certain they are not) and so were the beverages. Overall a relaxing day and I'd recommend if you want to get away. Get there early to claim a spot- it can get crowded and they do hit max occupancy on holidays and some weekends. Get on email list to purchase gift card deals when they offer them- it's definitely the way to go and they don't expire I'm told.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Imagine planning a family event for the last three months only to be greeted by list of restrictions upon restrictions. I was excited to spend the day at HIGH END SPA and expected to hear Warm water greetings of "Good morning, thank you for choosing HIGH END SPA, on behalf of our staff, we hope you enjoy your day here."

That greeting was never heard, ever. I initially reserved and paid for the BambooCabana for I tried to explain to Robert the email exchanges of what was told to me, but he was not going to hear anything I said. He stated that the email had to go through him and he had to approve everything and was not informed. So, HIGH END SPA's miscommunication  was misdirected towards me and my group.

Robert also said that we were placed in another poolside cabana and I had to move my car. I corrected him by showing my email confirmation and instead of apologizing for any confusion, he brushed it off. He was smug the entire time I was trying to explain what I understood. It didn't matter to him because he is the manager is always right, and customers are not and should be told so.

We shook it off and the day went by fine, as Asia and Jasson took care of us in a friendly and professional fashion. We all appreciated their attentiveness when they were around. We also ordered food from the cafeteria and several bars in the resort (as we didn't expect a personal attendant at all times). The group spend most of the time lounging in different pools so cabanas were used only as a quick stop to eat, drink and getting out of the sun.

At We were not noisy, we didn't play music, we didn't bring outside food or alcohol, we didn't use foul language, we weren't inappropriately dressed. We were just sitting on the edge of a lounge chair. I asked Robert "where's the demarcation between cabana and cabana and non cabana, if there was an actual border and lines to be crossed" He informed me that there wasn't . But again, he threatened that he can charge me $What was suppose to be a celebration of family and a relaxing day ended up being a huge disappointment. Instead of fond memories of our family day in the mud, it's scarred by Robert's smugness and militant demeanor.  

We asked to speak to someone other than Robert, he told us that there was "no one higher up" than he; however Jason came out to LISTEN. He didn't blame anyone, he just listen and agreed that things could have turned out different and positively.

HIGH END SPA, you got a good thing going. I loved the place, the sense of peace and relaxation. I've been going there for However, the combative and insensitive treatment we received from Robert was uncalled for and doesn't bode well for the image of HIGH END SPA. He needs to be placed in another position that's non "hospitality." He is the main reason why I wrote this review.  Extremely unprofessional, uncaring, unwillingly to listen, unwillingly to find a common ground. I won't return for awhile, if at all.

We were not noisy, we didn't play music, we didn't bring outside food or alcohol, we didn't use foul language, we weren't inappropriately dressed. We were just sitting on the edge of a lounge chair. I asked Robert "where's the demarcation between cabana and cabana and non cabana, if there was an actual border and lines to be crossed" He informed me that there wasn't . But again, he threatened that he can charge me $200 for sitting on the EDGE of a lounge chair in an area that was EMPTY. He reiterated that several times.

What was suppose to be a celebration of family and a relaxing day ended up being a huge disappointment. Instead of fond memories of our family day in the mud, it's scarred by Robert's smugness and militant demeanor.  

We asked to speak to someone other than Robert, he told us that there was "no one higher up" than he; however Jason came out to LISTEN. He didn't blame anyone, he just listen and agreed that things could have turned out different and positively.

HIGH END SPA, you got a good thing going. I loved the place, the sense of peace and relaxation. I've been going there for 25+ years.. always a good experience.  Food is delicious and reasonably priced, atmosphere and landscape upkeep still lush and beautiful with great improvement and expansions. Belle and Nisha in the front, thank you for making us feel welcomed.

However, the combative and insensitive treatment we received from Robert was uncalled for and doesn't bode well for the image of HIGH END SPA. He needs to be placed in another position that's non "hospitality." He is the main reason why I wrote this review.  Extremely unprofessional, uncaring, unwillingly to listen, unwillingly to find a common ground. I won't return for awhile, if at all.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Absolutely would avoid. My friend REALLy wanted to come here so we went, but quickly it went downhill.

I'll start with the Pro since it's short. The Club Mud was cool.

The rest are cons. Remember that I'm here on a weekday in the off season.
- the grotto is $30 extra
- crap nachos to share are $30, drinks $15/drink and are pre mixed, weak
- the mineral baths are very small and are absolutely packed so good luck
- the mini pools were all super packed by 11 as well
- we were told to make a reservation and pre pay so we did. Guess what, you wait in line anyway! The line is akin to a Vegas nightclub. They even section off the line and "allow" people to check in as they see others leave. It's insane.
- after you check in you go to the bathhouse and change, which is so inefficiently setup all the girls flow in and out of the same tony doorway. Non stop traffic jam.
- you then are told to put a credit card of file for drinks. Fine. But then they tell you to go to yet another location, carrying your DL, to get a wristband to go to yet another location to actually get a drink. All while having to carry your drivers license around a water park. So stupid. All this could be solved at checkin checking IDs and giving wrist bands.
- overall the entire thing is akin to a water park. Maps everywhere. Extremely loud and packed. Nowhere to relax and unwind.  
Would absolutely never return

userReviewOnlyContent:
Not too bad if you temper your expectations appropriately :) I went in the summertime last year on a gloomy day. If you go early in the morning the wait times aren't too bad, even on a saturday :) my advice is, unless you've already rented it a cabana, I'd make my first move to be something like claiming a lawn  chair immediately!!

Food served was pretty good! We did some sort of breakfast deal and the chia seed yogurt was creamy, the omelette was super enjoyable, and the champagne was delightful. Parking was easy as well

I'd imagine that your experience would easily go downhill if you go late on a weekend in the middle of the summer, but if you treat this experience with tHe same expectations that you would with Disneyland then I think you'd still be able to have a good time

Expect to wait, expect to pay a premium, but also expect to still have fun :)

Other than that, this spa is worth checking out once in your life. Very nature-y and pretty. I love their "club mud" area! Drinks are pretty cheap for a spa too.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I've just finished my first hot springs experience at HIGH END SPA, and I must say it was pretty good! We purchased a winter package that included admission, a Overall this package was a good deal. Today was a holiday (MLK), and so admission alone was going to be the weekend rate even though it was a Monday. The massage was good quality, and the Grotto was soothing.

I am disappointed in their robe offerings, though. Most everyone was running around with this luxurious plush robe that had HIGH END SPA stitched on the chest. They only offer it in a size Large, though. I'm a plus sized woman, and asked if they had bigger robes. They offered me an XL robe from their massage area. It was an OK robe, but not nearly as nice as the standard robes. I would highly recommend that HIGH END SPA invest in some XL and even XXL robes for their plus-sized guests that are just as luxurious as their standard robes. If I had known my robe was going to be just meh, I would have skipped it and brought my own. Makes the deal not as appealing, but not a deal breaker either.

Lunch took awhile because they make everything fresh. Great concept, but we waited in line for over Best pool experience was the saline pool and the hot/cold treatment pools.

I can't comment on the Lounge pool because we weren't allowed in. They were filming a promo, and we were ushered away.

I recommend HIGH END SPA to anyone looking for a day of relaxation and to get away from it all. If you are on the larger side, skip the robe rental and bring your own.
userReviewContent:
1/15/2018Previous review
I've just finished my first hot springs experience at HIGH END SPA, and I must say it was pretty good! We purchased a winter package that included admission, a 50 minute massage, the Grotto experience, a robe for the day, and a voucher for one cookie and one hot cocoa. The cost was $159.

Overall this package was a good deal. Today was a holiday (MLK), and so admission alone was going to be the weekend rate even though it was a Monday. The massage was good quality, and the Grotto was soothing.

I am disappointed in their robe offerings, though. Most everyone was running around with this luxurious plush robe that had HIGH END SPA stitched on the chest. They only offer it in a size Large, though. I'm a plus sized woman, and asked if they had bigger robes. They offered me an XL robe from their massage area. It was an OK robe, but not nearly as nice as the standard robes. I would highly recommend that HIGH END SPA invest in some XL and even XXL robes for their plus-sized guests that are just as luxurious as their standard robes. If I had known my robe was going to be just meh, I would have skipped it and brought my own. Makes the deal not as appealing, but not a deal breaker either.

Lunch took awhile because they make everything fresh. Great concept, but we waited in line for over 30 minutes for a panini, nachos, and a flatbread pizza.

Best pool experience was the saline pool and the hot/cold treatment pools.

I can't comment on the Lounge pool because we weren't allowed in. They were filming a promo, and we were ushered away.

I recommend HIGH END SPA to anyone looking for a day of relaxation and to get away from it all. If you are on the larger side, skip the robe rental and bring your own.

userReviewOnlyContent: Fool me once shame on you. Fool me twice shame on me. I made the mistake of going back again a week ago after I was unhappy with the service over a year ago, but I needed an adjustment. 1st time in I needed an adjustment, but all they wanted to do was a consultation, electrode pack, and get me out, but not before scheduling 12 appts. WTH? I argued I need to be adjusted, and apologized if I was an inconvenience but hell it's my money I'm spending. Reluctantly I was given a time to return that afternoon and what I got was a lay down on your stomach crack, and a bear hug crunch against the table. Then ok you're good to go. I then asked about checking my shoulders, pelvis etc... Again an inconvenience it seemed. Left regretting going in the 1st place, but we all use YELP and the reviews were good. Flash forward a year and I haven't needed chiropractic service so I again searched YELP when I needed help. Everything was booked so here I go again. Convenience was a key since i live within 5 minutes so I tried again. Same thing he read the note I wrote on a paper they gave me. From the time I left the waiting room to adjustment to walking back down the hall was 3-5 minutes tops. Same 2 adjustments without any further questioning. Then placed on the electrode pads. When I asked why it was explained it would loosen up my muscles. I then told them it was doing nothing to the area that brought me in the 1st place. Well lets crank it up to the max setting and wait and see. After that doing nothing I was placed on a roller bed that again did nothing for the area I was having pain. 1/2 way through I got up, paid, and left for the last time. Maybe I'm out of the realm for standard correcting if that's what's being done at this office. I wouldn't think so since 99% of the time I have 0 issues. I'll never go again, but what I would offer to them as advice is try not to make people feel like herded cattle being pushed through so you can make you next dollar. Maybe schedule a few minutes for each person rather then making it such a short cold experience. I may be the only 1, but your actions did reflect this way to me. Good luck in the future.

I'll be reporting this to the BBB and frankly this business needs to get its crap together. Use at own risk.

This place is like an oasis away from it all. Mineral springs, wading/lounge pool, multiple hot tubs and spa treatments await you here. They serve alcohol and even put in a Starbucks. It's clean, and the locker room has you covered for shampoo, conditioner and lotion if you forget.

The weekends are my least favorite time to visit because it's just too crowded. Good luck getting a pool float and you'll wait nearly 30 minutes or more to get a drink. They reach maximum occupancy most weekends. They've done better dealing with the quantity of people but it's sill a long wait for most anything. Because of this. It's also hard to justify the cost to visit - $69 admission fee. The admission fee is just ridiculous. And if you don't book a $100 service like a massage or facial, , you're not guaranteed to get in. This is probably my last trip unless they have some super sensational deal. The drive coupled with no guarantees of getting in are a no win for me.

Read less

userReviewContent:
6/5/2018Updated review
 6 photos

 2 check-ins

Another fabulous trip to HIGH END SPA! Love the new addition in the back with rocking chairs under beautiful trees! This place is growing faster than it can hardly keep up with - went on a Monday thinking it won't be as crowded and wow! It felt like a weekend! I'm hoping they will expand kitchen and help as it takes about 40 minutes to wait in line around the lunch hour to get food. It's all prepared fresh though and I appreciate that.

Been going here for over 27 years. I've seen all the growth and change. It's been bumpy and they are ironing out the kinks. Love the new bar - prob could use another one on other end of spa. I understand they are talking expansion though and even building a resort. I only hope it doesn't take away the private feel of this place. The area inside Starbucks (long hallway) seems like wasted space. Hardly anyone in there. Food was good, try the fish tacos (although I think they told me shells were gluten free and I'm certain they are not) and so were the beverages. Overall a relaxing day and I'd recommend if you want to get away. Get there early to claim a spot- it can get crowded and they do hit max occupancy on holidays and some weekends. Get on email list to purchase gift card deals when they offer them- it's definitely the way to go and they don't expire I'm told.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Imagine planning a family event for the last three months only to be greeted by list of restrictions upon restrictions. I was excited to spend the day at HIGH END SPA and expected to hear Warm water greetings of "Good morning, thank you for choosing HIGH END SPA, on behalf of our staff, we hope you enjoy your day here."

That greeting was never heard, ever. I initially reserved and paid for the BambooCabana for I tried to explain to Robert the email exchanges of what was told to me, but he was not going to hear anything I said. He stated that the email had to go through him and he had to approve everything and was not informed. So, HIGH END SPA's miscommunication  was misdirected towards me and my group.

Robert also said that we were placed in another poolside cabana and I had to move my car. I corrected him by showing my email confirmation and instead of apologizing for any confusion, he brushed it off. He was smug the entire time I was trying to explain what I understood. It didn't matter to him because he is the manager is always right, and customers are not and should be told so.

We shook it off and the day went by fine, as Asia and Jasson took care of us in a friendly and professional fashion. We all appreciated their attentiveness when they were around. We also ordered food from the cafeteria and several bars in the resort (as we didn't expect a personal attendant at all times). The group spend most of the time lounging in different pools so cabanas were used only as a quick stop to eat, drink and getting out of the sun.

At We were not noisy, we didn't play music, we didn't bring outside food or alcohol, we didn't use foul language, we weren't inappropriately dressed. We were just sitting on the edge of a lounge chair. I asked Robert "where's the demarcation between cabana and cabana and non cabana, if there was an actual border and lines to be crossed" He informed me that there wasn't . But again, he threatened that he can charge me $What was suppose to be a celebration of family and a relaxing day ended up being a huge disappointment. Instead of fond memories of our family day in the mud, it's scarred by Robert's smugness and militant demeanor.  

We asked to speak to someone other than Robert, he told us that there was "no one higher up" than he; however Jason came out to LISTEN. He didn't blame anyone, he just listen and agreed that things could have turned out different and positively.

HIGH END SPA, you got a good thing going. I loved the place, the sense of peace and relaxation. I've been going there for However, the combative and insensitive treatment we received from Robert was uncalled for and doesn't bode well for the image of HIGH END SPA. He needs to be placed in another position that's non "hospitality." He is the main reason why I wrote this review.  Extremely unprofessional, uncaring, unwillingly to listen, unwillingly to find a common ground. I won't return nor recommend HIGH END SPA because of this experience.
userReviewContent:
1/11/2020Updated review
 3 photos

Imagine planning a family event for the last three months only to be greeted by list of restrictions upon restrictions. I was excited to spend the day at HIGH END SPA and expected to hear Warm water greetings of "Good morning, thank you for choosing HIGH END SPA, on behalf of our staff, we hope you enjoy your day here."

That greeting was never heard, ever. I initially reserved and paid for the BambooCabana for 8-10ppl @($400/day). Unfortunately HIGH END SPA couldn't get that for us because we changed dates but asked if we wanted 2 poolside cabana ($200/per cabana= same cost).  Totally fine .. just as long we can be together. I was totally upfront with the guest list indicating all guest-- not trying to cheat the system at all. Well, upon arriving we were told that we can't do a lot of things "we won't serve people in your party that exceeds the cabanas (4ppl) and you can't step into the cabana area".

I tried to explain to Robert the email exchanges of what was told to me, but he was not going to hear anything I said. He stated that the email had to go through him and he had to approve everything and was not informed. So, HIGH END SPA's miscommunication  was misdirected towards me and my group.

Robert also said that we were placed in another poolside cabana and I had to move my car. I corrected him by showing my email confirmation and instead of apologizing for any confusion, he brushed it off. He was smug the entire time I was trying to explain what I understood. It didn't matter to him because he is the manager is always right, and customers are not and should be told so.

We shook it off and the day went by fine, as Asia and Jasson took care of us in a friendly and professional fashion. We all appreciated their attentiveness when they were around. We also ordered food from the cafeteria and several bars in the resort (as we didn't expect a personal attendant at all times). The group spend most of the time lounging in different pools so cabanas were used only as a quick stop to eat, drink and getting out of the sun.

At 5pm, a lot of people left and the day was getting quieter. We wanted to try the evening menu and ordered from a different server My, who proceeded to count heads in the cabana. We were told that we couldn't sit on an empty lounge chair in front of the 3rd cabana (that was mistakenly assigned to us earlier in the day--no one ever showed up/ it was zipped closed). My sister was told that she couldn't even sit on the edge of a lounge chair just to get out of the sun. The whole area was EMPTY. Are you kidding?! Robert came out reading the riot act saying that he could charge me another $200 for the day because my sister was sitting on the edge of the lounge chair in an area that was EMPTY. He reminded me that he had all our cards on file and that he could call security to have us removed.

We were not noisy, we didn't play music, we didn't bring outside food or alcohol, we didn't use foul language, we weren't inappropriately dressed. We were just sitting on the edge of a lounge chair. I asked Robert "where's the demarcation between cabana and cabana and non cabana, if there was an actual border and lines to be crossed" He informed me that there wasn't . But again, he threatened that he can charge me $200 for sitting on the EDGE of a lounge chair in an area that was EMPTY. He reiterated that several times.

What was suppose to be a celebration of family and a relaxing day ended up being a huge disappointment. Instead of fond memories of our family day in the mud, it's scarred by Robert's smugness and militant demeanor.  

We asked to speak to someone other than Robert, he told us that there was "no one higher up" than he; however Jason came out to LISTEN. He didn't blame anyone, he just listen and agreed that things could have turned out different and positively.

HIGH END SPA, you got a good thing going. I loved the place, the sense of peace and relaxation. I've been going there for 25+ years.. always a good experience.  Food is delicious and reasonably priced, atmosphere and landscape upkeep still lush and beautiful with great improvement and expansions. Belle and Nisha in the front, thank you for making us feel welcomed.

However, the combative and insensitive treatment we received from Robert was uncalled for and doesn't bode well for the image of HIGH END SPA. He needs to be placed in another position that's non "hospitality." He is the main reason why I wrote this review.  Extremely unprofessional, uncaring, unwillingly to listen, unwillingly to find a common ground. I won't return nor recommend HIGH END SPA because of this experience.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Absolutely would avoid. My friend REALLy wanted to come here so we went, but quickly it went downhill.

I'll start with the Pro since it's short. The Club Mud was cool.

The rest are cons. Remember that I'm here on a weekday in the off season.
- the grotto is $30 extra
- crap nachos to share are $30, drinks $15/drink and are pre mixed, weak
- the mineral baths are very small and are absolutely packed (again, on the off-season, on a weekday)
- the mini pools were all super packed by 11am as well
- we were told to make a reservation and pre pay so we did. Guess what, you wait in line anyway! The line is akin to a Vegas nightclub. They even section off the line and "allow" people to check in only as they see others leave. It's insane.
- after you check in you go to the bathhouse and change, which is so inefficiently setup all the girls flow in and out of the same tiny doorway. Non stop traffic jam.
- you then are told to put a credit card of file for drinks. Fine. But then they tell you to go to yet another location, carrying your DL, to get a wristband to go to yet another location to actually get a drink. All while having to carry your drivers license around a water park. So stupid. All this could be solved at checkin checking IDs and giving wrist bands.
- overall the entire thing is akin to a water park. Maps everywhere. Extremely loud and packed. Nowhere to relax and unwind.  
Would absolutely never return

userReviewOnlyContent:
Just wanted to update my review to reflect my latest experience at the spa. It was my friends birthday today and she received ary admission for the day :) it was a rainy day at the spa but that did not take away from the experience at all. If anything, it made us appreciate all the hot pools even more :) I'm gonna break it down as simply as I can:

Had an amazing massage by Ricardo: +1!
Margaritas are strong and seemingly bottomless: +1!
Food at the main restaurant was yummy: +1!
The floating bean bags in the lounging pool! Omg that was the best. You can totally set your drinks on the floating loungers too and they won't sink: +1!
Free parking: +The biggest negative that sort of put a slight damper to my day was my run in with a security guard first thing in the morning when I got there.

Some backstory:
So I always back in to whatever spot I'm parking in unless there are signs in the lot that say "head in only"

There are no such signs at HIGH END SPAn , so I went ahead and did my thing

The security guy walks literal circles around my car and gives me the eye and looks me over

Then he stopped in front of me and asks "why are you parked like that????"

Mind you, there are cars all over the lot that are parked head in, head out, all sorts of directions. But he singled me out and is like "you can't park like this. It's wrong. And it isn't allowed."

I kindly mentioned that there aren't any signs advising against how I parked and pointed at another car parked like mine and asked him, "you mean that guy can't park like that either then right? Because he backed into his spot too."

He looked at the cars and was like "no no, they are okay. That is fine but you cannot park like this. Fix it"

....that was a bit disappointing tbh. So for that unfortunate run in, I'd have to subtract a star. I've included photos of how other cars were parked

Buyer beware!

Loved this place!!!! I have never been able to go and enjoy a spa but it feels so good here. I would go daily if I could. I felt so relaxed and completely comfortable after a full day of the healing waters. My mother and I brought my daughter here and rented a private cabana. Best service and we were well taken care of by our hostess.
Second review: rented a cabana for my mother's 75th birthday. Rented the exact same cabana that we did before. Didn't really receive a special cabana time as we did last time. Nothing special about this trip with the cabana except for being able to sit in a private area and receiving service at your cabana. Wasn't worth the money unfortunately I will always recommend going to the spa to enjoy the waters but I will never rent another cabana again. First trip 5 stars second trip 3 stars for cabana experience.

userReviewContent:
3/30/2018Previous review
Been going here for over 27 years. I've seen all the growth and change. It's been bumpy and they are ironing out the kinks. Love the new bar - prob could use another one on other end of spa. I understand they are talking expansion though and even building a resort. I only hope it doesn't take away the private feel of this place. The area inside Starbucks (long hallway) seems like wasted space. Hardly anyone in there. Food was good, try the fish tacos (although I think they told me shells were gluten free and I'm certain they are not) and so were the beverages. Overall a relaxing day and I'd recommend if you want to get away. Get there early to claim a spot- it can get crowded and they do hit max occupancy on holidays and some weekends. Get on email list to purchase gift card deals when they offer them- it's definitely the way to go and they don't expire I'm told.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Imagine planning a family event for the last three months only to be greeted by list of restrictions upon restrictions. I was excited to spend the day at HIGH END SPA and expected to hear Warm water greetings of "Good morning, thank you for choosing HIGH END SPA, on behalf of our staff, we hope you enjoy your day here."

That greeting was never heard, ever. I initially reserved and paid for the BambooCabana for I tried to explain to Robert the email exchanges of what was told to me, but he was not going to hear anything I said. He stated that the email had to go through him and he had to approve everything and was not informed. So, HIGH END SPA's miscommunication  was misdirected towards me and my group.

Robert also said that we were placed in another poolside cabana and I had to move my car. I corrected him by showing my email confirmation and instead of apologizing for any confusion, he brushed it off. He was smug the entire time I was trying to explain what I understood. It didn't matter to him because he is the manager is always right, and customers are not and should be told so.

We shook it off and the day went by fine, as Asia and Jasson took care of us in a friendly and professional fashion. We all appreciated their attentiveness when they were around. We also ordered food from the cafeteria and several bars in the resort (as we didn't expect a personal attendant at all times). The group spend most of the time lounging in different pools so cabanas were used only as a quick stop to eat, drink and getting out of the sun.

At We were not noisy, we didn't play music, we didn't bring outside food or alcohol, we didn't use foul language, we weren't inappropriately dressed. We were just sitting on the edge of a lounge chair. I asked Robert "where's the demarcation between cabana and cabana and non cabana, if there was an actual border and lines to be crossed" He informed me that there wasn't . But again, he threatened that he can charge me $What was suppose to be a celebration of family and a relaxing day ended up being a huge disappointment. Instead of fond memories of our family day in the mud, it's scarred by Robert's smugness and militant demeanor.  

We asked to speak to someone other than Robert, he told us that there was "no one higher up" than he; however Jason came out to LISTEN. He didn't blame anyone, he just listen and agreed that things could have turned out different and positively.

HIGH END SPA, you got a good thing going. I loved the place, the sense of peace and relaxation. I've been going there for However, the combative and insensitive treatment we received from Robert was uncalled for and doesn't bode well for the image of HIGH END SPA. He needs to be placed in another position that's non "hospitality." He is the main reason why I wrote this review.  Extremely unprofessional, uncaring, unwillingly to listen, unwillingly to find a common ground. I won't return for awhile, if at all.
userReviewContent:
9/15/2019Previous review
Imagine planning a family event for the last three months only to be greeted by list of restrictions upon restrictions. I was excited to spend the day at HIGH END SPA and expected to hear Warm water greetings of "Good morning, thank you for choosing HIGH END SPA, on behalf of our staff, we hope you enjoy your day here."

That greeting was never heard, ever. I initially reserved and paid for the BambooCabana for 8-10ppl @($400/day). Unfortunately HIGH END SPA couldn't get that for us because we changed dates but asked if we wanted 2 poolside cabana ($200/per cabana= same cost).  Totally fine .. just as long we can be together. I was totally upfront with the guest list indicating all guest-- not trying to cheat the system at all. Well, upon arriving we were told that we can't do a lot of things "we won't serve people in your party who that exceeds the cabanas (4ppl) and you can't step into the cabana area".

I tried to explain to Robert the email exchanges of what was told to me, but he was not going to hear anything I said. He stated that the email had to go through him and he had to approve everything and was not informed. So, HIGH END SPA's miscommunication  was misdirected towards me and my group.

Robert also said that we were placed in another poolside cabana and I had to move my car. I corrected him by showing my email confirmation and instead of apologizing for any confusion, he brushed it off. He was smug the entire time I was trying to explain what I understood. It didn't matter to him because he is the manager is always right, and customers are not and should be told so.

We shook it off and the day went by fine, as Asia and Jasson took care of us in a friendly and professional fashion. We all appreciated their attentiveness when they were around. We also ordered food from the cafeteria and several bars in the resort (as we didn't expect a personal attendant at all times). The group spend most of the time lounging in different pools so cabanas were used only as a quick stop to eat, drink and getting out of the sun.

At 5pm, a lot of people left and the day was getting quieter. We wanted to try the evening menu and ordered from a different server My, who proceeded to count heads in the cabana. We were told that we couldn't sit on an empty lounge chair in front of the 3rd cabana (that was mistakenly assigned to us earlier in the day--no one ever showed up/ it was zipped closed). My sister was told that she couldn't even sit on the edge of a lounge chair just to get out of the sun. The whole area was EMPTY. Are you kidding?! Robert came out reading the riot act saying that he could charge me another $200 for the day because my sister was sitting on the edge of the lounge chair in an area that was EMPTY. He reminded me that he had all our cards on file and that he could call security to have us removed.

We were not noisy, we didn't play music, we didn't bring outside food or alcohol, we didn't use foul language, we weren't inappropriately dressed. We were just sitting on the edge of a lounge chair. I asked Robert "where's the demarcation between cabana and cabana and non cabana, if there was an actual border and lines to be crossed" He informed me that there wasn't . But again, he threatened that he can charge me $200 for sitting on the EDGE of a lounge chair in an area that was EMPTY. He reiterated that several times.

What was suppose to be a celebration of family and a relaxing day ended up being a huge disappointment. Instead of fond memories of our family day in the mud, it's scarred by Robert's smugness and militant demeanor.  

We asked to speak to someone other than Robert, he told us that there was "no one higher up" than he; however Jason came out to LISTEN. He didn't blame anyone, he just listen and agreed that things could have turned out different and positively.

HIGH END SPA, you got a good thing going. I loved the place, the sense of peace and relaxation. I've been going there for 25+ years.. always a good experience.  Food is delicious and reasonably priced, atmosphere and landscape upkeep still lush and beautiful with great improvement and expansions. Belle and Nisha in the front, thank you for making us feel welcomed.

However, the combative and insensitive treatment we received from Robert was uncalled for and doesn't bode well for the image of HIGH END SPA. He needs to be placed in another position that's non "hospitality." He is the main reason why I wrote this review.  Extremely unprofessional, uncaring, unwillingly to listen, unwillingly to find a common ground. I won't return for awhile, if at all.

userReviewOnlyContent:
Absolutely would avoid. My friend REALLy wanted to come here so we went, but quickly it went downhill.

I'll start with the Pro since it's short. The Club Mud was cool.

The rest are cons. Remember that I'm here on a weekday in the off season.
- the grotto is $30 extra
- crap nachos to share are $30, drinks $15/drink and are pre mixed, weak
- the mineral baths are very small and are absolutely packed so good luck
- the mini pools were all super packed by 11 as well
- we were told to make a reservation and pre pay so we did. Guess what, you wait in line anyway! The line is akin to a Vegas nightclub. They even section off the line and "allow" people to check in as they see others leave. It's insane.
- after you check in you go to the bathhouse and change, which is so inefficiently setup all the girls flow in and out of the same tony doorway. Non stop traffic jam.
- you then are told to put a credit card of file for drinks. Fine. But then they tell you to go to yet another location, carrying your DL, to get a wristband to go to yet another location to actually get a drink. All while having to carry your drivers license around a water park. So stupid. All this could be solved at checkin checking IDs and giving wrist bands.
- overall the entire thing is akin to a water park. Maps everywhere. Extremely loud and packed. Nowhere to relax and unwind.  
Would absolutely never return

userReviewOnlyContent:
Not too bad if you temper your expectations appropriately :) I went in the summertime last year on a gloomy day. If you go early in the morning the wait times aren't too bad, even on a saturday :) my advice is, unless you've already rented it a cabana, I'd make my first move to be something like claiming a lawn  chair immediately!!

Food served was pretty good! We did some sort of breakfast deal and the chia seed yogurt was creamy, the omelette was super enjoyable, and the champagne was delightful. Parking was easy as well

I'd imagine that your experience would easily go downhill if you go late on a weekend in the middle of the summer, but if you treat this experience with tHe same expectations that you would with Disneyland then I think you'd still be able to have a good time

Expect to wait, expect to pay a premium, but also expect to still have fun :)

Pretty decent spa and a worthwhile experience. Though beautiful and cleanly, with excellent service, this spa contains a few drawbacks. The biggest being how crowded it was, even for a weekday. I can't imagine how crowded it'd be on a weekend. Each pool had at least 5 people in it at all times. I guess you kind of get used to it after a while, but it'd be nice to relax without overhearing all this loud chatter. This isn't the type of "quiet" spa people get "shushed" at if they talk...unfortunately.

The only other complaint I have is over how grimey some couples got. It made me question the cleanliness of some pools

Other than that, this spa is worth checking out once in your life. Very nature-y and pretty. I love their "club mud" area! Drinks are pretty cheap for a spa too.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I've just finished my first hot springs experience at HIGH END SPA, and I must say it was pretty good! We purchased a winter package that included admission, a Overall this package was a good deal. Today was a holiday (MLK), and so admission alone was going to be the weekend rate even though it was a Monday. The massage was good quality, and the Grotto was soothing.

I am disappointed in their robe offerings, though. Most everyone was running around with this luxurious plush robe that had HIGH END SPA stitched on the chest. They only offer it in a size Large, though. I'm a plus sized woman, and asked if they had bigger robes. They offered me an XL robe from their massage area. It was an OK robe, but not nearly as nice as the standard robes. I would highly recommend that HIGH END SPA invest in some XL and even XXL robes for their plus-sized guests that are just as luxurious as their standard robes. If I had known my robe was going to be just meh, I would have skipped it and brought my own. Makes the deal not as appealing, but not a deal breaker either.

Lunch took awhile because they make everything fresh. Great concept, but we waited in line for over Best pool experience was the saline pool and the hot/cold treatment pools.

I can't comment on the Lounge pool because we weren't allowed in. They were filming a promo, and we were ushered away.

I recommend HIGH END SPA to anyone looking for a day of relaxation and to get away from it all. If you are on the larger side, skip the robe rental and bring your own.
userReviewContent:
1/15/2018Previous review
I've just finished my first hot springs experience at HIGH END SPA, and I must say it was pretty good! We purchased a winter package that included admission, a 50 minute massage, the Grotto experience, a robe for the day, and a voucher for one cookie and one hot cocoa. The cost was $159.

Overall this package was a good deal. Today was a holiday (MLK), and so admission alone was going to be the weekend rate even though it was a Monday. The massage was good quality, and the Grotto was soothing.

I am disappointed in their robe offerings, though. Most everyone was running around with this luxurious plush robe that had HIGH END SPA stitched on the chest. They only offer it in a size Large, though. I'm a plus sized woman, and asked if they had bigger robes. They offered me an XL robe from their massage area. It was an OK robe, but not nearly as nice as the standard robes. I would highly recommend that HIGH END SPA invest in some XL and even XXL robes for their plus-sized guests that are just as luxurious as their standard robes. If I had known my robe was going to be just meh, I would have skipped it and brought my own. Makes the deal not as appealing, but not a deal breaker either.

Lunch took awhile because they make everything fresh. Great concept, but we waited in line for over 30 minutes for a panini, nachos, and a flatbread pizza.

Best pool experience was the saline pool and the hot/cold treatment pools.

I can't comment on the Lounge pool because we weren't allowed in. They were filming a promo, and we were ushered away.

I recommend HIGH END SPA to anyone looking for a day of relaxation and to get away from it all. If you are on the larger side, skip the robe rental and bring your own.

userReviewContent:
2/10/2018Previous review
I miss the old HIGH END SPA. I've waited 2 days to actually talk to someone there about purchasing a large gift certificate. I was going to buy online but have a question. No live chat available and no response to my email after 2 days. Tried calling - waited over 15 minutes on hold then gave up and used the call back option. When Melissa from HIGH END SPA called back, we didn't have the best connection and within seconds she hung up and didn't try me back. Been going here for over 25 years and I've watched the service of this place plummet. It will no longer be my annual girls trip and mother daughter trip. Not worth the hassle when there are many other spas with amazing service around So Cal. I'd rather pay more and have my day feel like a spa day than chase down someone for a drink and wait 30 minutes or deal with people on the phone who have bad attitudes. Good bye HIGH END SPA.

userReviewOnlyContent: Had major issues with this place. My wife signed up for a massage and chiropractic services a week in advance. I called the desk around noon on the day of the appointment to verify and was told a 5pm. Later I was called saying my wife was late for her appointment which was at four. The front desk made a mistake and told me the wrong time. Due to this, I paid full price for a 20minute massage (suppose to be an hour) and was shown no remorse or accountability for the lost time. I get being late and being docked but this wasn't our fault. We were given the wrong time and fr ally I feel like we were scammed out of our money. We didn't stay for the chiropractic appointment at five as this whole experience was a waste of time and stressful. I'll be reporting this to the BBB and frankly this business needs to get its crap together. Use at own risk.

userReviewOnlyContent: I've been coming here for over The weekends are my least favorite time to visit because it's just too crowded. Good luck getting a pool float and you'll wait nearly Read less
userReviewContent:
8/27/2017Previous review
I've been coming here for over 25 years and have seen the ups and downs of this place. They are under with new management or ownership than last year when I came and so far it's better than before. This place is like an oasis away from it all. Mineral springs, wading/lounge pool, multiple hot tubs and spa treatments await you here. They serve alcohol and even put in a Starbucks. It's clean, and the locker room has you covered for shampoo, conditioner and lotion if you forget.

The weekends are my least favorite time to visit because it's just too crowded. Good luck getting a pool float and you'll wait nearly 30 minutes or more to get a drink. They reach maximum occupancy most weekends. They've done better dealing with the quantity of people but it's sill a long wait for most anything. Because of this. It's also hard to justify the cost to visit - $69 admission fee. The admission fee is just ridiculous. And if you don't book a $100 service like a massage or facial, , you're not guaranteed to get in. This is probably my last trip unless they have some super sensational deal. The drive coupled with no guarantees of getting in are a no win for me.

userReviewContent:
6/5/2018Updated review
 6 photos

 2 check-ins

Another fabulous trip to HIGH END SPA! Love the new addition in the back with rocking chairs under beautiful trees! This place is growing faster than it can hardly keep up with - went on a Monday thinking it won't be as crowded and wow! It felt like a weekend! I'm hoping they will expand kitchen and help as it takes about 40 minutes to wait in line around the lunch hour to get food. It's all prepared fresh though and I appreciate that.

Been going here for over 27 years. I've seen all the growth and change. It's been bumpy and they are ironing out the kinks. Love the new bar - prob could use another one on other end of spa. I understand they are talking expansion though and even building a resort. I only hope it doesn't take away the private feel of this place. The area inside Starbucks (long hallway) seems like wasted space. Hardly anyone in there. Food was good, try the fish tacos (although I think they told me shells were gluten free and I'm certain they are not) and so were the beverages. Overall a relaxing day and I'd recommend if you want to get away. Get there early to claim a spot- it can get crowded and they do hit max occupancy on holidays and some weekends. Get on email list to purchase gift card deals when they offer them- it's definitely the way to go and they don't expire I'm told.

MUD ME!

Who doesn't love a 'amusement park' of pools, mud, steam?! No Disney characters here, but plenty of room to try their different themed pools.

I love love love the mud area! Play in mud, bask in mud, swim off in mud pools!!! HEAVEN!

Plan for a Day here. There is plenty to do. Large locker room, dining, lazy pool, spa.

Leave your snacks at home bc they are not allowed. Starbucks also on-site for your coffee rush

userReviewOnlyContent: I have been bringing my 6 year old son in for adjustments because he was having migraines. We have been seeing a neurologist for years and have made life altering diet changes and yet haven't been able to figure out the cause of them. After going for treatment myself (such a life change!) i decided to have DOCTOR adjust my son. We found that his neck gets very tense and with regular adjustments, he doesn't get migraines!!! He was having them every 2 weeks consistently (for over 2 years). Since bringing him to DOCTOR, he has only had a couple because we went a bit too long between appointments! Such a relief for my momma heart to not need to resort to the crazy medications they wanted to put him on and to see him living life actively, the way a 6 year old boy should be! This office is incredible. The staff is so warm and caring and they are SO sweet to my kids when i have to bring them with me. After months of treatment i was hesitant to not go in as often because i truly enjoyed seeing them every few days! DOCTOR spends time listening and truly cares for his patients. I can't say enough great things about this office and the level of excellence they provide on all accounts.

8/27/2017Previous review
I've been coming here for over 25 years and have seen the ups and downs of this place. They are under with new management or ownership than last year when I came and so far it's better than before. This place is like an oasis away from it all. Mineral springs, wading/lounge pool, multiple hot tubs and spa treatments await you here. They serve alcohol and even put in a Starbucks. It's clean, and the locker room has you covered for shampoo, conditioner and lotion if you forget.

The weekends are my least favorite time to visit because it's just too crowded. Good luck getting a pool float and you'll wait nearly 30 minutes or more to get a drink. They reach maximum occupancy most weekends. They've done better dealing with the quantity of people but it's sill a long wait for most anything. Because of this. It's also hard to justify the cost to visit - $69 admission fee. The admission fee is just ridiculous. And if you don't book a $100 service like a massage or facial, , you're not guaranteed to get in. This is probably my last trip unless they have some super sensational deal. The drive coupled with no guarantees of getting in are a no win for me.

userReviewContent:
6/5/2018Updated review
 6 photos

 2 check-ins

Another fabulous trip to HIGH END SPA! Love the new addition in the back with rocking chairs under beautiful trees! This place is growing faster than it can hardly keep up with - went on a Monday thinking it won't be as crowded and wow! It felt like a weekend! I'm hoping they will expand kitchen and help as it takes about 40 minutes to wait in line around the lunch hour to get food. It's all prepared fresh though and I appreciate that.

Been going here for over 27 years. I've seen all the growth and change. It's been bumpy and they are ironing out the kinks. Love the new bar - prob could use another one on other end of spa. I understand they are talking expansion though and even building a resort. I only hope it doesn't take away the private feel of this place. The area inside Starbucks (long hallway) seems like wasted space. Hardly anyone in there. Food was good, try the fish tacos (although I think they told me shells were gluten free and I'm certain they are not) and so were the beverages. Overall a relaxing day and I'd recommend if you want to get away. Get there early to claim a spot- it can get crowded and they do hit max occupancy on holidays and some weekends. Get on email list to purchase gift card deals when they offer them- it's definitely the way to go and they don't expire I'm told.

userReviewOnlyContent: I came to DOCTOR Family Chiropractic after experiencing a few months of chronic sciatic pain. My primary care doctor took some X-rays and prescribed me a muscle relaxer, but I didn't feel like that was enough. I have had chiropractic care in the past, so it was just a matter of finding a new doctor. DOCTOR was highly reviewed and I made an appointment. From the first phone call I was treated professionally and kindly. The office is clean, inviting and full of state-of-the-art equipment. All of the office staff are friendly and DOCTOR is kind and caring. He took his time explaining my issues and his plan to help me find relief. He was realistic about my situation and didn't promise any miracles in an effort to gain my business. He was straightforward and encouraging. I have been receiving treatments for about one month and have had improvement in my pain. I have good and bad days, but I know things are improving and this makes me feel good about my decision to seek treatment with this office.

userReviewOnlyContent:
The doctor and staff were very nice and friendly. The office was very clean and organized.
I had an x-ray and consultation done and DOCTOR explained that he would make a plan to get me back on the right track. He said he would give me a roller and teach me exercises to do at home that would help.
When I retuned for my next visit I still did not receive that information. He sat me down and explained to me that he wanted me to go in 3-4 times per week to get adjusted. I explained to him that would not be realistic for me with my schedule, let alone my budget being a full time student. He said he couldn't discount his services because my insurance only pays him $1. I was not asking for a discount... just saying I can't afford to go that often
After that conversation, I feel like he totally gave up on me and wasn't interested in helping me. I was just very surprised and disappointed with my experience. I do not plan to return.

userReviewOnlyContent: Had sciatica pain, resulting in leg weakening.  Checked reviews for DOCTOR Family Chiropractic and decided to give it a go.  Smart decision.  DOCTOR X-rayed first, to identify what was going on.  Who does that in the chiropractic arena?  A smart doctor.  His consultation was clear, concise (love the marker drawings), and I could see the problem origin because of the X-rays. He laid out the treatment schedule, and after just 3 days, I already felt marked improvement.  At the end of the plan, he X-rayed again.  The X-rays confirmed what I already knew/felt - much better! I'm now on a maintenance program that will allow continued progress.  Also, an office staff will make or break any great doctor.  His is the best I have ever encountered!  They care, they're kind, and always have a smile for you.  Who "wants" to go to a doctor's office AND misses the office staff?  Me.  It's bizarre just saying that, but it's true.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I visited HIGH END SPA last Thursday and I loved it! I drove in from L.A. and stayed from about I learned about HIGH END SPA from a Vlog I watched and it was perfect for my stress-free day away from the busy city. My friend and I originally wanted to book the Wellness Package to get admission, the Grotto experience and a massage but when I called (and was on hold for a looong time) they said they were fully booked for the next few days so if you want a treatment, plan ahead! We ended up just buying the admission (teachers get My friend and I first reserved Club mud is where you get wet and spread this natural, brown clay/mud filled with minerals all over your body, you let it dry and then wash it off to exfoliate your skin. Then we did the Grotto experience which we were advised to do after club mud and shortly before leaving time. The Grotto is where you are escorted underground where a worker paints lotion on your skin (it feels and smells great), you sit in a hot cave, wash it off, and relax with tea, water and green apples.

My suggestions would be for HIGH END SPA to update their bathrooms so they are nicer as well as the showers in the locker rooms (there was a lot of hair on the floor in the shower which was gross).  They provide (flimsy) combs, lotion, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, blow dryers, unlimited towels, water and and q-tips. Providing some more bathroom items like hair ties/pony tails and more dryers for clothing would be nice.

All in all, it was a fabulous day of relaxation and n. I would definitely come again. In fact, I already bought my mom a Mother's Day gift card to try it out. Have a great time!!

userReviewContent:
5/5/2019
 2 photos

I visited HIGH END SPA last Thursday and I loved it! I drove in from L.A. and stayed from about 9am-7pm. There wasn't too long of a line when I got there and it went fast (security checks bags as you walk in). I would recommend bringing a dark colored swimsuit or one you wouldn't mind getting dirty (as the mud can do that), a cover-up/sweater for in between pools or for when it gets colder toward evening, a hairbrush if you plan to shower there (they provide combs but they are very flimsy), hairbands, a waterproof phone case or Ziploc bag for your phone, flip-flops, and an empty water bottle.

I learned about HIGH END SPA from a Vlog I watched and it was perfect for my stress-free day away from the busy city. My friend and I originally wanted to book the Wellness Package to get admission, the Grotto experience and a massage but when I called (and was on hold for a looong time) they said they were fully booked for the next few days so if you want a treatment, plan ahead! We ended up just buying the admission (teachers get 10% off) and the Grotto experience ($30). I recommend doing both if you don't get the package deal!!

My friend and I first reserved 2 lounge chairs by the lounging, shallow pool (the better lounge chairs get taken fast fyi) which has great beanbag chairs and rafts in it. You can drink, eat, read or just float away under the palm trees. We lounged in the sun, ate lunch and then I did an aqua-fitness class plus some laps in the lap pool. We went in the mineral Jacuzzi (which smells so bad but is supposed to be good for opening up your pores), the cold/hot experience pools, club mud (fun!) and finally the Grotto. Ask the workers when you check-in in what order to do things and they'll advise you (shout-out to Will who was great!!!). It wasn't too crowded when I was there but I'd definitely recommend coming on a weekday if you can as I can see how much more pleasant it is when it's not as crowded! There are lockers for your things so you can leave stuff in there all day and just tie the key on your swimsuit.

Club mud is where you get wet and spread this natural, brown clay/mud filled with minerals all over your body, you let it dry and then wash it off to exfoliate your skin. Then we did the Grotto experience which we were advised to do after club mud and shortly before leaving time. The Grotto is where you are escorted underground where a worker paints lotion on your skin (it feels and smells great), you sit in a hot cave, wash it off, and relax with tea, water and green apples.

My suggestions would be for HIGH END SPA to update their bathrooms so they are nicer as well as the showers in the locker rooms (there was a lot of hair on the floor in the shower which was gross).  They provide (flimsy) combs, lotion, shampoo, conditioner, body wash, blow dryers, unlimited towels, water and and q-tips. Providing some more bathroom items like hair ties/pony tails and more dryers for clothing would be nice.

All in all, it was a fabulous day of relaxation and n. I would definitely come again. In fact, I already bought my mom a Mother's Day gift card to try it out. Have a great time!!

userReviewOnlyContent: I have been going to DOCTOR since he opened, years ago. He and his staff make you feel right at home and are always attentive and friendly. He has way more methods of making anyone feel way better then other chiropractors I've been to. You will surely feel way better then when you first walked into the door. Besides analyzing how best to adjust you, and make the adjustment, he has an awesome digital decompression machine. This machine gently stretches out your spine or neck. Gravity has taken hold of my body and I have slipped discs and pinched nerves. With the aid of this machine and my adjustments, I am always amazed at how much better I feel. Much better quality of life. He also provides electrical stimulation and lazer treatments, if this is what will help you best. He has a water massage table and a regular massage table. Speaking of massages, he has an actual masseuse on staff who can really make you feel like a new person! Dr. Ali Sarvestani shares his office as well. He is a doctor in chiropractic and naturopathic medicine. This man can lead you to the oath of natural eating to avoid medications and maintain better health. He is amazing!

userReviewOnlyContent:
DOCTOR and all of his staff are the kind of people you wish were your family. They are warm, kind and truly care about your well-being.
I've been going to DOCTOR for over three years. I make the 40 minute drive from Pomona because I trust DOCTOR with my life. He will not every try to gauge you or perform treatments that are unnecessary. He is in this business to HEAL and HELP, not to get rich. DOCTOR gives chiropractors the good name they deserve. His office staff--Aurora, Eileen, Armando, and others--make everyone know they are welcome and appreciated.
The bottom line is that DOCTOR will find the source of your health problems and actually CURE them. Unlike most doctors, he doesn't throw pills at you that just mask symptoms or substitute one problem for another. Know that it might take some time--healing is often a process.
He also has a fabulous homeopathic doctor who works with him and focuses more on the biochemical aspects of health. This is Dr. Ali. Dr. Ali gets right to the source by looking at what's going on at the cellular level. He also won't gauge you. He just gets a ton of joy out of seeing people get better.
Your life will change for the better when you step through the doors of DOCTOR Family Chiropractic.
Veronica McKelvey

5/8/2018Hi Raven, thank you for taking the time to write a review of your recent visit. I am sorry to hear about your incident in the bath house at the end of your visit. userReviewOnlyContent:
What a wonderful way to start the year! This was my second time back to HIGH END SPA, and we had a great time. The crowds were very low (seriously, it felt like we had the place to ourselves most of the day.) We walked right into the mineral baths, club mud, and didn't wait in any kind of line for lunch. None of the pools were crowded, and we were even able to enjoy one of the hammocks in the secret garden.

Tiffany at the front check-in desk went above and beyond for us regarding the robes. I had requested a plus-sized robe, since after my last review I knew they had added some to their collection. Unfortunately, all of their plus-sized robes were still dirty from the day before. Tiffany was so accommodating, though! She was able to get us robes from the cabana area that fit me perfectly! It is so great to know that not only do they now offer guests of all sizes the option to enjoy a warm robe, but that they really want to make sure you have a good day. Thank you, Tiffany, for everything.

All of the staff today were in good spirits. The only thing that would have made today better would have been a massage. We'll have to book one next time. My husband and I are going to make HIGH END SPA our annual New Year's Day tradition!

Alexa Gallegos

userReviewOnlyContent:
Love this place for my massage. The front desk could seem a little more enthusiastic, but they are very calm, patient, helpful, and courteous... They just seem like... They work at a spa! Hahaha a little too laid back, if that makes sense. Anyway, still great service.

My husband and i started coming here for neck, shoulders and back relief.  We're new parents and carrying a baby around all day every day starts to cause a build up of knots.  We've tried different therapists and have enjoyed them all.  The two we usually see are Julliard and Autumn, but all have been great.

The chiropractors are also very patient and kind. I've never had an adjustment before coming here so Dr. Ramisar (sorry if mispelled) took the time to explain what he was going to do and patiently instructed me on how to position myself for the adjustment. It made the experience much more comfortable for me, a newbie to Chiropractice care.

I just enjoyed an hour neck and shoulder massage yesterday morning with Julliard and it was a little painful, not going to lie... But thats because of my really bad knots.  Afterwards, i felt like a million bucks. I was literally singing and skipping around taking care of errands like i just won a billion bucks.

And before you say $35/hr is too much, that you'd rather get a $10 massage at the mall... Really think about it first.  1) consider this a treatment and not a back rub - why wouldnt u want a licensed professional, in a clean clinical setting. And 2) check ur insurance Chiro plan - $10 copay, then Kaiser covers the massage if I get an adjustment the same day! =))

From the moment I walked in to the moment I walked out, I was always greeted with a smile.  This place was recommended to me by my coach at the gym.  I pulled a muscle by my neck/shoulder, and needed to do something asap because it was killing me.  My coach suggested that I see Dr.  , and I did.  Given that this was my first time at a chiropractor's office, I wasn't quite sure what I was getting myself in to.  But, I trusted what my coach told me, so I went with his suggestion.

No regrets whatsoever.  DOCTOR was very informative and nice.  He told me what to expect and to assure me that the cracking sounds I heard were normal lol.  I feel awesome and already have a next scheduled appointment for next week.  If you're in the Corona area and looking for a chiropractic or acupuncture spot, this IS the spot.

userReviewOnlyContent:
I never thought I would ever go to a chiropractor. To be honest I was scared of getting my neck and back adjusted. I had heard horror stories from other people and online and just never thought I would need to seek this type of help.

About two months ago I started having chronic migraine tension headaches, I have had bad reactions to a few medications and the ones I haven't either treat one one and not the other. The chronic pain in my head has caused my anxiety to be uncontrollable and for my life to be crippled, I wasn't able to even do things around the house.

A friend suffering from the same thing tried DOCTORs office and it helped her, so I decided to try it. Tomorrow will be my fourth adjustment. DOCTOR and his staff are wonderful. I am no longer having multiple migraines a week and my tension pain is slowly decreasing. He takes into account what type of pain I'm in and where I have been sore prior to adjusting me. The pricing is so affordable especially for those like me whose insurance don't cover the cost! I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND to anyone!
